story:
HELP US REACH WIDER AUDIENCES!

The Coalition Zine is a digital collective dedicated to putting girls of colour on the map by showcasing female writers, artists, and creators of colour on a monthly basis. The zine was created as a space dedicated solely to girls of colour, a  space where we can share our traumas, opinions, and triumphs with each other and grow together collectively. 

We, unfortunately, will not be able to be able to make it to Afropunk due to close deadlines. We were told about the opportunity at a late time so it is understandable. However, with whatever amount we make we hope to still be able to print enough zine copies to sell and distribute on our storevenvy, local bookstores, galleries, etc. We are trying to get the zine out to promote the message that girls of colour are worth it and are innovative and intelligent in a world that tells them otherwise.

Any donation, big or small will be appreciated. Thank you so much for supporting us.

CHECK OUT OUR BLOG AND OUR CURRENT ISSUE IF YOU WANT TO KNOW MORE ABOUT US AND OUR MISSION

CONTACT THE FOUNDER FOR ANY QUESTIONS/COMMENTS/ETC OR EMAIL US AT MSGTHECOALITION@GMAIL.COM

THANK YOU SO MUCH FOR YOUR SUPPORT, WE GREATLY APPRECIATE IT!

story:
Why we should give others without a fear? Because it´s returning back in bigger to you. Every contribution can make a change, even the smallest and it will hit you 10times more. We are creating our realities. 

This campaign is not about me, it´s about the mission. I invested all money I had to my current photographic tool pack but it´s not enough. I know what I have to do to continue professionally. Buy a new camera. But the slice is just too big for me. So I´ve made this campaign. And I believe in it. 

Thank you :) 

WHO

My name is Maria and Im a student of International Relations in Slovakia, Central Europe. I´ve bought  my first DSLR camera one year ago and I really didn´t expect how it´s going to change my life. I always loved taking pictures, even as a child. But so many people have the same hobby. So what´s the difference?

My real „photographic journey“ started just one year ago after I´ve bought my first DSLR. It had opened my eyes and I realised the real art of photography is about. I started to be fascinated by other photographers work, portraits and photo manipulations. I couldn´t stop myself until I reached similar outputs. It was crazy! I wanted it so much that I was dreaming about that, I was studying it on my own and falling asleep with thoughts about „how the hell could I do that awesome effect?“.

I´ve learned how to create levitating portraits or fairytale looking images, how to color photos correctly, how to work with light better, how to take care of the technical aspects etc. I´ve learned a lot but there is still lot of to learn. And now I´m here.

WHY

This campaign is my ask for a help. If I should describe why it is important for me I would say that my life depends on it. My biggest dream is to work with professional models and bring artistic fashion photos into magazines. With the new camera I can continue my passion and you´d help me to step into the world of real opportunities. But with my current camera it´s hard to imagine that I could get professional job. You can have all the talent of world, but without a professional-grade camera, you will never get truly professional output.

To fulfill my dream working with models, agencies and companies, it´s absolutely vital to have professional output - professional camera. It all raises and falls on this point.

WHAT do I need

My biggest need is to upgrade my photographic gear, but the gear is too expensive for me. Only with the help of others I can get this really basic professional tool pack.

·  Full frame camera Canon 5D Mark III – 2600 €

·  Canon 24-105m f/4L USM lens – 750 €

·  Canon BG-E11 Battery grip -280 €

·  SanDisk CF Extreme 32 GB – 45 €

·  New laptop with reliable screen and adequate power for photo editing (mine is too old and slow – slower than my smartphone Samsung S3 Neo) – MacBook Pro 13 – 1200 €

Now I´m working with older Canon 600D and few lenses. The biggest difference between my camera and the Canon 5D is in their sensors (APS-C vs. Full frame) and so in outputs of these two. For professional work it´s absolutely necessary to work with full frame, but my current situation doesn´t allow me to make this on my own. So I decided to try INDIEGOGO and ask somebody who can (and want), to help me.

PERKS

My offer is sort of special. Unfortunately I´m not creating any photobook or calendar and I´m not going to make the journey abroad full of adventure I could share with you later, BUT, during my photographic journey I´ve created unrealistic fairytale manipulations expressing my deepest thoughts and personal stories. Most of these pictures I was preparing long weeks before I created them. Usually images consist from more than 10 single shots and dozens of other layers. Sometimes it takes weeks from planning to realization and hours of graphic work to bring it to the life. Now Im offering this PACK of my deepest ideas and the best photo manipulations I did for you.

How it can be valuable for you?

Manipulations are offered for non-commercial purposes:

·  Decoration for your home/Office/whatever (for example printed on canvas)

·  Painting - It´s really, really awesome to have it printed on canvas at home!

·  Gift – (as a painting, printed on T-shirt, pillow etc.)

·  Wallpapers

·  Blogs

For commercial purposes please, contact me personally (on mary.zet.mazuchova@gmail.com or on my FB page)

2 € - Good energy will hit you back! Thank you! :)

10 € - Download of the whole PACK (10 highest quality images).

20 € - Download of the whole PACK + You´ll get original postcard with the photomanipulation (shipping and printing of the postcard included).

100 € and more - Download of the whole PACK + Postcard + 1x photo manipulation printed on 60x45cm canvas with my signature. Shipping not included. 

WARNING – reselling of these images is strictly forbidden. You can use my work for your personal but you can not to take it and sell as it was yours.


WHAT IF I will not reach my goal?

Even if my goal was not reached, I will find the way how to continue. I will buy some used older model of Canon 5D and cheap computer to get by till I´ll be able to afford new gear, but for this I also need some basic help from others.

OTHER WAYS You Can Help Me

Please SHARE!

Send me good energy ;)

FIND ME ON

FACEBOOK https://www.facebook.com/MariaMazuchPhotography

FLICKR https://www.flickr.com/photos/127739273@N02/

500PX https://500px.com/mariamazuch

story: This company is truly a childhood dream come true. We are bringing together our love of dance, personal growth, and healing to create a piece of Performance Art in Boulder, Colorado. We are seeking support in funding our project, so that all participants can receive this gift and give it back to our community. Funds will help pay for the beautiful rehearsal studios we have chosen to rent and necessary materials for our performance. We are grateful for any donation that will allow this project to reach it's highest potential.

We are seeking support in funding our project, so that all participants can receive this gift and give it back to our community. Funds will help pay for the beautiful rehearsal studios we have chosen to rent and necessary materials for our performance. We are grateful for any donation that will allow this project to reach it's highest potential.

story:
In Brief

Big data has dramatically changed our society and mostly in positive ways, but security and privacy measures lag far behind the cutting edge resources we take for granted. Search engines, social networks, email, and so on may seem free--and monetarily they are--but for each service the true cost is data. We sacrifice vast amounts of highly personal information in exchange for technologies that become increasingly ingrained in our habits, mindsets, and daily lives. Big data poses big risks, and in America today there is a unique confluence of economic, political, and social circumstances that make big data one of the most important issues facing our country. Data and Power aims to raise awareness and inspire public discussion--join me, join us, and together let's create a better America.

How You Can Help

To make Data and Power a reality, I need your help. I hope to raise $2,015 (a fitting sum!) with your support, and I will match all donations up to $1,500. Awareness, not profit, is the goal of this project. I will dedicate as much time, energy, and money as possible to making this book and community effort successful. 

Please raise awareness for this campaign and project and share this campaign with your peers, friends, and family. Your support is sincerely appreciated and essential to the success of Data and Power!

Funding

Funds will be used to publish Data and Power by self-publishing methods. Self-publishing has many advantages. Though traditional publishing generally takes between 6 and 18 months, self-publishing can be done much more quickly, which is especially important for a highly time-sensitive issue like big data in present-day America. Self-publishing is also highly flexible, allowing me to continually revise the book's content in light of future events. After thorough consideration and research of many companies, I have chosen Infinity Publishing and plan to purchase the following publishing packages, for a total of $1,127:

  • manuscript evaluation: $179
  • softcover print publishing: $599
  • eBook publishing: $349
The manuscript evaluation gives detailed critiques and typographical edits from a professional editor and will ensure that Data and Power is ready for the main stage. By publishing both in print and through eBooks, I hope to reach a wider audience and reflect the changing culture of readers. A January 2014 Pew Research poll showed that 50% of Americans over 18 have an e-reader or tablet: http://www.pewinternet.org/2014/01/16/e-reading-rises-as-device-ownership-jumps/.
In addition, I plan to purchase a marketing package:
  • publicity campaign: $2,000
Through this publicity campaign, Infinity Publishing will provide significant professional help to ensure that Data and Power will reach a large number of targeted media outlets and potential customers. The many resources I have consulted have stressed that marketing is especially important to a book's success, so I believe such a package is essential to this project.

Financial Summary

Donations will be used for specific and critical aspects of the project. If this campaign is successful in raising $2,015, I will have $1,805.60 to spend assuming all paperback copies are claimed (the difference is the cost of buying and shipping the copies). As stated above, I will also contribute $1,500 of my own money for a total of $3,305.60 in funds. I plan to spend this money as follows:

  • publishing costs: $1,127 (see breakdown above)
  • marketing costs: $2,000 (publicity campaign)
  • website cost: $158.90 ($149 for website yearly plan, $9.90 for domain name registration)
Therefore, my total expected costs are $3,285.90, with $19.70 remaining for small unforeseen costs or shipping cost changes. I will cover any other unexpected costs with my own money--I hope my commitment to this project, both in money and in effort, will reassure you that Data and Power is a project well worth supporting.
I will also cover any Indiegogo fees at the close of the campaign (4% if the goal is reached). 

Challenges

I value transparency very highly and so I do not hesitate to acknowledge the many significant challenges involved in this project. I overcame many obstacles even before launching this campaign: conducting rigorous research, forming a thesis, writing a book, filming a video, and the list goes on and on. Still, many challenges remain:

  • finalizing Data and Power (additional editing, updating material with current events if necessary)
  • publishing (cover design, formatting)
  • finishing painting for cover image (see website for details)
  • generating interest in the project and sales for the book
If you are reading this, thank you for your interest. This project has proven difficult and involved, but I hope to convince you that I am capable of bringing it to full fruition. I am someone who enjoys taking on difficult tasks and above all, I am willing to work tirelessly to make Data and Power a reality. 

About Me

I am a student at Stanford University interested in a wide range of topics. Outside of academics, I enjoy golf, tennis, good food, and spending time with my family. To give you a sense of my background, here is a brief resumé:

  • “America’s Top Young Scientist” 2010: $25,000 grand prize winner of the Discovery Education 3M Young Scientist Challenge

  • Veterans of Foreign Wars Voice of Democracy Essay Contest: First Place in Wisconsin 2013 ($1,750 scholarship), Fifteenth Place nationally 2013 ($2,000 scholarship), Second Place in Wisconsin 2012 ($1,500 scholarship)

  • National Merit Scholar ($2,500 scholarship)

  • Brookfield Academy Five Star Merit Distinguished Scholar Award (scholarship of $7,000 per year for four years)

  • Cum Laude Society Inductee

  • composer of two orchestral works, which were premiered by the Milwaukee Youth Symphony Orchestra in 2010 and 2014

  • Mock Trial Team: varsity leader, Regional Champions 2012-2014, Second in State 2013, Best Attorney award 2013

  • college acceptances to Stanford University and Harvard University

I hope the list above assures you that I passionately pursue my interests and will dedicate myself fully to each and every task. In asking for your money and support in this campaign, I want you to be confident that I am ready to complete this project efficiently and effectively. 

Impact

Why does Data and Power matter? Why is big data so important to the future of America? What's the point?

Big data has great power for good, but with great power comes great danger. Because of big data's shocking ubiquity and the apparent lack of public awareness about its more troubling consequences, this danger is a real threat. Increasingly, we become accustomed to sharing highly personal information with unknown third parties. 

The confluence of big data, economic inequality, changes in campaign finance law, and lack of awareness is causing a concentration of power in the hands of the few, and the American public is at risk. Data and Power is my passionate attempt to inform and inspire our country to seriously consider the realities of an ever more technological world.

As a member of the young generation affected most, I am especially concerned. We have never known a world without cell phones, computers, and the Internet. We have never known a world in which it seemed risky to send a credit card number over the World Wide Web. Our world has a bright future, and one in which big data plays an essential role, but we must be aware of its dangers and we must demand of our government and corporate leaders transparency, security, and privacy. We must work together, as a connected people, and use big data itself to craft a prosperous future. Are you with me? Let's change the world.

story:
The Story Behind Spitshine

UT Spitshine Poetry is a student organization led and co-founded by Ariana Brown and Zachary Caballero since Fall 2011. Since then, our organization has grown into a community of writers committed to sustaining and promoting the art of spoken word poetry. We host weekly writing and performance workshops as well as monthly open mics and poetry slams in order to provide a safe and open space for anyone who has a story to share. 

In 2013, UT Spitshine made history by sending the first-ever slam team to represent the University of Texas at Austin at the College Union Poetry Slam Invitational in New York City. We returned to Texas ranked as the 18th overall best college slam team and winners of the Spirit of the Slam Award. 

In 2014, UT Spitshine placed #1 in the nation at the College Union Poetry Slam Invitational held at the University of Colorado at Boulder! UT Spitshine also took home multiple other awards such as 'Best Choreography', 'Best Poet', and "Best Group Poem".

In 2015, UT Spitshine placed #13 in the nation at the College Union Poetry Slam Invitational held at Virginia Commonwealth University at Richmond, VA. UT Spitshine also took home multiple awards such as 'Best Writing By a Team', 'Head-to-head Haiku Slam Champion', 'Best Poem', and 'Best of the Rest'.

 This year, UT Spitshine seeks to make history again as we prepare for the 2016 College Union Poetry Slam Invitational, hosted by the University of Texas at Austin. This year, Spitshine will be represented by Jasmine Bell, Ariana Brown, Adam Hamze, Arati Warrier, and Joshua Nguyen and will be coached by Sam Sax

It Takes a Village (What We Need From YOU!)

While the undying support from friends and family nourish the spirit of Spitshine, in order to get to compete in CUPSI 2016, we have thirty days to fund-raise $2000. These funds will cover expenses for five poets and one coaches, and include:

  • Lodging
  • Registration Fees
  • Food Stipends
  • Coaching fees

Free Ways to Help and Be Awesome!

We know that not everyone who wants to donate can, but that doesn't mean you can't help Spitshine with their journey to CUPSI '16! Help our fundraiser go viral and raise awareness for our cause by sharing this page through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and any other social media platform. Tell your family and friends continue to make us help history!

Thanks for being part of our village,

Spitshine Poetry.

We host weekly writing and performance workshops as well as monthly open mics and poetry slams in order to provide a safe and open space for anyone who has a story to share. In 2013, UT Spitshine made history by sending the first-ever slam team to represent the University of Texas at Austin at the College Union Poetry Slam Invitational in New York City. We returned to Texas ranked as the 18th overall best college slam team and winners of the Spirit of the Slam Award. In 2014, UT Spitshine placed #1 in the nation at the College Union Poetry Slam Invitational held at the University of Colorado at Boulder! UT Spitshine also took home multiple other awards such as 'Best Choreography', 'Best Poet', and "Best Group Poem".In 2015, UT Spitshine placed #13 in the nation at the College Union Poetry Slam Invitational held at Virginia Commonwealth University at Richmond, VA. UT Spitshine also took home multiple awards such as 'Best Writing By a Team', 'Head-to-head Haiku Slam Champion', 'Best Poem', and 'Best of the Rest'. This year, UT Spitshine seeks to make history again as we prepare for the 2016 College Union Poetry Slam Invitational, hosted by the University of Texas at Austin. This year, Spitshine will be represented by Jasmine Bell, Ariana Brown, Adam Hamze, Arati Warrier, and Joshua Nguyen and will be coached by Sam SaxIt Takes a Village (What We Need From YOU!)While the undying support from friends and family nourish the spirit of Spitshine, in order to get to compete in CUPSI 2016, we have thirty days to fund-raise $2000. These funds will cover expenses for five poets and one coaches, and include:
Lodging
Registration Fees
Food Stipends
Coaching fees
Free Ways to Help and Be Awesome!We know that not everyone who wants to donate can, but that doesn't mean you can't help Spitshine with their journey to CUPSI '16! Help our fundraiser go viral and raise awareness for our cause by sharing this page through Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and any other social media platform. Tell your family and friends continue to make us help history!Thanks for being part of our village,Spitshine Poetry.

story:
About Me

Photo by Verónica Gonzalez Mayoral

The Short Version: I'm an artist living and working in Brooklyn. I'm also a freelance graphic designer, teacher, curator, writer, cat whisperer, amateur chef, amateur astrologer, and lover of hiking, camping, scary movies, and good bourbon. 

More: I'm originally from East Texas and have been in New York City for about ten years. In that time have had a ton of amazing opportunities from curating and exhibiting to teaching and writing about art for The Coastal Post. In the past I have had the good fortune to be awarded residencies at The Wassaic Project and also the School of Visual Arts. I have also exhibited in venues across New York City and beyond including Tiger Strikes Asteroid NY, Automat Gallery, Lorimoto Gallery, Pratt Institute, and most recently Untitled Art, Miami. I have also taught at Pratt Institute, Hofstra University and Borough of Manhattan Community College. My work has been in the flat files at TSA New York and Morgan Lehman Gallery and can also be found in the University of Texas at Tyler permanent collection and the Fidelity Mutual Corporate collection as well as personal collections across the U.S. and beyond. Additionally, I am represented by Spotte Art.

You can find more of my work here: jenshepardart.com

What My Art is About

My current body of work focuses on imaginary landscapes. Drawing inspiration from discoveries in quantum physics, space exploration, and the mysteries of the spiritual and unseen universe, I seek to explore the notion of what is real verses what is not real and invite the viewer to enter a new world. I make full sized installations and also drawings and paintings. At VSC I hope to continue to make some small objects for my "worlds" and also some larger works on paper.

Above: Me in front of my installation at the Wassaic Summer Exhibition, Vagabond Timekillers exhibition (photo by Walker Esner)/ work in progress during my residency at The Wassaic Project in September of 2018 (photo by Verónica Gonzalez Mayoral).

 

About Vermont Studio Center

The Vermont Studio Center is an artists' residency situated along the banks of the Gihon River in the historic village of Johnson, Vermont. It is the largest international artists' and writers' residency program in the United States. It's highly competitive and offers extensive facilities including a full printmaking studio, photography studio, sculpture studio, mediation houses, and a yoga studio. In addition VSC offers a large community of artists and writers, and all meals and room and board are included.

 

What is a Residency?

An artist's residency is a of a retreat for artists where they are offered time and space away from their daily lives to focus on their work. Residencies such as VSC offer studio space (much larger than my usual), community, and additional facilities and technical support that are hard to come by in the "real" world. Residencies are an important space where artists can take time to focus on their work and make strides that are not always possible in your daily life.

 

Why I Need Your Help

Although VSC has generously offered me both a merit grant and a work study scholarship, the remainder of the fee for my room and board + studio + facilities is $2300. To be honest this is far less than I spend on rent, food, and studio in New York City, so it's a great deal. However, my acceptance to VSC comes at a very unexpected time. I originally applied for a spring or summer residency but had listed January as a 3rd option. 

I am being offered the residency at a time that comes right on the heals of my last residency at The Wassaic Project, where I have been an artist and residence twice (once in 2016 and once this September).

Having spent a good portion of my savings there and having come back to a slower than usual pace with freelance work, this opportunity comes at a very awkward time financially.

However, due to the competitive nature of the program, and due to the immense benefit I hope to gain from the experience, I feel it is an opportunity I cannot pass up. Also, I am soon planning to leave the freelance world for the full time work force for awhile, so this may be my last opportunity to take a residency for a few years at least.

In addition to the cost of the residency itself, I need to raise additional funds to help pay bills while I'm away (although I plan to offset that cost partially by subletting my apartment). I also need to pay for art supplies and travel. So I am hoping to raise an addition $500 for art supplies, i.e. paper, paint, canvas, epoxy clay, and another $600 for additional bills and $200 for my flight to Vermont.

So the total I am hoping to raise is $3600 by January 6th.

Any additional funds will be gratefully accepted in order to make even more work!

While I am there I plan to make a new body of works on paper, experiment with some printmaking/etching, and also create a new body of small sculptures, including rainbow babies and other celestial bodies.

Age of Aquarius, 50" x 34," 2017, acrylic, gouache, spray paint, graphite on paper

 

Benefits I Hope to Gain From The Residency

One of the main benefits of a residency such as this is just having the time and head space to think and to come up with new ideas. New York City is always an exciting yet draining mad rush of socializing, working, commuting and generally running around. So having the space to get away and think and make your work is very important. Additionally, my tiny space in New York City is only 100 square feet, while the studios at Vermont Studio Center are as large as 300 square feet. Having more space to spread out and really step back from the work is immensely helpful. In fact the first time I attended The Wassaic Project my practice grew to include installation and sculpture on a scale I had never created before.

Space Capades, 50" x 36," 2018, acrylic, gouache, graphite, spray paint on paper

 

What's Different From Other Residencies I've Done?

This program has additional facilities and technical support for a number of mediums. It also has fully prepared and paid meals, so I will have one less thing to worry about outside of making work. It is also a larger program, so I will have an opportunity to connect with a much wider group of artists and also writers, as they have a writing program as well. Also, it's in the mountains of Vermont! So will be a different and exciting area for me to be inspired by.

My installation at the Pratt Alumni Exhibition, 2017

 

What You Get For Helping

For helping you get:

• My undying gratitude

• A pass for ever buying me a Christmas or birthday gift if you know me ;+)

• The solace of knowing that you helped an artist who is hustling make some weird stuff!!

Just kidding! That's definitely not all!

You can also get a small drawing on paper or a small sculpture!!!! :+D

 

*See PERKS section* ------>

 

Some examples of my work:

A "Baby Rainbow" sculpture Fiona, 2018, acrylic and gouache on epoxy clay and paper machê

 

Ruthie Under the Sea, 50" x 36," 2018, acrylic, gouache, spray paint and graphite on paper

Below: Installation shots from my 2-person exhibition with Daniel Weiner The Devil and the Deep Blue Sea, Automat Gallery (hosted by Spillway Collective), Philadelphia, PA

story:
The Softest Blanket in all of Dingledörf

This SCAD senior film is the brain child of director Xan Poulsen. It includes 2D, 3D and stop motion animation. Follow the baby king on his journey to find the softest blanket in all of Dingledörf. Though his actions may be cruel, the right blanky might just turn that frown upside down. 

  • A team of 10 students worked day and night for 10 weeks to build this set 
  • 2 of which worked another 10 weeks to animate the scene (20 weeks total)
  • Supplies were bought out if pocket and expenses were shared across the film crew 
  • The film will premier end of may 2021

What We Need & What You Get

If you would like to see our film please donate. 

  • All money donated will go to the stop motion team to reimburse them for set materials such as; wood, wool, wire, plaster ect.
  • The film is almost complete! If you donate, you’ll receive exclusive behind the scenes set footage and bloopers from our past year of animation. 

The Impact

We hope to reach our goal of $3000 by the time our film is released. That way you can see what your contribution went towards. 

  • You can see our movie and be proud of what your donation has done. 
  • You’ve become a philanthropist taking interest in the arts.
  • Our film is kid friendly and can be viewed by your whole family!

Risks & Challenges

  • It has been difficult for students to pay out of pocket for these expensive set materials. Each prop was made by hand and designed entirely by one class.
  • Now that the film is being released, many students are graduating and going into their respective fields of work. The additional debt from this project will take a toll on individual finances.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate there is still a big way you can help..

  • Share our indiegogo on Facebook or among friends. 

And that's all there is to it.

2 of which worked another 10 weeks to animate the scene (20 weeks total)
Supplies were bought out if pocket and expenses were shared across the film crew 
The film will premier end of may 2021

All money donated will go to the stop motion team to reimburse them for set materials such as; wood, wool, wire, plaster ect.
The film is almost complete! If you donate, you’ll receive exclusive behind the scenes set footage and bloopers from our past year of animation.

We hope to reach our goal of $3000 by the time our film is released. That way you can see what your contribution went towards.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to donate there is still a big way you can help..
Share our indiegogo on Facebook or among friends. 
And that's all there is to it.

story:
WHO ARE YOU? AND WHO IS THIS Lil' Reaper?

Hiya! My name is Vikram Madan and I am an award-winning visual artist and author from Seattle, WA specializing in humor and whimsy! (In other words no one takes my art too seriously, which is just fine with me!)

Lil' Reaper (aka Lil' Grim Reaper) is one of my most popular creations and star of many paintings and an entire art book.      

WHAT ARE YOU MAKING?

This project will fund the making of 'Carpe Diem' (i.e. 'Seize the Day') coins featuring my Lil' Grim Reaper character.  These ReaperCoins(tm)  can serve as game tokens, talismans, place markers, golf markers, good luck charms, challenge coins, decision-making coins (yes, flip 'em: heads or tails?), memento mori and also as an immensely-valuable currency in a post-apocalyptic zombie-overrun world! (Take that BitCoin!)  

 

WHY ARE YOU MAKING THIS?

Remember back when we didn't have a pandemic and we took everything for granted? 

COVID-19 has taught us that we should not have put off till tomorrow the things we could have done yesterday: e.g. the trips not taken, the experiences not had, the projects not started, the moments (and lives) that will never be the same...

My Lil' Reaper character is a whimsical reminder for living a better life by acknowledging that all things are finite. The pandemic is making me feel preachy and I want to use Lil' Reaper to beat people on the head .. sorry I mean, to impart the message that we should all live well today, and not wait for tomorrow (because, as 2020 is showing us, who knows what tomorrow brings)... 

In response to the pandemic, I will create these Lil' Reaper coins for you to keep in your pocket, purse, accessory, desk, or hand to remind you to SEIZE THE DAY everyday and to live mindfully in the present...      

WHAT WILL THE COINS LOOK LIKE?

The coins will feature original hand-drawn art on both sides. There are three different coins.

This is the design for the first Lil' Reaper coin ('Raven Coin'). It has a Reaper with an Hour-glass on the front and a Raven on the back:

 

I had a few coins made to confirm that the design can be translated to metal, and to my delight, it translates very, very well:            

This is the design of the second Lil' Reaper coin ('Mayan Coin'). It has a Reaper Running on the front, and a design inspired by the Mayan Calendar on the back. 

 

This is the design of the third Lil' Reaper Coin ('Phoenix Coin'). It has a Reaper with a Balloon on the front, and a Phoenix on the back.

       

WHAT ARE THE COIN SPECIFICATIONS?

The coins will be made from a copper-zinc alloy (ok, it's really brass but copper-zinc sounds more esoteric, right? ;) ...) with an antique gold plating (sadly no real gold involved). Each coin is 3.8 cm (1.5 inches for the metrically challenged) in diameter, 3 mm (0.12 inches) thick, and weighs 26 grams (0.9 ounces). The coins have a nice hefty feel whether you hold them in your hand or clench them tightly inside your pocket any time you are panicking about something.... 

Quick - look how puny a standard U.S. Quarter coin looks compared to these magnificent specimens:  

 

IS THERE ANY SYMBOLISM IN THE COIN ART?

Gee, and I thought you were never going to ask:       

 

WHAT IS THE PROJECT TIMELINE?

The coins are already designed so it's just a matter of taking your pledges and laughing all the way to the bank... I mean getting the coins made and shipped etc.

In general it will take 1-2 months for your reward items to ship. Indiegogo releases funds periodically, after which manufacturing orders are placed in batches. Shipping happens after I receive my items from the manufacturers. This is a non-linear process. Sometimes rewards may ship sooner if there is excess stock at hand. Sometimes rewards may ship later if fresh manufacturing orders have to be placed, based on number of pledges made. 

 

WHAT ARE THE PROJECT REWARDS?

$1 PLEDGE & UP: You get my heartfelt thanks and your name will be listed in my website blog as a project backer.  

 

$10 PLEDGE & UP: In addition the above, thanks to the success of this campaign so far, I am able to unlock the following rewards to all pledges $10 & Up: FOUR Lil' Reaper 4"x6" Mini-Prints and THREE Lil' Reaper High-Quality Vinyl Stickers (suitable for indoor and outdoor use):

 

$20 PLEDGE & UP: In addition the above, receive 1 Lil' Reaper coin of your choice:

Every coin comes in it's own drawstring pouch:

 

$36 PLEDGE & UP: In addition the above, receive a second Lil' Reaper coin of your choice:

 

$53 PLEDGE & UP: In addition the above, receive a third Lil' Reaper coin of your choice:

 

$100 PLEDGE: In addition to the above, receive a fourth coin of your choice, as well as an original 7"x10" B&W Pen & Ink Lil' Reaper Drawing on Mixed Media Paper similar to the one shown below:     

 

HOW DO WE KNOW YOU CAN PULL THIS OFF?

If you visit my online store at http://www.ArtByVikram.com you will see that I have consistent, glowing 5-star reviews for the quality of my work and the customer experience I provide. I have plenty of shipping and fulfillment experience as my store carries all kinds of art-related merchandise including prints, magnets, buttons, postcards, notecards, playing cards, puzzles and more. 

 

I GOT HERE LATE AND MISSED THE ENTIRE CAMPAIGN! CAN I STILL GET THE COINS?

Yes, of course! Once this campaign is over, coins will be available from www.LilReaper.com - however the extra goodies (like stickers and mini-prints) are currently only available as part of this campaign. 

 

ARE THERE ANY PROJECT RISKS?

  • If the campaign is too successful, it may take longer to ship the items due to logistics and manufacturing.
  • The ongoing pandemic may delay manufacturing and shipping. 
  • The design with the Mayan Calendar may end up being too intricate to mint into a coin. We won't know till we mint them. 

 

CAN I SEE SOME MORE OF YOUR ART?

But of course: Paintings Books Instagram Facebook Prints Originals - Please do follow my art on social media @ArtByVikram.

And lastly, here are some more Lil' Reaper images, just for fun, also available as prints from www.LilReaper.com:

The ongoing pandemic may delay manufacturing and shipping. 
The design with the Mayan Calendar may end up being too intricate to mint into a coin. We won't know till we mint them. 
 CAN I SEE SOME MORE OF YOUR ART?But of course: Paintings Books Instagram Facebook Prints Originals - Please do follow my art on social media @ArtByVikram.And lastly, here are some more Lil' Reaper images, just for fun, also available as prints from www.LilReaper.com:

story:
It Started With One Pot

For the past 5 years, I have been dyeing and selling yarn.  I started in my kitchen with one small pot and have grown to the back deck, using propane burners and 62 quart pots.  My name is Melissa, I am A Tree Hugger's Wife from Juneau, Alaska and I need your help to make my dyeing process more efficient and take it to the next level of productivity. 

In order to keep the shops that I sell to stocked, I need to have a dye studio that is not outside in the elements, where I can store all my supplies in one space and I have access to water and sewer without hauling buckets.  


I am personally investing in my expansion plan by working with an architect, a structural engineer and contractors to have a studio built.  I need your help to purchase the equipment that will make my process more efficient and increase production.  

What I Need & What You Get

What I need and their cost:

  • Skeiner to wind yarn from cones:  $805
  • Proofing Cabinet:  $900
  • Propane Cylinder:  $200
  • Ventilation system and installation labor:  $2500
  • Stainless Steel 62 Quart dye pots (quantity of 3 at $100 each):  $300
  • Propane Burners:  $300
  • Stainless Steel work tables (quantity of 3 at $300 each):  $900
  • Stainless Steel Sink and faucet hardware:  $850
  • Stainless Steel Shelving Racks (quantity of 4 at $70 each): $280
  • Electronic Scale:  $50
  • Heavy Duty Yarn Swifts (quantity of 2 at $525 each):  $1050
  • Consumable Supplies:  $1000
  • Drying Racks:  $500
  • Sheet pans for dyeing with proofing cabinet (quantity of 12):  $145
Total funding for everything I need would be fantastic but I feel that I have set a realistic goal of $7500 to be able to purchase the bulk of what I need to get me going in the next direction of efficient production.    
Due to the nature of hand dyeing dyeing with high acidity, I need high quality equipment that will not stain or rust or corrode.  In the past, I have used the readily available aluminum pots that I can buy locally.  Unfortunately, they do not last with the acid that I use and eventually develop pinholes, which then allows the dye bath to drip onto the propane burner and corrode it too.  Investing in high quality equipment will decrease the amount of times I have to replace things.  
The other obstacle I have is that there is a shortage of used equipment in our town, add that to the fact that you can not drive out of Juneau so we have to ship everything up here or put a vehicle on the Ferry and take a couple weeks to go to Anchorage or Seattle to try to find used restaurant equipment which honestly does not work out very well with our family schedule of school and farm chores.   

Now for the FUN part...Perks!  I am so excited for every single one of these perks, I have put a lot of thought into what the most sought after items are in the knitting world and collaborated with a few of my favorite artists to bring you some amazing perks at all levels.  All perks include domestic shipping.  Some perks are ready to be shipped now.  We have a few more perks to add as the campaign progresses so be sure to check back often!
  • $10 contribution level gets you a set of 4 hand made Jade and Swarovski crystal stitch markers.  They're small, get a set for everyone in your knitting group! Did you know that Jade is the Alaskan state gem?  Have a little bit of Alaska delivered to you! 

  • $25 contribution level gets you a hand made project bag from Seaside Yarns in Juneau.  These one of a kind Tula Pink Saltwater bags are only being made for the Indiegogo project.  Made from high quality quilting cotton designed by Tula Pink, they are roomy and will hold at least 4 skeins of sock yarn.  Don't need it as a project bag?  This can also hold toiletries for travel, help keep your diaper bag organized, or just about anything else.  

  • $30 gets you a skein of Basic Sock in the Mermaid color way. This color is so crazy popular, I have a hard time keeping it on the shelves.  If you buy more than one, I will make sure that they are from the same dyelot so that your larger project works.  Imagine a mermaid rising from the depths...greens, blues, teals and purples shimmer as she surfaces.  It is a gorgeous color!  The yarn is 100% USA made superwash Merino wool, 400 yards / 100 grams.  Buy more than one for a larger project and I will make sure that they are from the same dyelot.

  • $50 contribution is inspired by a moment dear to my heart:  The raising of two new totem poles in Juneau last September.  With this contribution, you will receive 2 skeins of Little One (in the brand new 100% USA raised and spun base) in my brand new colorway:  Totem.  Little One is a single ply superwash Merino yarn, fingering weight, 425 yards per skein.  Want to watch a time lapse video of the totems going up?  Click here (not my video but one that I feel captures the spirit of the event).  

  • $50 scores you an amazing hand dyed, hand knit beanie from The Granite Collective.  When Granite beanies drop in Juneau, they sell out within hours...they're that amazing.  Each one is designed with an active, stylish lifestyle in mind.  They are able to go from serious shred time on the mountain to checking off your Saturday errand list.  There are 5 beanies to choose from, if you see one you like, snag it now because it truly is the only one I have of that color/style.  Each one fits an average size head, the cabled beanies are a bit more roomy. 

  • $60 contribution level gets you one skein of 50% Qiviut, 50% Merino. It is my personal favorite.  I find that it wears so well and the Merino wool adds a bit of memory so whatever you make does not become stretched out.  Plus, it develops a gorgeous halo while allowing you to keep stitch definition. Your choice of color, I will include patterns that I have written specifically for this yearn. 203 yards per ounce. One skein will make a small scarf or cowl. Select two or more for a larger project and I will dye them at the same time.
  • $75 contribution level gets you one stunning Juneau beach inspired yarn bowl from Joyce Payne Pottery.  Joyce walks the beach at low tide and finds sweet little shells to use to cast molds for her pottery designs.  Each one varies slightly but includes Butter Clams, Blue Mussels, Barnacles and Limpets.  These are a larger sized yarn bowl that will look fantastic on any table as a work of art.

  • $100 contribution level for the non-yarny folks!  You will receive a box with my favorite Juneau & Alaska things.  This includes:
               1 pound of Heritage Coffee "Heritage House Blend", seriously my favorite                      coffee, hands down.  
               King Salmon Jerky, always a great snack to have in your bag.
               A bar of "Tee Harbor Breeze" from Homesteader's Cache.  Such a crisp                          scent, you will love it! 
               A hand crocheted (by me!) dishcloth is not pictured but will be included.                        Made from 100% cotton, we all deserve to enjoy a little luxury while we do                    our everyday chores.
               Sitka Spruce Tip Sea Salt, delicious sprinkled on raw vegetables, popcorn,                    salmon, you can't go wrong.
               Halibut Tea Infuser with removable basket.
               1/2 pound Dark Chocolate Turbinado Sea Salt Almonds aren't technically                      from Juneau or Alaska but I adore them and I think you will too!
               Blueberry Tea is a light flavored tea and great to drink when the weather                        starts turning cooler...which is also is a good time to head out the road to                      pick blueberries in Juneau. 

  •  
  • $100 contribution level gets you a 4 pack of the new (temporarily unnamed) 100% USA grown & milled superwash merino Worsted weight yarn.  You can choose from either the "Grown In Alaska"  or the "Backyard Birds of Alaska".  There are 220 yards per skein so you end up with 880 yards of worsted weight Alaskan goodness.  You may recognize a few of these colorways that are tried and true beauties but as a personal Indiegogo challenge, I have created a few new colorways based on things around Juneau that inspire me.  This is an either/or package, please let me know which you prefer in the comments or send me an email at atreehuggerswife@gmail.com.  At this time, I won't be breaking the collections up and will keep it as plants or birds.  Want to see projects that are listed on Ravelry to get an idea of how things may look when completed?  Click this link.

  • $105 contribution level gets you a skein of 100% Qiviut yarn.  Finer than Cashmere and 8 times warmer than wool, this is truly the fiber of the Arctic. The yarn develops a soft halo as it is worked and worn, it is like nothing you have ever seen or felt, it is light as a feather. Your choice of color, I will include patterns that I have written specifically for this yearn. 203 yards per ounce. One skein will make a small scarf or cowl. Select two or more for a larger project and I will dye them at the same time.
  • $125 contribution level gets you a 3 month membership to our yarn of the month club.  Each month, you will receive a shipment of yarn with a coordinating pattern written by a professional designer.  Each pattern that we are highlighting is hand picked and we will send you enough yarn to complete the project.  Projects range from socks to fingerless mitts to hats or scarves, maybe even a baby sweater or pair of slippers!  You will find other small treats in your shipment every month, a few of my favorite things that I would like to share with you!
  • $150 contribution level goes out to my fellow spinners!  Have you been dreaming of spinning the most luxurious fibers you can get your hands on?  I have a perk for you!  With this perk, you get an ounce of raw Qiviut, an ounce of prepared Qiviut and an ounce of raw French Angora fiber from my bunny Tortellini.  Surely this is an experience not to be missed!  These are not dyed whatsoever, I leave that creative freedom up to you.

  • $150 contribution level gets you a hand knit cowl or scarf from my favorite blend of 50% Qiviut 50% Merino wool...hand made by me!  Not a knitter or crocheter but still want to experience Qiviut?  This perk is for you!  Available in natural, peacock, sitka spruce, wild iris, red elderberry or cranberry.  Your choice of cowl or scarf.

  • $225 contribution level gets you a 6 month membership in our yarn of the month club.  It's just like the 3 month level, only you get to enjoy the goodness even longer!  Each month, you will receive a shipment of yarn with a coordinating pattern written by a professional designer.  Each pattern that we are highlighting is hand picked and we will send you enough yarn to complete the project.  Projects range from socks to fingerless mitts to hats or scarves, maybe even a baby sweater or pair of slippers!  You will find other small treats in your shipment every month, a few of my favorite things that I would like to share with you!
  • $250 contribution level  gets you a hand knit cowl or scarf made from the decadent 100% Qiviut...hand made by me!  Not a knitter or crocheter but still want to experience Qiviut?  This perk is for you!  Available in natural, peacock, sitka spruce, wild iris, red elderberry or cranberry.  Your choice of cowl or scarf.
  • $425 contribution level gets you a 12 month membership in our yarn of the month club.  It's just like the 3 & 6 month level, only you get to enjoy the goodness even longer *and* this level will include a skein of Qiviut blend yarn at one point during the 12 months!  Each month, you will receive a shipment of yarn with a coordinating pattern written by a professional designer.  Each pattern that we are highlighting is hand picked and we will send you enough yarn to complete the project.  Projects range from socks to fingerless mitts to hats. scarves or shawls, maybe even a baby sweater or pair of slippers!  You will find other small treats in your shipment every month, a few of my favorite things that I would like to share with you!
  • $500 contribution level gets you a personal dye day and lunch in the studio once it is completed in the fall.  Plan for a 5-6 hour experience in the studio, I will supply the dyes and other supplies, instruction/guidance and $250 worth of yarn in whichever base you would like to work with.  Want to try a little of everything?  We can do that!  Want to dye yarn for the sweater of your dreams and enough for a matching one for your husband?  We can do that!  A few skeins of Qiviut to treat yourself?  Yeah!  We totally can do that!  Want to make it a dye day party with your friends?  Well, spread the word and have your friends purchase the perk too!  We can accommodate up to 5 dyers in the studio at once.  Lunch will be organic and as local as possible, made to suit your tastes and highlight what is in season.

My Mission

Over the past two years, I have been slowly switching my yarn bases to all 100% USA made yarns.  It is important to me to be proud of the quality of yarn I offer and I love being able to tell customers that my yarn is made in America.  I have worked with Jane from the Yolo Wool Mill in northern California for wool processing, Cestari and Kraemer Yarns for finished yarns, as well as two farmers in northern California for my wool sources, Jim has Southdown, Hampshire and Dorset sheep and Evan has my beloved Columbias.  It has become a project that I fully believe in, I want to support America's farmers and invest in their future.  I need your help to continue doing this.  Investing in my company through this crowdfunding project will help me invest in them.  


If I Don't Meet My Goal

I have a priority list of things that are *must have* items.  After Indiegogo takes their cut and the credit card processing takes theirs, my portion will go towards my priority list whether I make my goal or not.  I am well versed in starting small and not overextending myself so I am no stranger to waiting to fully grow while continuing to work as hard as I can and use what funding I do get to increase productivity in the meantime.  My must have list includes things that are absolutely necessary in the studio:

  • Ventilation System & Installation Labor
  • Stainless Steel Sink & Faucet Set Up
  • Propane Cylinder
  • Propane Burners
  • At Least One Stainless Steel Work Table
  • At Least One Set of Stainless Shelving Racks for organization

Other Ways You Can Help

I get it that you might not be able to contribute at this time. I really do.  There are other ways that you can help me that will make a big difference.  I need your help getting the word out.  Please share this on facebook, twitter, instagram, with your church knitting group, your friends, anyone you think might be interested.  The beauty of crowdfunding is word of mouth and the community pulling together to make it happen.  There are buttons to use to share on social media, indiegogo has made it easy!

story:
Hello! My name is Gin O'Keefe, and I have recently finished earning my Masters of Fine Art in ceramics from the University of Missouri. My husband (who also works in clay) and I moved to Boonville last August, where we immediately fell in love with the history and people of this town. While this historic little river town is full of antique shops, restaurants and bars, there is a lacking presence of community-driven art. My goal is to combine my passion in teaching ceramics with that of the people of Boonville and its surrounding rural areas.   


What We Need & What You Get

 

The roughly estimated $30,000 will go towards securing a studio space for teaching in Downtown Boonville, a kiln, pottery wheels and ceramic tools and materials. Each donation comes with a "perk" consisting of a handmade object made by myself and other fellow artists!

 

The Impact

Each donation helps me get closer to bringing art and ceramics to an area that desperately needs something which allows people to become invested in their community! My hopes are to bring together people in an environment that encourages creativity, knowledge of history and a growth of new ideas. While Boonville's history is rich in ceramics with its local resource to the Missouri River, rural areas like these have little to no exposure to the arts. My experience in teaching clay at the university level as well as in other community clay studios has shown me the impact of this material and its potential to bring others together!


 

Spread the word!

Even if you are unable to donate to the cause, letting others know and sharing (what in reality is my dream!!!) helps tremendously. This project is greater than myself and is about getting people's hands dirty and setting a spark to a community that needs this. THANK YOU.

story:
Who is HIM?

Hello art enthusiasts, my name is Boden Him, a Studio Art grad from Cal State Long Beach. I am currently a full time artist at California Kings Tattoo. 

It has been two years since my first exhibit. With all the anxiety and pressure following up to the opening reception, I had no idea at the time how the event would turn out. To my surprise, it was a success as people gathered under one roof to appreciate the arts and music. 

I have been fortunate to have this opportunity arise again. Every first Tuesday of the month, the talented staff at Digital Installers orchestrates a SONOS listening party, with a particular genre of music playing in their state of the art showroom. I have been asked to be the featured artist for the month of June, with reggae music as the theme. What better way to kick off the summer as we vibe to the groovy sounds of roots, rock, and reggae? 

This gathering will take place at the Digital Installers' showroom in Long Beach, CA. The event is simply designed for creatives to come together, network and have a good time.


Why I'm here.

I am here to ask for your help in funding my second exhibit. The gallery will feature a comprehensive collection of oil paintings, charcoal portraits, money art, and tattooed pig skin. Your contributions will help provide the necessary elements to bring this show to life. $1,500 needs to be raised by June 1st. A portion of gallery sales will be donated to NHCC-New Hope for Cambodian Children. 


What's the purpose?

Since my last show, I have been overwhelmed and blessed with the support and feedback from my family, friends, and social media. I have had the pleasure of chatting and meeting many people from across the world. Recently I met a humanitarian worker who once lived in the U.S., but has given up everything to volunteer in Cambodia to educate and heal children living with HIV/AIDS. A portion of the proceeds will be donated to the charity. 

http://www.newhopeforcambodianchildren.com


What We Need & What You Get

The proceeds will enable me to provide you with prints of my work, food, refreshments, prizes, and cover the cost of staging. 

Venue/Host Fees=$250

Prints/Merchandise=$900

Art supplies/Display accessories=$200

Food & Refreshments=$150

Although we were short of achieving our goal in the last project, we were still able to launch a successful event with the funds that were donated.  Your help is greatly appreciated with the cost of assembling this art show.  Thank you.


Your Contribution

Whether you think so or not, anything you decide to do will make a great impact.  If you're unable to make any monetary contributions, you can help spread the word by simply sharing this with your friends and family.  A quick Facebook post, Twitter tweet or Instagram snapshot will go a long way.  I sincerely appreciate you stopping by. 


By the way, you're all invited!

Tuesday, June 2, 6PM - 9PM

Digital Installlers

1530 E Wardlow Rd., Long Beach, CA 90807

story:
We are going to press. This is an amazing accomplishment. In just a few weeks we will need to determine if we can print 1000 books for $16,840, or can if we can only afford to print 500 for $12,550. With funds from the first campaign (igg.me/at/sixcomforts) combined with this current campaign we have just about $14,500 (as of 5/26/2015). So we are just $2,340 from our ideal goal. It's a testament to Chris's character and the greatness of his friends that we have gotten this far! Thank-you. This is a limited edition book, will be a valuable collectors item, so please order now, support our campaign, and enable Proof Publishing to start out with a great release.

The initial contract with the printer in toronto has been signed. Once the proof is delivered in a few weeks time, we will at that point need to decide if we will do 500 or 1000 books. The book is now 344 pages (16 signatures) on 135 lb. paper, casebound, smyth sewn, colored endpapers, dust jacket and embossing on front, back and spine. (Cover material will be finalized with the proof). 

NEW GOAL FOR THIS CAMPAIGN: $4,500.


The Six Comforts book, a limited-edition conceptual work of text and image by artist Christopher Gustave, is now available for pre-order.

Christopher Gustave’s immense artist book “The Six Comforts”, c.344 pages in total, more than 308 full color plates, will be printed as a tightly-limited edition. We sold over 85 books in little over a month. We are continuing the pre-sale now. Contribute $100, receive Christopher Gustave's last art work: The Six Comforts, and get your name on the Acknowledgement page before it goes to press.

Gustave conceived of the Six Comforts as a method for living in response to personal tragedy, primarily the death by heroin overdose of his best friend, Daniel Brack, in San Francisco, on September 13th, 1996. Over the next several years, he focused his creative output in book-design, conceptual art, collage and assemblage within a framework of this “sorting construct” of the Six Comforts: key components of a method of living in opposition to super-cultural alienation, and unrecoverable loss.

"The Six Comforts are Home, Sleep, Work, Love, Food and Self. The Six Comforts’ is a sorting construct I formulated around the summer of 1997. At that point in my life I had just endured a blistering spate of profoundly bad luck—death, divorce, unemployment, homelessness… you name it—and I was in a deep state of emotional turmoil and mental resignation… really heart-broken and bereft of hope. Life nearly unendurable and all that. However, given a little time, it was pretty clear that, in spite of all of this, I was not going to just stop living. I had resigned myself to the Nietzschean formula (“That which does not kill us…”). Part of my survival regimen at that time was to simply sort out what I most needed in order to keep on going and just focus on those basics; get myself back into a healthy, sane and productive place. So, those “basics” became ‘The Six Comforts’." — Christopher Gustave, 2002.

The work “The Six Comforts” existed primarily in book-page spreads, diptychs, comprised of poetical texts and, aphorisms layered with photographic elements. It can be read forward to back, back to front, and starting anywhere in the middle. Pages from the unbound book were exhibited and sold in St. Louis galleries between 1999 and 2002. Other works from this series include a Six Comforts “screen” assembly the size of a room, The Six Comforts as a series of hand-pulled woodcuts, The Six Comforts Panels (assemblage of found objects with encaustic) and finally culminating in a concept-album in collaboration with several talented St. Louis musicians.

On January 17th, 2014, Christopher Gustave was found dead in his apartment of a overdose of anti-depressants. Within days of his passing, hundreds of his friends and supporters organized and began gathering together his works of art. A fundraising memorial was held at MAD Art Gallery in St. Louis, with the purpose to raise money for his eight-year-old daughter, Sophia. We are continuing that purpose in perpetuity with the initial release of this book The Six Comforts, which will mark the completion of Gustave’s final, and perhaps most challenging and important, work of art.

This book embodies a spiritual quest against the backdrop of modern industrial oppression.

The experience one has of reading the book is extraordinary. Gustave tears down megalithic conceptions foisted upon us by a vapid culture and replaces them with sharp, emancipating anti-slogans. While the punk-rock ideals inherent to Gustave’s practice keep everything on the edge, there is redemption on every page.

Please share this campaign with everyone you know and love.

UPDATE!  OUR LATEST VIDEO, FEATURING TRACKS FROM THE SIX COMFORTS ALBUM:

Caption: Page spread from the book The Six Comforts

Caption: Installation view of the Six Comforts, Brokaw residence, St. Louis.

Caption: Page spread from the book The Six Comforts

Caption: Mock-up of the book The Six Comforts
1. The Six Comforts Book

Each contributor of $100 gets the book The Six Comforts containing every one of his Six Comforts designs.

  • 348 pages of full-color designs. 9.25” x 9.25”
  • approx. 1.75” thick
  • 80# quality paper
  • embossed hardcover
  • smyth-sewn binding

Every person who buys a book will have his or her name recorded on the Six Comforts Book’s Acknowledgements page.

2. The Six Comforts: Singleton Series

Selections from The Six Comforts Singleton Series are available for $50 each in limited edition of 100.

  • 12” x 12” image size,
  • Archival 100% Cotton Rag Paper
  • Estate stamped and numbered
3. The Six Comforts Box Set and Deluxe Box Set


Specifications for the Box Set:

  • 18” x 18” hand-made wood box, silk-screened images from The Six Comforts series on front and back, drawer format with removable inner box.
  • 1 shadow boxed "Comfort Relic" from Gustave's collection.
  • The Six Comforts Limited-Edition Book
  • The Six Comforts Singleton limited edition prints, series of 6, 12”x12” on archival paper with estate stamps
  • The Six Comforts T-shirt with slogan chosen by collector
  • The Six Comforts CD in special book-binding format.
  • Edition of 12 only
  • $1200

Specifications for the Deluxe Box Set:

  • 18” x 18” hand-made wood box,  silk-screened images from The Six Comforts series on front and back, suitcase format with slide out display.
  • Pull out display drawers on either side of the box displaying The Six Comfort Singleton limited edition prints, series of 6, 12”x12” on archival paper with estate stamps
  • 1 shadow boxed "Comfort Relic" from Gustave's collection.
  • The Six Comforts Limited-Edition Book
  • The Six Comforts T-shirt with slogan chosen by collector
  • The Six Comforts CD in special book-binding format.
  • Photographic print of Gustave
  • Hidden compartment with additional artifacts
  • Edition of 6, only 5 available
  • $2300


4. The Six Comforts T-Shirt 

Choose from several designs, each an aphorism from the pages of The Six Comforts.

  • $30 each
  • Editions are limited to 10 of each design. Order now!
  • Black High-Quality American Apparel T-Shirt
  • Screen applied white lettering and design
  • We will contact you after purchase to specify size and style information

Caption: The Six Comforts CD, Front and Back Image
4. The Six Comforts CD

We have a small number of the Six Comfort CDs to offer as perks for $25 donations.

This album contains 17 tracks: 3 of which feature Christopher Gustave. Other artists include: Colony, Tripstar, Languid and The Drew Johnson Band. The production quality (by Drew Johnson) is masterful.

story:
Untamed Objects:

My name is Joan Wyand, and I am a local artist and teacher. I am organizing this exhibition because the annual conference for the National Council on Education for the Ceramic Arts, (NCECA), will occur in Providence, from March 25th-28th, creating a national community of peers, scholars, and mentors.  

I want take advantage of this unique opportunity and show the ceramic work of 10 female artists that have lived in Providence over the past 10 years.  The works are a variety of sculpture, installation, and functional pieces.  There is a preview party at 6pm for donors (which includes delicious food), and the public opening starts at 7pm.   After the opening, there is a dance party till 1am with local and visiting DJ's!
 
Machines with Magnets is an amazing local venue/gallery/ &recording studio that will host both the untamed objects exhibition in the gallery and a great dance party in the venue.   

Please help make this exhibition happen by donating!  In return you will receive some limited-edition gifts, delicious treats, and a fun evening of art and dancing.  Below is a detailed plan for the exhibition, including show details, a budget, and a timeline.

Thank you!

Featured Artists: 
  • Kerry Adams
  • Heidi Born
  • Lauren Fisher
  • Stef Grant
  • Jungil Hong
  • Anna Shapiro
  • Meredith Stern
  • Kik Williams
  • Joan Wyand
  • Meredith Younger

Location:  Machines With Magnets, 400 Main St. Pawtucket, RI 02860 

Show duration: Wednesday, March 25th through Friday, April 24th 

Gallery hours: 

  • Wednesday, March 25th from 10am-5:30pm
  • Thursday, March 26th from 5-7pm
  • Friday, March 27th from 5-9:30pm
  • Opening reception: Saturday, March 28, 7pm-1am, Dance party at 10pm with local DJs! 

Goals for the Untamed Objects show:

  • To exhibit powerful ceramics made by 10 female artists. 
  • Have an awesome dance party with local DJ’s after the opening.
  • Hire a professional photographer to document the exhibition.
  • Hire a gallery assistant to run the gallery during NCECA. 
  • Spend extra funds to keep the gallery open more hours. 
  • Have a great selection of rewards for donors including: 

      *An Invitation to a decadently tasty Preview Party! 

      *A limited edition ceramic cup... 

      *Full color exhibition books and signed screen printed posters. 

      *A screen printed exhibition bag… 

      *A Polaroid snapshot from the Preview Party!


Itemized BUDGET: $2,750

  • Renting the gallery venue: $600
  • Installation supplies: $75
  • Postcards: $100
  • Posters: Donated by Headlight hotel, thank you!
  • Vinyl for the gallery wall: $100
  • Hiring local and visiting DJ’s: $450
  • Hiring a gallery assistant: 25hrs, $450
  • Hiring a professional photographer for documentation: $300
  • Reward fulfillment: $675

               -Shipping: $125

               -Materials for custom cups, bags, and cups: $100

               -Custom printed artist books: $175

               -Food for Preview Party: $275

Project timeline:

  • Indiegogo campaign: January 20th to February 18th, 2015.
  • Donor's reward items assembled: February 20th to March 20th
  • Installation of artwork: March 21st- 23rd
  • Professional photographs of show taken: March 24th
  • Gallery hours: Wednesday, March 25th from 10am-5:30pm, Thursday, March 26th from 5-7pm, Friday, March 27th from 5-9:30pm. 
  • Opening reception: Saturday, March 28, 7pm-1am, Dance party at 10pm with local DJs!
  • Donor reward delivery: Donor rewards will be available for pick-up at the opening reception on Saturday March 28th, and will otherwise be mailed to donors on Monday March 30th. The full color exhibition books will be shipped separately after they are printed, no later than May 15th.

Goals for the Untamed Objects show:

To exhibit powerful ceramics made by 10 female artists. 
Have an awesome dance party with local DJ’s after the opening.
Hire a professional photographer to document the exhibition.
Hire a gallery assistant to run the gallery during NCECA. 
Spend extra funds to keep the gallery open more hours. 
Have a great selection of rewards for donors including: 

      *An Invitation to a decadently tasty Preview Party! 
      *A limited edition ceramic cup...       *Full color exhibition books and signed screen printed posters.       *A screen printed exhibition bag…       *A Polaroid snapshot from the Preview Party!
Itemized BUDGET: $2,750

Renting the gallery venue: $600
Installation supplies: $75
Postcards: $100
Posters: Donated by Headlight hotel, thank you!
Vinyl for the gallery wall: $100
Hiring local and visiting DJ’s: $450
Hiring a gallery assistant: 25hrs, $450
Hiring a professional photographer for documentation: $300
Reward fulfillment: $675

               -Shipping: $125
               -Materials for custom cups, bags, and cups: $100
               -Custom printed artist books: $175
               -Food for Preview Party: $275
Project timeline:


Indiegogo campaign: January 20th to February 18th, 2015.

Donor's reward items assembled: February 20th to March 20th

Installation of artwork: March 21st- 23rd

Professional photographs of show taken: March 24th

Gallery hours: Wednesday, March 25th from 10am-5:30pm, Thursday, March 26th from 5-7pm, Friday, March 27th from 5-9:30pm. 

Opening reception: Saturday, March 28, 7pm-1am, Dance party at 10pm with local DJs!

Donor reward delivery: Donor rewards will be available for pick-up at the opening reception on Saturday March 28th, and will otherwise be mailed to donors on Monday March 30th. The full color exhibition books will be shipped separately after they are printed, no later than May 15th.

story:
Hey fans,

My laptop has died very recently and I urgently need to replace it. But with your help and support, I will accept a donation of any amount to help cover the cost of replacing it.

If you donate a specific amount you will be entitled to a Perk of your choice as a reward for helping me. I will gift you an artwork or request in exchange for your help. I will be spending this money towards a new laptop so I can get back to my University studies and produce more new artworks for Musik Pictures I Drawn. 

Your continued support of my work is very precious to me, I've enjoyed every Like, Comment, and Share you have given. My dream is to make a positive impact and bring to joy to others, knowing I can do this through my Facebook page is a life changing experience.

Thanks again everyone who has followed me on my journey and provided support. I will continue Musik Pictures I Drawn until you have all stopped turning up.

www.facebook.com/musikpicturesidrawn


Lots of love,
Musik Pictures I Drawn
xxx


IMPORTANT SIDE NOTES:

1) All art work requests via indiegogo will be fulfilled when the deadline ends.

2) If you select a Perk, please leave as much information here and via message on my Facebook page as I will need to identify you and send you the request through Facebook or e-mail.

3) If you require artwork before the deadline of this campaign, please contact my Facebook page directly and we can use PayPal as an alternative. You will receive your request as soon as payment is received.

4) The $500 goal is a rough figure and will not buy a new laptop on its own, however any funds raised over the $500 and the cost of a laptop will be separated from my personal finances and used directly to fund the Facebook page. This could be real music that I commission, videos/animations and more!

story:
Sun Tower

2228 years after Archimedes is said to have destroyed an attacking Roman naval fleet using mirrors, we will bring the Sun Tower to the playa and try to set it on fire the same way.

This 30+ foot tall climbable tower will have a sun shaped mandala at the top. On Friday around 1PM hundreds of participants around the perimeter will bring or be given mirrors to reflect sunlight at the center of the mandala where a target of cannon fuse will catch fire and set the rest of the tower ablaze.

Hi, I'm wizzard, and this is my 17th year bringing art to the playa. I've wanted to use sunlight to start a big burn for several years, and I look forward to finally seeing it happen.

 The Sun Tower team is composed of some of the same  skilled and talented people who created and brought Cruz the Wave to Burning Man last year and the Mayan TRIcycle to BM 2012. This year our team is smaller than for either of those projects, and we are donating our time and money toward making the tower a reality. However, we can't do it all on our own and need your financial help to make it possible.

This is the tallest structure that I've brought to Black Rock City and I can't wait to climb it!  On such a large flat space as the playa, getting 5' above the ground really changes your perspective. When you are 20' or 30' up, the view is amazing!

This is also the first art project I've worked on that will burn during the day. On burn day-which we've tentatively set as Friday, the 4th of September, around 1pm-with the help of participants, we will all point mirrors to reflect sunlight on the Sun Mandala and try to burn the tower to the ground. We will be bringing hundreds of small mirrors to the desert and would like to encourage others to bring their own mirrors to the burn. Be aware that the target is going to get VERY bright, so those of you who will be there will want to bring the darkest sunglasses you have with you!

Below I've estimated the costs involved in making the Sun Tower:

The tower: $1200
The mandala: $300
The mirrors: $400
The signage: $100
The DG: $2000
The lighting & power: $400
The fuel/fusing: $200
Transportation: $200
The rewards: $300
The total: $5100

Rewards for donations:

Sun Tower pendants in progress. This photo is before we've added the bales and cord. 
Pendant with Bales & Cords attached

Sun Tower Magnet

Back of Sun Tower Mirror. (Other side looks like a mirror! with copper foil edging.) Size 3x4".

3 Mirrors stacked like a tower.

For a $750 donation, one lucky Bay Area donor can have the 7+ foot tall, 1:5 scale original model of the sun tower.

Please help Get the Sun Tower to the Playa

We need your help to raise the funds it will take to make this project happen. Without your help, we will not be able to bring the Tower to the desert and try to prove that Archimedes could have in fact set the Roman ships on fire using mirrors. If you can't donate, but like our project, consider helping us get the word out by telling your friends about it.

As tokens of our appreciation, we are busy creating a variety of items that will remind you of your involvement in this huge project. 

Please donate now to the Sun Tower.

Thanks for your support!

- wizzard and the Sun Tower Team

===========================================
P.S. We're looking for reliable burners to help out on the burn perimeter on Friday at burning man.  Send us a comment if you might be able to help. By helping out you'll also get a laminate showing you're an official perimeter person. I've been working on the laminate image, and I think this is what it will look like. (Just finished it a few minutes ago and I think this is a keeper!)

===========================================


Intro - me & past projects

If you've been going to burning man for a while, you've probably seen one or more of my past art projects. Or you might recognize me if you have watched the movie "Burning Man:  Beyond Black Rock" (now showing on NetFlix).  I am one of the three artists that they followed in 2003 for the documentary.


My past art projects include: A Place to Stand (2003), Pagoda of Infinite Reflection (2004), Project X (2005), IntelligentDesign (2006/2009), THE END (2008) and I was a crew member of Valley of Heart's Delight (South Bay CORE project 2011). 

In 2012 I designed the Mayan TRIcycle, and along with John Schiesel as the master builder, we brought it to the playa. In 2013 I married Gwen Jester and made a wedding arch as the location for the ceremony. Last year, I designed and John was the lead builder of Cruz the Wave.
