story:
DESCRIPTION DU PROJET

Tout premier projet de la compagnie On a tué la une!, la pièce Mme G. met en lumière la personnalité atypique et attachante de Thérèse Drago, figure mythique du milieu underground de la ville de Québec, qui sera incarnée à la scène par la grande comédienne Marie-Ginette Guay, du 12 au 30 avril, à Premier Acte, le théâtre de la relève québécoise !

Une dizaine d’artistes et artisans travaillent déjà d’arrache-pied depuis plusieurs semaines à la mise au monde de cette comédie dramatique empruntant les codes de la docu-fiction. Votre soutien financier saura contribuer à camper la pièce dans ses allers-retours dans le temps, que ce soit, entre autres, dans le souci du costume bien choisi ou dans la location d’un vrai piano, un élément fort du parcours de Mme Thérèse, rebaptisée ici Mme G.

*****

D’ailleurs, plusieurs petites surprises,

gentiment offertes par nos partenaires et commanditaires,

vous attendent en échange de vos dons,

dans des catégories inspirées par la pièce !

*****

Autrefois propriétaire du bar la Grande Hermine, plaque tournante de la prostitution de la ville jusqu’en 1994, Thérèse Drago a ensuite tenu pendant plus d’une vingtaine d’années un after-hour clandestin entre les murs de son demi-sous-sol de Montcalm. Fasciné par son parcours hors de l’ordinaire, le comédien et journaliste Maxime Beauregard-Martin a fait les démarches qu’il fallait pour qu’une nuit, dans sa chambre, elle lui raconte son histoire.

Surnommée la « travailleuse sociale sans diplôme » par l’une des fidèles clientes de son bar d’autrefois, Mme Drago a non seulement marqué l’imaginaire, mais aussi le destin de plusieurs citoyens de la Capitale nationale.

À vous maintenant de plonger dans son histoire, du 12 au 30 avril, entre les murs de Premier Acte.

www.premieracte.ca

MME G

ÉQUIPE DE PRODUCTION

Un texte de Maxime Beauregard-Martin

Mise en scène : Maryse Lapierre
Interprètes : Maxime Beauregard-Martin, Israël Gamache, Nicolas Gendron,
Marie-Ginette Guay, Mary-Lee Picknell, Annabelle Pelletier-Legros

Conceptrices : Gabrielle Arseneault, Maude Groleau
Assistance à la mise en scène : Sarah Villeneuve-Desjardins

Graphisme : Émilie Lapierre Pintal


SYNOPSIS

« La cigarette, c’est mon problème numéro un. Pas capable de m’en défaire. Depuis l’âge de treize ans que je fume. C’est déjà venu à quatre cinq paquets par jour. Là, c’est rendu à trois. Je diminue. Ça doit être la codéïne qui tient mes poumons deboutte. »

Y a pas de trafic sur René-Lévesque. C’est une petite soirée au Dagobert. Tout Québec est en pyj. Tout le monde, à part un gars – un Y instruit à l’école privée – qui brave moins quarante pour aller écouter une octogénaire tenancière d’un after-hour clandestin lui raconter sa vie.

Dans la chambre exiguë d’un demi-sous-sol, les souvenirs d’une existence à contre-courant jaillissent comme on regarde les montagnes à partir de la Haute-Ville : dans le désordre. Elle parle, il écoute. De cet équilibre naît un sentiment étrange. Quelque chose comme l’affection fulgurante et éphémère d’une rencontre de voyage.

Entre ces allers-retours dans le temps, qui nous font revivre l’âge d’or d’un bar de passage de la rue Cartier, s’ouvrent des fenêtres dévoilant avec humour le processus de création d’un théâtre documentaire. Mme G., c’est une histoire épique recopiée dans un cahier Canada, dont les meilleurs bouts sont écrits dans la marge.

ON A TUÉ LA UNE !

La jeune compagnie On a tué la une ! puise son inspiration dans l’actualité, présente ou passée, et des acteurs plus ou moins connus qui la composent. Ses créations s’articulent à partir d’une démarche inspirée du journalisme d’enquête, qui sert de piste de décollage à la fiction. Le collectif croit en la force des histoires au théâtre. Mme G est son premier projet, dont une première étape de travail fut présentée avec succès lors des Chantiers 2015 du Carrefour International de Québec. Soutenue par une bourse de la Société des auteurs et compositeurs dramatiques du Québec et par Première Ovation, la pièce sera officiellement créée en clôture de la saison 2015-2016 de Premier Acte, à quelques coins de rue du bâtiment ayant jadis abrité la Grande Hermine.

REMERCIEMENTS

Cinéma Le Clap, Gabrielle Arseneault, À Double Tour, Café Castelo – Maison de torréfaction, Premier Acte, Le Théâtre du Trident, Hôtel Château Laurier

story:
About the Project

Curatorial collective VERBureau delivers an art project examining the socio-political history of ice cream bringing communities together and celebrating cultural difference. Unfolding from February till May, the project has already started with an exhibition Who Owns the Cone? successfully held at Likky Ruph, New York in February 2016. It will be followed by a big exhibition and collateral events programme Pokey Hat taking place at New Glasgow Society as part of the visual arts festival Glasgow International in April 2016.

Elements of social history spanning popular culture, immigration, LGBTQ and women’s emancipation, regeneration and community can be charted through the Italian ice cream cafés that first appeared throughout Glasgow and New York from 1880s to 1930s. Emphasising the social, cultural and political importance of the cafés, Who Owns the Cone? and Pokey Hat aim to establish a dialogue between these two cities significant to the Italian diaspora and trace how the ice cream cafés have catalysed shifts in local culture across the world. The project entails newly commissioned works and reflect on the collective experience of contemporary urban environments through ice cream.

The overall project aims to unfold complex local histories; raise discussion about the coexistence of differing values, attitudes, lifestyles, faiths and traditions; critically consider the notions of identity, family, community and home; and forge new social connections.

Pokey Hat


Photo by Elizabeth Hudson

The main part of the project, Pokey Hat, will take place at New Glasgow Society in April 2016 as part of Glasgow International – a city-wide biennial that attracts over 200 000 visitors over the course of three weeks. Glasgow’s connection with ice cream parallels that of New York, which we explored earlier, but retains its own distinct history. Alongside positive tales of burgeoning youth culture and tolerance are darker stories of failed regeneration schemes, slum clearances and the gang violence of the notorious “ice cream wars” of the 1980s. Hence ice cream provides an illuminating lens through which to explore notions of immigration, community, regeneration and national identity - all of which are at the forefront of current political agendas in Scotland in the wake of the independence referendum, Commonwealth Games and ongoing refugee crisis.

Pokey Hat will present five new commissions from artists whose research-driven practices examine the social, political and cultural landscape of the past and present: Cooking Sections (Daniel Fernández Pascual and Alon Schwabe), Carrie Gooch, Julie Hill, Rosie O’Grady and Rachel Sharpe. The artistic responses to the history of ice cream will be diverse, ranging from the transformation of invasive plants into ice cream flavours and celebration of queer culture to the exploration in socio-political anxieties through the horror genre.

The events programme will invite people of all backgrounds and ages to connect through making and sharing. The events include storytelling and recipe sharing workshops, a talk on the socio-politics of ice cream in an urban environment, and a screening of archival film footage followed by feature length films. The new works, artistic interventions and events will extend beyond the gallery, thus taking Pokey Hat to different neighbourhoods across Glasgow. The other venues include Centre for Contemporary Art, Jaconelli’s Café and Café Peña.

What your support will mean to us

We need your help to make Pokey Hat, the second stage of this project, happen. By supporting this project you will help us cover

  • 50% of artist fees for Pokey Hat

  • 50% of the production costs of newly commissioned works for Pokey Hat

  • elements of our public events programme

Please join us to support the artists that we work with!

It means the world to us that we can acknowledge the value of artists’ meaningful labour and, as fair collaborators, support artists’ everyday and future practice by providing appropriate conditions for development of new work.

VERBureau

VERBureau is an independent non-profit curatorial collective that produces interdisciplinary projects across the UK and abroad. Our key aims are to foster collaboration, support artistic practices sensitive to the current socio-political climate and advocate open discussion. We are committed to providing valuable opportunities for the artists and other practitioners that we work with. We maintain a non-hierarchical organisation that runs on consensus-based decision making. The collective members are based in Glasgow, London and Moscow.

http://verbureau.co.uk | @VERBureau

Risks & Challenges

The combination of Who Owns the Cone? and Pokey Hat is the most complex project we have produced so far, but we believe that our professional commitment and competence will guarantee an exciting platform for artists to produce new work and for people based in as well as visiting Glasgow to engage with complex local histories and current socio-political discussions. We have already accomplished the first half of the project by organising a successful Who Owns the Cone? exhibition in New York and it was a great experience. You can learn more about the first half of the project here.

The timeline of the project is tight but, as an organised and dedicated team, we have prepared an elaborate action plan for delivering Pokey Hat in schedule and within budget. VERBureau has already produced a number of successful projects ranging from exhibitions and events programmes to publications. Within VERBureau, our professional skills and experience span curatorial and artistic practices, academic research, writing and publishing, development of educational programmes as well as communications and marketing.

The artists are already in the process of developing and producing their work for Pokey Hat and we have established solid partnerships with Glasgow International, New Glasgow Society, Centre for Contemporary Art, the Village Storytelling Centre, Café d’Jaconelli, Peña, Glasgow based academics, members of the local Scots-Italian community and more. This means that we will have an immense amount of support throughout the project and we will be able to deliver it as successfully as our previous endeavours, including Who Owns the Cone? at Likky Ruph.

The exhibition and events in Glasgow will be held in many different locations and involve several organisations and individuals in different capacities. Whilst this could potentially make the project complicated to manage, with good planning and seamless communication these several partnerships are an incomparable resource. Invigilators and event hosts will be present at all times to ensure the safety of visitors, participants and artworks. The works will be packed, transported and installed professionally and accompanied by detailed condition reports and all project components will be covered by a public liability insurance. To ensure that the local communities will not feel alienated, VERBureau and the artists will approach this history sensitively with a VERBureau member raised in Glasgow in the lead.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate that not everyone can support us financially. If you feel that you would like to support our project in any other way, we would be happy to receive your help.

If you are an ice cream café or work in food/drinks industry in the UK, you can support us by product supply for one of our events. Please contact us to learn how you can benefit from this deal. If you are not able to donate this way, we would still be very grateful if you could allow us to promote this project through you by leaving some leaflets at your premises.

If you feel closely connected to the themes that our project aims to address, your advice on how to make the project more relatable, sensitive or inclusive would be valuable to us. We would be happy to hear from you.

If you are working in mass media, you can really help us by circulating information about our project and this campaign.

If you have any other creative ideas, suggestions or simply would like to ask us a question, please do not hesitate to contact us here or through our website at www.verbureau.co.uk.

Please share this page on your websites, blogs and social networks and send the link directly to any contacts who might be interested in supporting our project.

After Pokey Hat: Publication

These artistic and curatorial outcomes will become a foundation for more extensive academic research on the social history of ice cream. In collaboration with academics, artists and curators, this research will be compiled into an internationally distributed publication.

Gifts

Depending on your donation, we are happy to reward you with our exclusive gifts!

You can receive our cool carpenter pencils:


Or our branded tote bags:


Or artists' ice-cream-themed design necklace or brooch (your choice!):
story_txt:
About the Project
 
Curatorial collective VERBureau delivers an art project examining the socio-political history of ice cream bringing communities together and celebrating cultural difference. Unfolding from February till May, the project has already started with an exhibition Who Owns the Cone? successfully held at Likky Ruph, New York in February 2016. It will be followed by a big exhibition and collateral events programme Pokey Hat taking place at New Glasgow Society as part of the visual arts festival Glasgow International in April 2016. 

Elements of social history spanning popular culture, immigration, LGBTQ and women’s emancipation, regeneration and community can be charted through the Italian ice cream cafés that first appeared throughout Glasgow and New York from 1880s to 1930s. Emphasising the social, cultural and political importance of the cafés, Who Owns the Cone? and Pokey Hat aim to establish a dialogue between these two cities significant to the Italian diaspora and trace how the ice cream cafés have catalysed shifts in local culture across the world. The project entails newly commissioned works and reflect on the collective experience of contemporary urban environments through ice cream.
The overall project aims to unfold complex local histories; raise discussion about the coexistence of differing values, attitudes, lifestyles, faiths and traditions; critically consider the notions of identity, family, community and home; and forge new social connections.
Pokey Hat
Photo by Elizabeth Hudson

The main part of the project, Pokey Hat, will take place at New Glasgow Society in April 2016 as part of Glasgow International – a city-wide biennial that attracts over 200 000 visitors over the course of three weeks. Glasgow’s connection with ice cream parallels that of New York, which we explored earlier, but retains its own distinct history. Alongside positive tales of burgeoning youth culture and tolerance are darker stories of failed regeneration schemes, slum clearances and the gang violence of the notorious “ice cream wars” of the 1980s. Hence ice cream provides an illuminating lens through which to explore notions of immigration, community, regeneration and national identity - all of which are at the forefront of current political agendas in Scotland in the wake of the independence referendum, Commonwealth Games and ongoing refugee crisis. 
Pokey Hat will present five new commissions from artists whose research-driven practices examine the social, political and cultural landscape of the past and present: Cooking Sections (Daniel Fernández Pascual and Alon Schwabe), Carrie Gooch, Julie Hill, Rosie O’Grady and Rachel Sharpe. The artistic responses to the history of ice cream will be diverse, ranging from the transformation of invasive plants into ice cream flavours and celebration of queer culture to the exploration in socio-political anxieties through the horror genre.
The events programme will invite people of all backgrounds and ages to connect through making and sharing. The events include storytelling and recipe sharing workshops, a talk on the socio-politics of ice cream in an urban environment, and a screening of archival film footage followed by feature length films. The new works, artistic interventions and events will extend beyond the gallery, thus taking Pokey Hat to different neighbourhoods across Glasgow. The other venues include Centre for Contemporary Art, Jaconelli’s Café and Café Peña.

What your support will mean to us
 

We need your help to make Pokey Hat, the second stage of this project, happen. By supporting this project you will help us cover

50% of artist fees for Pokey Hat
50% of the production costs of newly commissioned works for Pokey Hat
elements of our public events programme

Please join us to support the artists that we work with!
It means the world to us that we can acknowledge the value of artists’ meaningful labour and, as fair collaborators, support artists’ everyday and future practice by providing appropriate conditions for development of new work.   VERBureau
 VERBureau is an independent non-profit curatorial collective that produces interdisciplinary projects across the UK and abroad. Our key aims are to foster collaboration, support artistic practices sensitive to the current socio-political climate and advocate open discussion. We are committed to providing valuable opportunities for the artists and other practitioners that we work with. We maintain a non-hierarchical organisation that runs on consensus-based decision making. The collective members are based in Glasgow, London and Moscow.

http://verbureau.co.uk | @VERBureau   

Risks & Challenges

The combination of Who Owns the Cone? and Pokey Hat is the most complex project we have produced so far, but we believe that our professional commitment and competence will guarantee an exciting platform for artists to produce new work and for people based in as well as visiting Glasgow to engage with complex local histories and current socio-political discussions. We have already accomplished the first half of the project by organising a successful Who Owns the Cone? exhibition in New York and it was a great experience. You can learn more about the first half of the project here.

The timeline of the project is tight but, as an organised and dedicated team, we have prepared an elaborate action plan for delivering Pokey Hat in schedule and within budget. VERBureau has already produced a number of successful projects ranging from exhibitions and events programmes to publications. Within VERBureau, our professional skills and experience span curatorial and artistic practices, academic research, writing and publishing, development of educational programmes as well as communications and marketing. 

The artists are already in the process of developing and producing their work for Pokey Hat and we have established solid partnerships with Glasgow International, New Glasgow Society, Centre for Contemporary Art, the Village Storytelling Centre, Café d’Jaconelli, Peña, Glasgow based academics, members of the local Scots-Italian community and more. This means that we will have an immense amount of support throughout the project and we will be able to deliver it as successfully as our previous endeavours, including Who Owns the Cone? at Likky Ruph.
The exhibition and events in Glasgow will be held in many different locations and involve several organisations and individuals in different capacities. Whilst this could potentially make the project complicated to manage, with good planning and seamless communication these several partnerships are an incomparable resource. Invigilators and event hosts will be present at all times to ensure the safety of visitors, participants and artworks. The works will be packed, transported and installed professionally and accompanied by detailed condition reports and all project components will be covered by a public liability insurance. To ensure that the local communities will not feel alienated, VERBureau and the artists will approach this history sensitively with a VERBureau member raised in Glasgow in the lead.

Other Ways You Can Help 

We appreciate that not everyone can support us financially. If you feel that you would like to support our project in any other way, we would be happy to receive your help.
If you are an ice cream café or work in food/drinks industry in the UK, you can support us by product supply for one of our events. Please contact us to learn how you can benefit from this deal. If you are not able to donate this way, we would still be very grateful if you could allow us to promote this project through you by leaving some leaflets at your premises.
If you feel closely connected to the themes that our project aims to address, your advice on how to make the project more relatable, sensitive or inclusive would be valuable to us. We would be happy to hear from you.
If you are working in mass media, you can really help us by circulating information about our project and this campaign.
If you have any other creative ideas, suggestions or simply would like to ask us a question, please do not hesitate to contact us here or through our website at www.verbureau.co.uk.Please share this page on your websites, blogs and social networks and send the link directly to any contacts who might be interested in supporting our project.

These artistic and curatorial outcomes will become a foundation for more extensive academic research on the social history of ice cream. In collaboration with academics, artists and curators, this research will be compiled into an internationally distributed publication.

story:
The Atlantic Center for the Arts, New Smyrna Beach, Florida

I'm thrilled to accept this last-minute invitation. Over the course of the past year, ACA has received 350 applicants, of them 95 are invited to attend. For three weeks the Center will provide meals, a place to live, and studios to work in.  I’ll be steeped in my own work along with a group of seven other artists lead by master artist Jessica Craig-Martin. 

I plan to focus on photographing and drawing – my current project about recycling trucks will be the foundation from which to start. I will delve into recycling as a subject. Being away from the recycling trucks in my neighborhood I have been drawing will help me open the project up and approach it from a different perspective. 

What I Need and Where Your Money Goes

I am raising money for transportation (last minute airfare is expensive!), a residency fee, supplies including film and processing, photo and drawing papers, pencils, and shipping fees to send works home at the end of the residency. Every single donor will recieve something special from me directly -- see my list of perks on the right hand side of this page. Should the campaign be successful, any additional funds raised will be applied directly to my studio practice upon arrival home. This residency will provide a running start into the MFA program I will start in the fall.

My Work

See images here from my MFA application portfolio – it includes photographs, cut outs, and drawings from two projects: Antarctica With/Without, and Recycling Trucks.

Click here to see my Postcard Machine (Possibly from the Future) in action.

I’ve had the good fortune to work at Blue Bottle Coffee for the past six years and have done some wonderful work there! To see my illustrations or handwriting in action check out The Blue Bottle Craft of Coffee, R is for Rosetta A Blue Bottle Coloring Alphabet, or  visit bluebottlecoffee.com and any of our beautiful locations in the Bay Area or New York City. The coffee is SO GOOD.

You can also visit the indiegogo gallery for more of my work samples. Scroll to the top of this page and you'll see the "gallery" tab!

More Details

I live and work in Oakland, CA and found out a month ago that I am admitted to Berkeley’s MFA program. Grad school is a huge personal goal and I’ve been hurriedly making plans to be ready for the fall semester.

And, when fortune rains, it pours! The last-minute nature of the residency invitation requires more resources than I currently have. You can help me by donating, or, if your pockets are as empty as mine, please pass this along to your fellow art enthusiasts

Sincere Thanks!

story:
ME

I am a 65 year old artist living in Corvallis, MT. I have exhibited many years ago in Allan Stone Gallery in New York, Roy Boyd in Chicago and Los Angeles, Simard Helm Gallery in Los Angeles and most recently in 2011 at Robert Berman Gallery in Los Angeles. I have shown in numerous group shows both nationally as well as internationally. I have painted murals in the USA as well as Thailand and China. I am not a famous artist yet I am not unknown.

While living and exhibiting in Thailand in the early 90's my beautiful daughter Dao Ann Slagter was born to her Thai mother and my wife, Gulap. We returned to the states when she was 2 years old so she could have a better life. I took a break from my daily practice of painting to open a mural company as I felt that I would be able to spend more time raising my daughter. It went well enough to support and raise my family, not in any high style but well enough to live. We left Los Angeles and moved to Montana in 2006. I wanted my daughter to have "roots" and values that she could fall back on as an adult and to see that beauty really does exist. Although it has been financially very difficult here we enjoyed a very nice life until 7 months ago when my daughter passed in an auto accident at 17 years of age. A devastating and life changing event for my wife and I. I started seriously painting again at my daughters insistence 6 years ago and some of that work can be seen on my website as well as the work exhibited at Robert Berman Gallery last year.

This project titled "CALL TO DUTY" is the first work I have done since my daughter's death. In my 65 years I have watched aghast as our country has degenerated into a nation of sleeping and complacent people. Our morals, values and integrity as a nation have slipped away. We are now the most aggressive nation on the face of the earth. Many people are waking to the fact that our government has become too large and uncontrollable and they also are becoming aware of the massive corruption from the federal to the local level.

Our loss of liberty as a nation and loss of personal liberty continues unhindered on a daily basis. We seem to be too asleep to stop it. We are on the brink of a massive world war as well as teetering on the precipice of a complete financial collapse nationally and globally. There is constant talk in the streets and alternative media of an impending civil war and massive social unrest which will be squelched mercilessly by an ever expanding internal police force with the help of US military and potentially UN troops. The Constitution has been shredded and deemed insignificant by many of our politicians. We have given complete control of the US currency to a group of private world bankers who are taking away homes, jobs and industry from millions of US citizens and the people of the world.

We are all aware of the famous meme of the "wake up slap". In this series my images are a "wake up slap" and a "call to duty" for many of our politicians, bankers, non governmental employees, corporate heads, military and the American people. In some cases they will be of specific people who have changed the world in less than positive ways that we are uniformed of. Other images will be of legislation and some of the concepts that have caused our loss of liberties. All images will have information in the text that informs the viewer of the reason for the slap. Viewers can take the opportunity to research this information for themselves and make informed decisions about the state of our country. For instance United Nations Agenda 21 and United Nations Codex Alimentarius. Many of us have never heard of these two agendas, and even fewer understand their full implications. Both have been approved by our government and implementation is taking place. The former will ultimately result in the complete loss of sovereignty for our nation and the formation of a global currency and one world global government. The latter takes away the right of the people to feed themselves in a natural and healthy manner. Both have hugely detrimental  programs of eugenics and control as there ultimate goal. As you awaken you will see how just these two agendas are being implemented in your local area as well as nationally and globally.

                 

                                 Be An American Eagle

This print informs about the recent authorization of 30,000 drones over the USA authorized by the Federal Aviation Authority. H.R. 658 FAA Modernization And Reform Act of 2012.    A link to the actual legislation:  http://www.govtrack.us/congress/bills/112/hr658  and a link to a discussion about it:  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qg1TAAqrqMo.   With additional interest and research you can be informed and make up your own mind about this legislation.  

 

FUNDING

All funding for this project will be used for the design, development, printing and shipping of this project. Even if the goal is not reached I intend to finish this project funded or unfunded and prints will be available on my website and other outlets on the web. Currently 5 prints are finished and can be seen here and in the "gallery" section of this site.
The majority of the funds will be used to print the posters using offset lithography. This has to be done in large runs and cannot be printed on a one print basis. The other 2 signed limited editions can be done as single prints as they are funded.
 
To print the posters I need a minimum of $1000.00 per each image as they are printed with offset lithography and so must be all printed at the same time.

In the event the goal is not meant I will print what posters the budget allows and they will be sent to contributors. I will print the posters in the order of the list below.

If the goal is not met and the budget does not allow for the printing of any posters, all contributors at those reward levels will receive (1) unsigned, open edition, 9" x 12" fine art print, my choice, in lieu of the poster.

All contributors of rewards for limited edition fine art prints are guaranteed they will receive their reward.

Shipping costs are included with the contribution. No additional costs for shipping.

All art will be mailed in tubes and sent FedEx inside the USA and USPS Internationally.

If my goal is reached I will start the printing and sending rewards as soon as i receive the funds. All artwork and printing files will be finished by the funding date. This should be about 8 weeks into the project. I will mail out rewards as each is printed. I will keep all contributors posted on the upcoming printing and mailing dates.

When the editions are sold out, no new prints will be made.

 

 
 
  
 

              Barack Obama, President, U.S.A.

This print informs about Obama's involvement in U.N. Agenda 21: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CEHWsdimVO4 , Codex Alimentarius: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fb_y4tL3b3I , Posse Comitatus: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vC4_6tnjI8g , Lybia: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s5Juspl5K8E , Fast and Furious: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vgil5gKBwWE , FEMA, Drones, GMOs and NWO connections: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eAaQNACwaLw 

 

IMPACT

Your contributions to this project will help wake up America to just how many loses of rights and liberties that have already occurred and of future dangers to our great nation. There is only one way this nation can retain it's greatness and attempt to avert the impending disaster. That is by becoming AWAKE and INFORMED  and then taking action. The most important action is to help wake up your friends and neighbors. Shout from the rooftops and help save this great nation before it is to late. And that day is approaching rapidly.

This is your chance to own a piece of fine art that documents the complete overturning of humanity on a global scale. While our times are dangerous and uncertain I still feel privileged to have lived long enough to see the amazing awakening that is happening globally.

Even if you can't contribute financially please share and spread these images across the internet and the globe as a way to "do your duty" and help inform a sleeping but ever awakening public.

   

         Willard "Mitt" Romney

                                 GOP Presidential Candidate 2012

This print informs about Romney's illegal campaign activity: FECA sect. 441E: http://www.veteranstoday.com/2012/08/12/foreign... , and his involvement with Monsanto and GMOs: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EbhtUhebzic

 

THE PROJECT

Currently 5 images are finished. I will finish 1 more per week for the next 5 weeks. As each piece is finished I will post it on this site. With each new posting I will again add links to the description so you can start research on each subject for yourself.

The work will be printed by Art Works Fine Art Publishing in Los Angeles, CA.   http://www.fineartpublishing.com/   Art Works prints for some of the west coast's finest artists and galleries.

10 individual images published and offered in three editions.

The first edition will be 27" x 36" printed as an open, unsigned edition of posters.

The second edition will be a 9" x 12" fine art print, signed and limited to 100 each printed on 16 lb. matte stock.

The third edition will be a beautiful 18" x 24" fine art print. It will be limited to 50 signed and numbered prints of each image. They will be printed on 100% rag archival watercolor paper.

 

   

 Ben Bernanke, Chairman Federal Reserve

This print informs about Ben Bernanke:  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ben_Bernanke, the Federal Reserve  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Reserve_Sy..., 1913 Federal Reserve Act: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lu_VqX6J93k and Quantitative Easing 1,2 and Infinity: http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_emb.... You will learn that the Federal Reserve is neither "Federal" or "Reserve" and is a private banking cartel, not a part of the U.S. government.

 

A list of the subjects :

1. BARACK OBAMA     (CONSTITUTION, ETC.)  Finished

2. MITT ROMNEY       (FECA, MONSANTO, BAIN CAPITAL)  Finished

3. BEN BERNANKE      (FEDERAL RESERVE)  Finished

4. JANET NAPOLITANO   (DHS, FEMA, TSA)  Finished

5. DRONES  Finished

6. RON PAUL    (QUITTING)  Working

7. BILL GATES    (GMOs and VACCINES)

8. HENRY KISSINGER    (NATIONAL SECURITY STUDY MEMORANDUM 200)

9. US MILITARY     (STAND DOWN, DO NOT FIRE ON U.S. CITIZENS)

10. NEW WORLD ORDER   (GLOBAL DOMINANCE AND MANIPULATION)

                                

Janet Napolitano, Secretary Homeland Security

This print informs about DHS, FEMA, TSA: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AOOM5DDOpRk , FEMA coffins: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qBstzHEyHgI , Fusion Centers:  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pXG3Ipv6C0g , H.R. 6566:  http://beforeitsnews.com/survival/2012/10/h-r-6... , 1.6B bullets purchased in 2012: http://www.infowars.com/dhs-purchases-200-milli... and RAPS Robotic Aircraft For Public Safety (drones in USA): http://rt.com/usa/news/dhs-us-public-safety-019/

 


AFTERWARDS

If this project is successfully funded I will continue the project with another 10 images.

I will also publish a book of all 20 images if both projects are funded fully.  Please help make this project a reality.

 

A list of the planned subjects for the second phase:

11. HILLARY CLINTON    (LIBYA, CFR)

12. BILL O'REILLY         (CONTROLLED MAINSTREAM MEDIA)

13. GEORGE BUSH        (9/11, AFGHANISTAN, IRAQ, PATRIOT ACT, ETC.)

14. DONALD RUMSFELD     (9/11, AFGHANISTAN, IRAQ, PATRIOT ACT,          
                                        ASPARTAME, ETC.)

15. MONSANTO       (GMOS)

16. TRANSHUMANISM  

17. AMERICAN PEOPLE     (SLEEP AND COMPLACENCY)

18. ERIC HOLDER   (FAST AND FURIOUS)

19. POLICE         (ESCALATING BRUTALITY)

20. COLIN POWELL     (LIES ABOUT WMD)

The other 2 signed limited editions can be done as single prints as they are funded. To print the posters I need a minimum of $1000.00 per each image as they are printed with offset lithography and so must be all printed at the same time.In the event the goal is not meant I will print what posters the budget allows and they will be sent to contributors. I will print the posters in the order of the list below. If the goal is not met and the budget does not allow for the printing of any posters, all contributors at those reward levels will receive (1) unsigned, open edition, 9" x 12" fine art print, my choice, in lieu of the poster.All contributors of rewards for limited edition fine art prints are guaranteed they will receive their reward.Shipping costs are included with the contribution. No additional costs for shipping.All art will be mailed in tubes and sent FedEx inside the USA and USPS Internationally.If my goal is reached I will start the printing and sending rewards as soon as i receive the funds. All artwork and printing files will be finished by the funding date. This should be about 8 weeks into the project. I will mail out rewards as each is printed. I will keep all contributors posted on the upcoming printing and mailing dates.When the editions are sold out, no new prints will be made.
 
 
 
   

 
              Barack Obama, President, U.S.A.
This print informs about Obama's involvement in U.N. Agenda 21: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CEHWsdimVO4 , Codex Alimentarius: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fb_y4tL3b3I , Posse Comitatus: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vC4_6tnjI8g , Lybia: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=s5Juspl5K8E , Fast and Furious: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Vgil5gKBwWE , FEMA, Drones, GMOs and NWO connections: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eAaQNACwaLw 

 
IMPACT
Your contributions to this project will help wake up America to just how many loses of rights and liberties that have already occurred and of future dangers to our great nation. There is only one way this nation can retain it's greatness and attempt to avert the impending disaster. That is by becoming AWAKE and INFORMED  and then taking action. The most important action is to help wake up your friends and neighbors. Shout from the rooftops and help save this great nation before it is to late. And that day is approaching rapidly.This is your chance to own a piece of fine art that documents the complete overturning of humanity on a global scale. While our times are dangerous and uncertain I still feel privileged to have lived long enough to see the amazing awakening that is happening globally.Even if you can't contribute financially please share and spread these images across the internet and the globe as a way to "do your duty" and help inform a sleeping but ever awakening public.
    
         Willard "Mitt" Romney
                                 GOP Presidential Candidate 2012

This print informs about Romney's illegal campaign activity: FECA sect. 441E: http://www.veteranstoday.com/2012/08/12/foreign... , and his involvement with Monsanto and GMOs: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EbhtUhebzic
 
THE PROJECT
Currently 5 images are finished. I will finish 1 more per week for the next 5 weeks. As each piece is finished I will post it on this site. With each new posting I will again add links to the description so you can start research on each subject for yourself. The work will be printed by Art Works Fine Art Publishing in Los Angeles, CA.   http://www.fineartpublishing.com/   Art Works prints for some of the west coast's finest artists and galleries. 10 individual images published and offered in three editions.The first edition will be 27" x 36" printed as an open, unsigned edition of posters.The second edition will be a 9" x 12" fine art print, signed and limited to 100 each printed on 16 lb. matte stock.
The third edition will be a beautiful 18" x 24" fine art print. It will be limited to 50 signed and numbered prints of each image. They will be printed on 100% rag archival watercolor paper.
 
    
 Ben Bernanke, Chairman Federal Reserve
This print informs about Ben Bernanke:  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ben_Bernanke, the Federal Reserve  http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Federal_Reserve_Sy..., 1913 Federal Reserve Act: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=lu_VqX6J93k and Quantitative Easing 1,2 and Infinity: http://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_emb.... You will learn that the Federal Reserve is neither "Federal" or "Reserve" and is a private banking cartel, not a part of the U.S. government.
 
A list of the subjects :
1. BARACK OBAMA     (CONSTITUTION, ETC.)  Finished2. MITT ROMNEY       (FECA, MONSANTO, BAIN CAPITAL)  Finished3. BEN BERNANKE      (FEDERAL RESERVE)  Finished4. JANET NAPOLITANO   (DHS, FEMA, TSA)  Finished5. DRONES  Finished6. RON PAUL    (QUITTING)  Working7. BILL GATES    (GMOs and VACCINES)8. HENRY KISSINGER    (NATIONAL SECURITY STUDY MEMORANDUM 200)9. US MILITARY     (STAND DOWN, DO NOT FIRE ON U.S. CITIZENS)10. NEW WORLD ORDER   (GLOBAL DOMINANCE AND MANIPULATION)
                                
Janet Napolitano, Secretary Homeland Security
This print informs about DHS, FEMA, TSA: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AOOM5DDOpRk , FEMA coffins: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qBstzHEyHgI , Fusion Centers:  http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pXG3Ipv6C0g , H.R. 6566:  http://beforeitsnews.com/survival/2012/10/h-r-6... , 1.6B bullets purchased in 2012: http://www.infowars.com/dhs-purchases-200-milli... and RAPS Robotic Aircraft For Public Safety (drones in USA): http://rt.com/usa/news/dhs-us-public-safety-019/
 

AFTERWARDS
If this project is successfully funded I will continue the project with another 10 images.
I will also publish a book of all 20 images if both projects are funded fully.  Please help make this project a reality.
 
A list of the planned subjects for the second phase:
11. HILLARY CLINTON    (LIBYA, CFR)12. BILL O'REILLY         (CONTROLLED MAINSTREAM MEDIA)13. GEORGE BUSH        (9/11, AFGHANISTAN, IRAQ, PATRIOT ACT, ETC.)14. DONALD RUMSFELD     (9/11, AFGHANISTAN, IRAQ, PATRIOT ACT,                                                  ASPARTAME, ETC.)15. MONSANTO       (GMOS)16. TRANSHUMANISM  17. AMERICAN PEOPLE     (SLEEP AND COMPLACENCY)18. ERIC HOLDER   (FAST AND FURIOUS)19. POLICE         (ESCALATING BRUTALITY)20. COLIN POWELL     (LIES ABOUT WMD)

story:
A full list of Perks WITH PICTURES of EACH is available at:

www.dogpawpottery.ca 

PICKING-UP Locally? No Problem.  NOW choose the Perk WITHOUT the shipping cost!

Short Summary

Hi, I'm Meg!  I'm a ceramic artist and educator based in Thunder Bay, Ontario and I follow my heart in all that I do. 
For years, I worked hard as an Outdoor Educator and it's felt effortless to apply those specialized skills to my passion for ceramic arts.  As a self-taught artist, I'm also lucky to have been mentored by an amazing local potter who is now a dear friend. 
Over the years, I've created studio space in two commercial locations, but leasing has never been an ideal option for many reasons. Because of this I converted a tiny room in my basement into a semi-functional workspace. However, orders to fill and a growing wait list of students means I can no longer meet the demand to both teach and produce in my current space. 
So... I'm building a new studio in my own backyard!  This will happen one way or another BUT I would LOVE to have your help on this journey!


With gratitude and excitement from all of us: 

Scott, my partner and dedicated studio assistant; Jala, our daughter and young apprentice; the huskies, the namesakes of Dog Paw; and me, the soulful trailblazer. xo


www.dogpawpottery.ca

What We Need & What You Get

Building a studio from scratch is incredibly exciting for so many reasons, but most importantly, it will provide a creative and functional workspace for me and for my students, and ensure that I'm just a few steps away from my growing family. 

I am already partnered with many local vendors and organizations (Sweet Escape Bakery, Both Hands Pizzeria, International House of Tea, Belluz Farms, and The Loop Clothing as well as non-profit Roots to Harvest) but it can be a struggle to meet the demand because of space and therefore time constraints. 

With your help, I'll be able to create more wares, fill orders more efficiently, and welcome more students into the studio. 


The new studio will be 20' x 30', with an earthy and simplistic design. It will also be cost effective, sustainable, eco friendly and beautiful, matching with my values. I am asking for 50,000 which will be the cost of the building:

Metal Roof - $2,900

Lumber - $4,650

Concrete - $8,750

In-floor heat - $3,075

Hardware - $1,560

New/Used windows and doors - $3,200

Labour - $11,400

Insulation - $5,270

Sheeting - $1,400

Drywall - $2,750

Stairs and Railing - $2,100

Siding - $1,600

Drafting Services - $2,000

Total: $50,655


I will also be purchasing the following large equipment when money allows.  If there is additional money that comes in, it will help me buy the following (in order):

- 8 new wheels @ $1000/wheel ($8000)

-1 slab roller @ $1000

-1 pug mill (reclaiming/wedging clay) @ $6000


I am so entirely committed to this plan that I am going to build this studio and get this equipment no matter what.  Because of this, I have decided to do a FLEXIBLE campaign where every dollar counts toward my end goal. 


What You Get…

the PERKS!

Check out the full list of perks WITH pictures here!

$5 - Personalized THANK YOU!

$15 - EXCLUSIVE! Ceramic Cupcake Keychain (AND Discounted Baked Goods)

$30 - Breathing Bowl

$45 - EXCLUSIVE! Dog Paw T-Shirt

$60 - EXCLUSIVE! Carved Mountain and Treescape Travel Mugs 

$65 - EXCLUSIVE! Studio Concert with Arley Hughes 

$75 - Both Hands Wood Fired Pizza and Drinks for 2

$100 - EXCLUSIVE! Contributor Appreciation Party 

$125 - EXCLUSIVE! Driftwood and Ceramic Hanging Mini-Planters 

$160 - EXCLUSIVE! Custom Wildlings Set

$200 - Large Hand-cut Treescape Fruitbowl

$250 - Learn with me Workshop

$300 - Set of 6 Lg. Mugs (Choose from 9 glazes)

$600 - Teapot + 6 Tumblers (Choose from 9 glazes)

$700 - A Mug A Month Club Subscription 

$950 - EXCLUSIVE! Sunset Flight over Thunder Bay for 2 with Jason Hughes

$1200 - Dinnerware set for 8 (Choose from 9 glazes)

$1500 - Dinnerware set for 12 (Choose from 9 glazes)

$2000 - EXCLUSIVE! 'What's Your Story?' Workshop FOR 8

with Meg Sheepway and Angela Gollat

$2500 - EXCLUSIVE! Private Dinner for 8 AND Take Home the Dishes! 


Check out my website for a full list with descriptions and photos of each perk available to you:

www.dogpawpottery.ca


The Impact - Why does it matter?

A profound question for me while preparing this campaign has been: Why would people help me build my dream?

~In my pottery you will find meaningful, savvy and functional designs, each their own piece of art. 

~I offer a space for folks to play with and realize their own artistry, take creative risks and invest in their own well-being. 

~I always get excited when I can support others' living their dream and that will be something you will experience through supporting me and participating in crowd-funding ... I will be living my dream. 

In a lot of ways this project is small and local but I believe the impact of it goes much further than that. The realization that an artist is in each of us can alter the way we relate to the world, to our own innate creativity therefore affecting confidence and creative courage.  I have learned this about myself and reaching toward this goal helps me reach others with these ideas through classes but also through the idea that my passion for pottery can become an abundant career for me and my family. 

 I have had the opportunity to work with incredible people, being in class and sharing this all IN Community has quickly become one of my most favourite activities. Here are some TESTIMONIALS:

 From Brenda Philips: 

"This fall I responded to an ad on my Facebook page…it was Kismet! I had been thinking of taking pottery classes once again, but, hadn’t really done too much research. Meg Sheepway of Dogpaw Pottery was taking students!

Having never heard of Meg, I checked out her website and fell in love! Meg’s pottery, her philosophy, her love of life had me.

Now, after three sessions, I have found a new release…I will never be a production potter, that is not my desire. My desire is to add something to my life that enhances me…

Meg’s positivity and encouragement has made such a difference in what I do at the wheel. Her warm and welcoming classes have made my evenings so enjoyable. Visits from her adorable daughter, a warm nuzzle from one of her dogs, and the companionship of the other students is something quite unique. Conversations are inspiring and insightful, humour and laughter makes the atmosphere in her studio nothing like I’ve ever experienced.

I thank Meg for all she has given me, a new sense of well being and worth. Nothing I create is frowned upon and each piece is celebrated!

I hope to be a life long student of Meg’s (she may get tired of seeing my face). I can not express my appreciation for her enough, she is amazing!" 

(THANKS Brenda!) 


(Photo: Choice of 9 Glazes)

From Alyssa Wood:

"I joined Meg's classes in hopes of walking away with beautiful pottery but I ended up with much more. Thursday nights became the highlight of my week; a chance to unwind, share, laugh, learn and to be creative. Meg not only provided wonderful guidance and empowered me to create stunning pieces but she also  created a beautiful atmosphere for us to open up and let the stress of a week in fade away! I feel so grateful to have had the opportunity for the therapeutic powers of Meg's words and pottery in my life and am glad her love will be spread further with a larger space to do so! 

Thanks again meg! I can't wait for my next class!"

(THANKS Alyssa!)

From Arley Hughes: 

"Allow yourself to get lost in each piece... I find myself revelling over a particular patch of glaze or colour; there is just something magical about sipping tea out of Meg's mugs. Dog Paw Pottery is pure comfort and love that are made by what must be some of the most energetic and light bearing hands in the pottery world. "

(THANKS Arley!)

From the most wonderful lady EVER at the 2015 Potters' Guild Xmas Show, Thunder Bay, ON

"I am 73 years old dear, I have seen a lot of pottery! Yours might be the most beautiful I have ever seen. I'm serious." 

(Thank YOU dear :) )

Risks & Challenges

There have been many new learnings I have experienced through this process, learning about building buildings, permits, iMovie, loans, grants, business plans, crowd-funding - already I have overcome so many challenges.  :) 
Here are some others --> 
~ Getting permits from the city: This took a lot of work on my part and the part of some other key players but I am happy to say this challenge is completed. Yay!
~ Finished before the snow flies: Because we live in Thunder Bay, our season is short so we are starting in early June and plan to have the studio closed in and finished by summers end. Yay! 
~  the PERKS! There are so many PERKS in my campaign and it is going to take me many hours to complete them. Because of this I have called in extra help as well as calculated by hours and effort and created a detailed schedule. This way, I can be working on the PERKS along side my everyday teaching and production, getting product to people at in reasonable time. 
~ Funding Gap:  There is a chance that my Indiegogo campaign won't fund my entire project but because I know this project is happening regardless, I have secured a more traditional funding route just in case. (Fingers crossed ;))
~ Lastly, I have always had an entrepreneurial spirit but art is vulnerable and sometimes I find it hard to base a business off of that part of myself.   Because of my life as a mom, personal life challenges, work with youth groups and facilitating others through tricky situations in the outdoors, I have learned that a big part of working through this is learning and practicing being vulnerable AND being ok with it.  


Other Ways You Can Help

 Every single cent is helping me raise this studio from the ground up... so first of all, THANK you, from the deepest places of my being. 

 If you happen to be interested in doing more...Share, share SHARE!! ;D Because everyone helping is so essential, the more people this reaches, the better - in more ways then anyone can know.

 With immense appreciation, I thank you all. 

Meg :D 

www.dogpawpottery.ca

story: CANCELLED
story_txt: CANCELLED

story:
The Yoknapatawpha Arts Council serves our entire community.  Our staff, Board, volunteers and partners work to provide new experiences for your family through the arts. It has been your on going support that has made it possible for talented artists to enrich our community, provide opportunities for everyone to be part of the creative process, and launch new programs that will continue to define us as an Arts community.

Your membership is key to our ability to plan a full year of programming. A membership in the arts council is an investment in our community.  Membership donations provide the resources for the Arts Council to seed educational programs, support community projects such as the Summer Concert Series in the Grove, and offer free events such as the Oxford Art Crawl.  I invite you to renew your membership and join us at our annual membership event on Saturday, May 11, 2013 at The Powerhouse Community Arts Center from 4pm-7pm.

This year we will hold our membership picnic in the sculpture garden. We hope you will join us as we dedicate the SculptureGarden and invite you to be part of the continued renovation and expansion of The Powerhouse.  This historic building is the most versatile tool the Arts Council has in providing arts programming that enriches our community.  It provides a home for performing arts groups, educational programs for all ages, hosts cultural programs, and offers local artist a space to showcase their work. In just the past few years, with the support you provide, over $500,000 of improvements have been completed on the building from new theatre seats, lighting and sound equipment,  backstage, and the sculpture garden.

These enhancements have made it possible to present original works by performers, a venue for screening independent films, class space for children and adult programs, and attracted national tours to our community. The Arts Council’s long range plans will transform the remainder of the building, offering dedicated classroom space, a rehearsal studio, and space for artists. All that we offer the community is because of your support. I ask you to please renew your membership today

In just the past few years, with the support you provide, over $500,000 of improvements have been completed on the building from new theatre seats, lighting and sound equipment,  backstage, and the sculpture garden.
These enhancements have made it possible to present original works by performers, a venue for screening independent films, class space for children and adult programs, and attracted national tours to our community. The Arts Council’s long range plans will transform the remainder of the building, offering dedicated classroom space, a rehearsal studio, and space for artists. All that we offer the community is because of your support. I ask you to please renew your membership today

story:
Update: We reached our goal in what may be a record: 3 hours!! Whoa. We're totally floored.

But even though we reached our goal, we still need your help! We pretty much wiped out our funds to make 2013 happen, so we will need to raise a lot of money for next year. And we still have some really great perks! Everything we raise from here on out will go towards 2014. And we're gonna need it: 2014's probably going to cost about $20,000! So please keep supporting SF's biggest and best trans pride event!!

 

Who are we?

The San Francisco Trans March is SF's largest transgender Pride event and one of the largest trans events in the entire world. It's always the Friday of Pride weekend and thousands of people attend. This year the March will be June 28 in Dolores Park and there's lots of big fun, huge celebration and awesome community building just waiting for you!

The theme for this year's March is "Trans March X: Celebrating a Decade of Change."

 

 

What We Need & What You Get!

The March is organized and run entirely by volunteers from the community. Our Board of Directors and a committed group of community members work hard to ensure that everthing we do supports our mission and vision. The event itself is the result of hard work by many, many people doing things big and small.

Unfortunately, we need more than just volunteers to make the March happen. The event costs about $18,000 and that covers things like city permitting fees, stage rental, the sound system, ASL interpretation, the trolley for those with mobility issues, the youth/elder brunch and a whole mess of other expenses. We were hit with some additional fees this year from the city, including a $1000 increase in the park rental fee and a new fee of $700 to have EMTs on site. We usually raise money through grants and sponsorships, but we still need quite a bit directly from the community to make the event happen in the style to which we would like you to grow accustomed.

In return for your generous donation, you'll receive some pretty great rewards including stickers, posters, invites to our appreciation party, shirts, and maybe more if we manage to meet certain fundraising goals. Check out the pics of the perks in our gallery!

 

2013 poster:

 

The Impact

What will your contribution help pay for?

  • $1 pays for 30 seconds of ASL interpretation, something we've been proud to offer every year of the Trans March!
  • $5 pays for one young person or one elder to receive a FREE Trans March t-shirt at the youth/elder brunch
  • $10 pays for one month of our website hosting fees
  • $25 pays for one elder or one person with dis/abilities to ride the trolley
  • $50 pays for 15 minutes of on-site Emergency Medical Technicians to help keep you safe!
  • $100 pays for one booth for our youth/elder brunch
  • $250 pays for all of our clean up fees!
  • $500 pays the Dolores Park reservation fee

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally get that these aren't the easiest economic times and not everyone's in a position to help out financially. That's totally okay! If you want to help make the March the best it can be, there are plenty of other ways you can help.

  • Share our campaign with your friends. The more people we get the word to, the more likely we'll reach our goal.
  • Comment on this campaign. Not only will you be letting us and the world know what you think of the March, you'll also help us increase our chances of getting on the indiegogo home page where we'll get tons more exposure.
  • Click the Like, Tweet snf +1 links at the top of the page. The more likes, tweets and +1s, the higher our chances of getting to the indiegogo home page.
  • Like our facebook page or Follow our twitter account. We all know social media's where it's at, right?
  • Invite people to the event. You can do this easily by adding people to the fb event.
  • Volunteer with the March. We always have a need for more volunteers to do jobs both big and small, so email us at volunteers@transmarch.org.
  • Wear purple to the March. Why? We're trying to make a strong visual statement for the media by having the community united in color so we'll get more and better coverage from them. And united in color, united in pride, right?
  • Promote the March as an all ages event and Save your partying for after the March. We want youth, families, seniors, and sober folks all to feel safe and welcome, so do us a favor and leave the intoxicants at home, huh?
  • Attend the march. We want to make this the biggest and best year yet, so show up and define your moment!

This year is going to be really amazing, but it can't happen without you. Get involved in any way you can and make this year's March the biggest, best and most badass Trans March ever!

story:
Project Summary

The Nemeth Art Center was founded in 1977 when a group of local residents raised the funds to purchase a collection of European paintings dating to the Renaissance. These works, now known as the Gabor and Edith Nemeth Study Collection, have been enjoyed and treasured by the Park Rapids community ever since.

During our off season months and when the paintings are not exhibited, they are stored in our on-site storage room. Currently, that room is woefully inadequate and the long term health of the paintings is in jeopardy. In the new storage system, each painting will get its own designated cubby, with paintings staying as close to vertical as possible while not touching each other. The system, designed by a senior art proprietor of the Minneapolis Institute of Arts, will help minimize future damage to the priceless paintings. If you give to this campaign, you will be helping to ensure the continued health of this collection.

What We Need & What You Get

Your contribution will go towards the supplies needed to build this structure. Wood, screws, carpet and other building materials will be purchased with the donations. Brian Stieler, of the Minneapolis Institute of Arts, has graciously volunteered his time in designing and building the structure.

For your donation, you can get such perks as a Nemeth Art Center T-Shirt, an original print from our upcoming Midwest Multiples juried show, or your name on a plaque recognizing our primary contributors.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute to this campaign at this time, please consider passing along the information by posting to Facebook or emailing others who you think may be interested. The Nemeth Art Center is also always looking for volunteers, so if you'd like to help out in person, please email volunteer@nemethartcenter.org.

story:
I am Nora Huszka, an artist from Hungary, I live in Berlin but at the moment I am traveling through Italy, the birthplace of the Tarot Cards, to complete my project.

The idea is to combine three things to create something unique: my arts, tarot cards and YOU. This project is in my heart, because I find it very important that art and magic can get some space in everyday life to make it more beautiful and colourful.

I put a lot of energy into this project for the past years and we are very close to complete it together on Indiegogo!

 

Let me invite You to The Gypsy Palace !

I am drawing for many years and I read the tarot cards as well. These things supported my life and at one point there were ready to support each other too. I flicked through my pictures and I realized they will find their perfect places as tarot cards. My aim was to create a whole tarot card deck, 78 cards, in high, artistic, handmade quality while keeping the traditional meaning of the Rider Waite Tarot.

I dug deeper in the meanings to find the perfectly matching picture and of course, I had to create lots of new versions. I had to create the design to the cards, choosing colours, drawing a frame, making the pictures ready to print on the computer, creating a special handmade font for them and write the names on each of them in four languages (English, German, Italian, Hungarian) and so on.

It was all worth it. Now they are ready to communicate with You and to come alive in your hands.

I am proud of them and I would be pleased if You feel like being a part of making it come true.

 

And all for You!

Your role has a great importance, because your donations will go straight into printing costs. I want to print 1000 packs in high quality. That means it will be a limited edition card set.

And from the printer they will go straight to your home as You wish!

 

Worth to read the perks for special offers!

You can own the original Gypsy Palace Tarot deck, or the Special Editions with handmade magic bags, signed and personalized for You.

But there is more here: for your support I also offer my knowledge about reading the tarot cards, to give something personal. Did you ever had a card reading?

Check the perks for more information and choose for yourself or for a person You love!

 

About The Gypsy Palace Tarot philosophy

I choose the name The Gypsy Palace for this deck, for two reasons: first, because the colours, the atmosphere of my pictures has a flavour of the gypsy art, and secondly, because card reading has a great tradition in gypsy culture. The gypsy culture has its roots in India, but made a long journey through Spain and eastern Europe and so on, that is why it became a very strong, vivid culture. As travelers, their palace was not a building, but their well kept tradition, like fortune telling and card reading.

 

So use The Gypsy Palace Tarot card deck as a tool to get in contact with your inner self, motivations, hopes or fears. It is a free chosen way- inspires your imagination, relaxes your mind and like a little ritual, brings you out of the routine. Give yourself a chance to open for little magic and get started on the adventurous way to know yourself!

THANK YOU very much for reading this, for watching the video, for sharing it with the people around You, for supporting this project.

WE can make it come true!

 

THE GYPSY PALACE Tarot by Nora Huszka

- high quality print  (playing card Quartett standards)

- 410g playing card paper, enameled

- 70 x 120 mm corners rounded

- 78 Tarot Cards meaning based on "Rider Waite Tarot"

- in 4 languages (English, German, Italian, Hungarian)

- limited 1000x edition worldwide

- text and numbers will be embedded in gold

- for special Perks signed and/or handmade bags

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to see the Gypsy Palace Tarot in print, please spread the word. Tweet, post to Facebook, your Wordpress blog, Tarot Forums, or any other media you have access to.

Thank you so much for your encouragement and support.

 

I wrote a short article about this card deck, please visit me on my blog.

Read the Interview with me by Shaheen Miro.

Please, follow me on facebook and join us, we welcome You!

If You have any questions or opinion feel free to contact me!

CURRENCY CONVERTER

EUR in USD                         EUR in GBP

15       75                            15       75

25       100                          25       100

40       150                          40       150

50       250                          50       250

 

>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>>> D E U T S C H  <<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<<

 

 

Ich bin Nora Huszka, ein Künstler aus Ungarn, ich wohne in Berlin, aber im Moment reise ich durch Italien, die Geburtsstätte der Tarot-Karten, um mein Projekt abzuschließen.

Die Idee ist, drei Dinge zu kombinieren, um etwas Einzigartiges zu schaffen: meine Kunst, Tarotkarten und Dich. Dieses Projekt ist in meinem Herzen, weil ich es sehr wichtig finde, dass Kunst und Magie mehr Platz im Alltag bekommt.

Ich habe viel Energie und Liebe in dieses Projekt gesteckt und wir sind sehr nah, es zusammen zum Leben zu erwecken!

 

Ich lade Sie ein zum  Gypsy Palast!

Ich bin seit vielen Jahren am zeichnen und ich lese auch die Tarot-Karten. Diese Dinge unterstützten mein Leben und nun können beide einander unterstützen. Ich schaute durch meine Bilder und habe erkannt, dass sie perfekt zu den Tarot-Karten passen. Mein Ziel war es, eine ganze Tarot Kartenspiel, 78 Karten, in hoher, künstlerischen, handgemachter Qualität zu schaffen, während Ich die traditionelle Bedeutung aus dem Rider Waite Tarot Karten beibehalte.

Ich grub tiefer in den Bedeutungen, die perfekt passenden Bilder zu finden und natürlich musste ich viele neue Versionen erstellen. Ich musste das Design mit den Karten erstellen, die Farben auswählen, einen Rahmen gestalten, erstellung einer speziellen handgefertigten Schrift und die Namen auf jeden von ihnen in vier Sprachen (Englisch, Deutsch, Italienisch, Ungarisch).

Es war es wert. Jetzt sind sie bereit, mit Ihnen zu kommunizieren und können in Ihre Händen lebendig werden.

Ich bin stolz auf sie und ich würde mich freuen, wenn Sie ein Teil dafür beitragen.

 

Und das alles ist für Sie!

Ihre Rolle hat eine große Bedeutung, weil Ihre Spenden geradeaus in die Druckkosten gehen werden. Ich möchte eine limitierte 1000 Auflage in hoher Qualität drucken.

Spezielle Angebote für Sie!

Sie können Eigentümer des einfachen "Gypsy Palace Tarot" Deck werden, oder der Special Edition mit handgefertigten magischen Beutel, signiert und personalisiert für Sie.

Aber es gibt hier mehr: für Ihre Unterstützung, Ich biete  auch mein Wissen über das Lesen der Tarot-Karten an. Haben Sie jemals eine Kartenlesung gehabt?

Überprüfen Sie die Vergünstigungen für weitere Informationen und wählen Sie für sich selbst oder für eine Person, die Sie lieben!

Über "The Gypsy Palace" Tarot Philosophie

So verwenden Sie The Gypsy Palace Tarot Kartendeck als Werkzeug, um in Kontakt mit Ihrem inneren Selbst zu kommen. Es ist ein frei eingeschlagener Weg-inspiriert Ihre Phantasie, entspannt den Geist und ist wie ein kleines Ritual, bringt Sie aus der Routine. Gönnen Sie sich diese Chance, sich für wenig Magie zu öffnen und auf den abenteuerlichen Weg selbst kennen zulernen!

VIELEN DANK für Ihre Unterstützunhg und den Austausch mit den lieben Menschen um Sie herum, für die Unterstützung dieses Projekts.

Gemeinsam machen wir es wahr!

 

 

THE GYPSY PALACE Tarot by Nora Huszka

- in hoher Spielkarten Qualität

- 410g Spielkartenkarton mit spezieller Lackierung

- 70 x 120 mm mit abgerundeten Ecken

- 78 Blatt basierend nach traditionellen "Rider Waite Tarot"

- in 4 Sprachen (Englisch, Deutsch, Italienisch, Ungarisch)

- limitierte 1000er Auflage weltweit

- Text und Nummern mit goldenen Hintergrund

- für spezielle "Perks" Signiert und/oder Handgefertigte Taschen

 

Bitte besuchen Sie mich hier , wir begrüßen Sie!

 

Wenn Sie Fragen haben oder Meinungen fühlen Sie sich frei, mich zu kontaktieren!

story:
Hi, I'm David Strickland and I will be taking a trip around the United States with my videographer (Randy Patterson) and my editor (Charles Fields) to visit all 48 states in 52 weeks.

Tucker (my puppy) and I will be taking photographs of people and places normally ignored by the media.

People that follow the news know of the layoffs, the business closings and bankruptcies, the escalated crime rates, and other factors related to the economy. But, they are only shadows of the real story. What about the actual faces of those families and individuals involved?

My journey with Tucker and my team will bring these faces to light.

As we travel, we will interview select people and collect photographs of the lives of these people. We will bring them to you through both vibrant pictures on Facebook and Twitter.Updates will be done weekly and (for those who participate in the perk) a personal update will be provided.

I am a retired Army Sergeant, Disabled Veteran, who has within the last year lost everything; my home, my wife, and at one point, my freedom. I have been an avid  photographer for 5 years. Now it's time for me to put my skills to use.

The money received from these donations will be used to purchase a small (but adequate) motor home for me, Tucker and my team and to upgrade my photography equipment (I lost most of it last year and all I have now is an old SLR).

I receive military retirement which will be adequate for fuel, supplies and food for us. At the culmination of my journey, I will be publishing a book entitled "48N52" and also hope to gain a greater insite into the triumphs and disappointments of the nation. If the goal is not reached, the money received will be put first toward the motorhome and I will get suitable equipment on a rental plan. Either way I will make this trip. I am making preparations to depart in May and, God willing, I will succeed. Thank you all for your kindness.
story_txt:
Hi, I'm David Strickland and I will be taking a trip around the United States with my videographer (Randy Patterson) and my editor (Charles Fields) to visit all 48 states in 52 weeks. 
 Tucker (my puppy) and I will be taking photographs of people and places normally ignored by the media. 
People that follow the news know of the layoffs, the business closings and bankruptcies, the escalated crime rates, and other factors related to the economy. But, they are only shadows of the real story. What about the actual faces of those families and individuals involved? 
My journey with Tucker and my team will bring these faces to light. 
As we travel, we will interview select people and collect photographs of the lives of these people. We will bring them to you through both vibrant pictures on Facebook and Twitter.Updates will be done weekly and (for those who participate in the perk) a personal update will be provided.
 I am a retired Army Sergeant, Disabled Veteran, who has within the last year lost everything; my home, my wife, and at one point, my freedom. I have been an avid  photographer for 5 years. Now it's time for me to put my skills to use.
 The money received from these donations will be used to purchase a small (but adequate) motor home for me, Tucker and my team and to upgrade my photography equipment (I lost most of it last year and all I have now is an old SLR).
 I receive military retirement which will be adequate for fuel, supplies and food for us. At the culmination of my journey, I will be publishing a book entitled "48N52" and also hope to gain a greater insite into the triumphs and disappointments of the nation. story:
Hi! I'm Tia!

A California Artist with a Detroit Attitude.

I grew up with art. As a military brat I traveled most of my childhood, (born in California, raised in the Philippines, then high school in Michigan) so I drew alot. I earned a Bachelor’s in Fine Arts from The College for Creative Studies, in Detroit 2006.

My Past

I worked at ad agencies like a Mad Man until being laid off in 2008. I swore never again to live by corporate standards and fled the East Coast to paint in California for a living. I create lowbrow satire inspired by the ideologies of past & present, favoring a juxtapose of cutesy subjects engaged in suspicious activity.

My Present

After many long years working the art scene grind, attending group shows, gallery openings, street fairs, farmers markets, contests, and even opening my own gallery on the beach, it finally paid off and I have a real gallery representing me and my first debut solo show with all new work.


Unfortunately, 3 years of being a starving artist hasn't left me with many supplies or means. With contributions from donors like you, I will be able to get the proper size canvases for my frames, quality oil paints (that aren't leaking) natural bristle brushes instead of synthetic, promotional and marketing materials for the show.

My Future

While any amount can help a starving artist in need, the goal amount is based on a priced out list of items needed for my progress to meet my October deadline. From paints, to canvas, to brushes, thinners, and frames. Be sure that every cent goes towards my future art career and this show!

story:
Short Summary

WorldFest is a fantastic festival brought on by the nonprofit Towards Freedom (501(c)3) in Woodley Park, California (near Los Angeles). It's one of the most fun events of the year with three stages of live music, compassionate living, environmental and healthy living speakers, amazing vegan food, and fun. 

Each year the non-profit barely breaks even paying for all the expenses a festival of this size needs. We rent tents and booths, security, advertising, rental of solar power equipment, sanitization service, water trucks, recycling trash services, all while depending on a small team of volunteers passionate about making this festival the best ever each year.

This year we'd like to introduce and fund an additional venue, Art Avenue. This tent is a special art show that is only accepting artwork that related to the themes of WorldFest. That means only work that brings up the issues of animals, the environment, and social justice. The artwork is carefully curated with local artists, and they are urged to explore these issues on their crafted materials. It's become a very amazing exchange between artists and our activist curating team. Artists get to sell their original work with a small percentage donation going back to the festival.

However, funding a tent like this requires sponsorship. We tried asking a wide variety of businesses and non-profits to help fund the tent, but it's been difficult and unsuccessful. We realized in order for this to work we will need our friends to help this happen. We have some really great rewards for your generosity.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Funding is needed to pay for the rental the tent for the day, as well as tables and chairs. We also need to construct museum style walls (from reclaimed materials) and use low wattage LED lighting. We'll be needing additional security to keep the artwork safe. We'll also need additional materials to decorate the tent and attract visitors, including specimen lighting and construction of our seating area (which includes seats and cushions). We will also need additional funding for the entire festival to help cover costs like advertising and rental of Woodley Park.

 

The Impact

Your donation will help us make this project this year, as well as each and every year afterwards. This will give artists motivation to create more activist inspired artwork for people to enjoy each year. This helps a lot of people by increasing awareness of vital issues by the artistic expression, as well as increasing a market for activist art as a whole.

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out! Tell people about this amazing campaign and get your friends involved. Be sure to use those great share tools by the IndieGoGo website. Also, be sure to help spread the word about Art Avenue. Keep your eyes on the official Art Avenue website through art.worldfestevents.com
