story:
Hi. I am Catalina Barroso Luque and I am a Mexican visual artist. For those who don’t already know me, I am the current artist in residence at New Haven’s Artspace (in Connecticut, USA).

My work revolves around ways of seeing while challenging the boundaries and traditions of both sculpture and photography. In my early career, I have had the opportunity to exhibit in London and in my hometown Mexico City. Currently, I am a New Haven artist and am excited to announce that I will take part in this year’s New Haven City-Wide-Open Studios Festival. During this month-long festival, not only will my studio be open to the public, but I am also planning to create my biggest, most ambitious piece yet. Screen Realities will be a room-size (about 3 x 7 m) installation where it will be possible for viewers to be actively submerged in them. The installation will allow visitors to walk within a maze of curtains and overlapping images. Having an image literally create space and swallow its viewer has always been a dream of mine, but for this dream to become reality I need your help.

I already have a space for this work. The installation is scheduled to open on October 26th at the Goffe St Armory. However I need to raise $1,200 to cover the cost of materials, hire the appropriate equipment, and successfully set the installation up. I will be dedicating the next 2 months to do everything from sewing each curtain, to producing the digital files, constructing the temporary walls, and installing every bit of equipment: all in order to create this ambitious artwork. However, without any kind of outside help this unique piece may never see the light of day. So I am turning to you, my strongest supporters, to ask for contributions. In exchange, I will be offering a free artist talk at the exhibition to all contributors. For the first 20 people who donate $50 or more, I will send out limited edition signed postcards. If you donate $150, I will be giving out some limited edition signed prints.

Your contribution will help create a truly immersive artwork that tests the boundaries of what we think photography to be. In addition, the piece will bring a bit of Mexican spice to New Haven, while helping support the creative arts in the city. Finally, it will really enrich my artistic practice. Please help me continue on my path to becoming the international MEXICAN artist I have always dreamed of becoming. Thanks! Y gracias!

If you find the idea inspiring and would like to help further, please like this video and share it on Facebook. Help me get the word across; every little helps. Thanks!



Artist Bio:

I am originally from Mexico City, and have lived in London and now the USA. I received my BA in Central St Martin’s renowned Sculpture/3D department. After living for almost 5 years in London, I was awarded the 1 year Artist in Residence position at Artspace, New Haven. My work has also been shortlisted for other competitions and awards including the BARTUR Award in Photography, and the Zeitgeist Open. At the moment I am working towards further pushing and developing my practice, and hope to get into one of the world’s top Fine Arts Masters Programs for Autumn 2014.

story:
Short Summary

Slam Richmond is a multi-faceted organization, including a weekly open mic, workshops for aspiring writers, and an adult and youth slam poetry team. This writing community has become a voice for artistically suppressed young adults, allowing them the opportunity to be heard every Saturday. Here, scribbles in notepads and quiet journal entries are transformed into award winning prose.

Slam Richmond is the only venue in Richmond, Virginia offering a poetry slam competition weekly for both youth and adults in separate categories. Youth poets compete by writing original poems and reciting them for an audience and judges randomly selected from our crowd. Winners of each competition qualify for a chance to represent Richmond, Virginia at Brave New Voices youth competition, which is held annually in a different city. Once the teams are selected (5 poets and 2 coaches), they rehearse all summer and then compete to show the world a peek into Virginia’s artistic and literary arsenal!

What We Need & What You Get

  • Funds for gas. Slam Richmond annually drives to the competition. Driving is, believe it or not, cheaper.
  • Funds for food. Although there is a meal plan included in registration for the competiton itself, during the days of driving food is necessary.
  • Funds for lodging. Slam Richmond stops in various cities to workshop with award winning poets or perform & often, after a day of educational sightseeing, the group stays in a hotel to rest up for another full day of driving.

The Impact

  • Many youth poets have come to believe that their passion is only a hobby; a miniscule pasttime. This experience proves to youth poets to the realities of their dreams and goals by introducing them to successful poets across the country and giving them hands on experience with touring through the mini tour we they go on annually en route to competition.
  • In the four years of this program, it's become clear that most youth have not traveled outside of Virginia and those that have have not gone far. This experience shows them the world beyond their homes and confirms that they do have a place in the world at large.
  • Youth find themselves re-purposed from this program. Many intended dropouts have gone to college. Those who didn't remained became mentors, coaches and continue to work towards maintaining the program so that other youth may enjoy the same expeirence.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that money is tight for many. Still, there are ways you can help!

  • Share this link on your Facebook, LinkedIn, Twitter & e-mail it to folks.
  • If you know of any youth aged 13-19 in Richmond, VA, inform them of our program so that they may participate in the years to come.

story:
AZF 2013 will be held on Saturday, June 8th, and Sunday, June 9th, 2013. If you’re interested in selling zines, art, comics, or any manner of DIY crafts, sign up by May 19th, 2013, using our webform.


Ways your funds will help:

Buying tables -- Promotional materials -- Stickers, flyers, tshirts, buttons, totebags, signage/posters/banners -- Refreshments -- Honorariums for guest speakers -- Van rentals for carpooling -- Film and photography services -- Zines for the Atlanta Zine Library.

Please contact us at info@atlantazinelibrary.com for more info!

story:
Dear Lovely Ones,

I'm an expressive arts therapist and yoga teacher passionate about empowering girls with finding and sharing their voices through the expressive arts.  In northern Thailand, hill tribe communities are vulnerable for human trafficking due to their being denied political, economic, and social rights. 

100% of the funding will be used to buy art materials to create these art murals done by the girls. We will use some funds to reproduce their artwork for fundraising or to be able to "travel the mural" internationally so more people can witness their artistry and hear their voices. 
  
In recent years, I have worked with these girls doing expressive arts entirely self-funded. I am happy to expand this program to include you as a part of this inspiring and world-changing project!  Traditionally, murals are done in Thai temples by men. This is an innovative approach to healing that will bring awareness of their talent and voices in a positive way in their community and around the world.
 
Thank you kindly for your interest. Your generosity is deeply appreciated! And we are so happy if you will spread the word on social media such as Facebook and email.
 
With gratitude,
 
Ali Guida Smith

story:
The House of Spoof Collective started after a close friend to the group, Glenn “Spoof” Wright, was murder in a case of mistaken identity at the age of 21 in 2009. Glenn was an emerging artist, photographer, illustrator and sculptor. He was an active member in his community that worked with students from Harlem and The Bronx. After his death, We (the collective) started The House of Spoof Collective. The House of spoof collective is a collaborative of artist dedicated to keeping the spirit and memory of the beloved Glenn “Spoof” Wright alive, by providing emerging artist with opportunities, support and resources and space to exhibit their work. THOSC’s objective is to create awareness of senseless violence in undeserved communities by providing a positive reaction to it. THOSC is a diverse group of artists that work in many artistic mediums such as photography, painting, music, drawing, graphic design, printmaking and filmmaking.

The House of Spoof Collective needs at least 2,800 dollars for the project. This project has two folds components; the first aspect of the project will consist in a series of one-day workshops open to the community at large to learn different printmaking and photographic techniques. (With a total of 12 workshops on stencil, silkscreen, linoleum cut, solar plate, collagraph, framing, studio lighting, experimental photography among others). On the second aspect of this project The House of Spoof Collective will curate a series of four exhibitions giving the workshop participants an opportunity to showcase their work along a much larger artistic community.

We have received a The Community Art Grant from Bronx Council for the Arts for $1000 dollars and we need to fundraise for the rest of the funds to be able to complete this project.

story:
What happens to food when you add paint?


It becomes surprisingly bold & fresh. 


Blue and green mushrooms sprouting into a miniature forest, or wild flowers scattered in our noodles, create fantastical visuals that bring us back to our childhood when creativity wasn't limited.

This unique mixed media art project combines unlikely materials to create exciting photographs. As a supporter of this project, you can share in these bright images through postcards, prints & the final book.

(The image of the book above is a mock up only, real book may vary in cover and width)


A Book Like No Other

Is it an artbook, a photobook or a cookbook? Why can't it be all three? Questions like this take us back to childhood when we asked "why" much more often. 

The final intriguing book plays all three parts. Photography of fragile, short-lived art pieces. Each photograph is edited, given a certain toned aged look.





And at the back of the book, you will find diagrammed art recipes, detailing how each piece can be recreated. Following in cookbook tradition, measurements such as "2 tsp blue acrylic paint" are used. 




Other mediums are also experimented with, such as thread and gold leaf. Play is a large part of the process for creating such imaginative images, and part of play is breaking rules.

As an artist, my work centers on mixed media, exploring combinations & fusion. I'd like my artwork to exhilarate viewers into their own creative endeavors by proving there are no boundaries that can't be explored.





An Intriguing Offer


All the funding goes directly into the perk rewards first, of course. 

However, I haven't completed all the pieces yet. Some of your funds go into new & fantastical images for the book and other perks. 

Each perk has been priced very carefully, and 70-75% of the cost is directly for the printing/creation of that perk. 

The rest goes towards my costs as creator. Specifically:

  • the purchase of food and paint 
  • my time as an artist, photographer and photo editor
  • the final layout and editing of the book. 




What Happens When

At the end of the campaign I will begin creating and photographing the rest of the art pieces to be included in the perks. I estimate 8-10 days for that work. 

Then I will edit the photos, layout the book, and do the final proof check. I estimate it will take 10 days until I am sure that the final book is ready to ship!


Which means - Book orders will be shipped around 20-30 days after the campaign ends, and you can expect 7-10 days for shipping (depending on your location). 

Early perks, (postcards, prints etc) will be sent out throughout this process, and the books will be sent on schedule.






Even More Details!

Want more details about the perks?

  • The softcover book features 30-40 pages, a glossy cover, flexible spine, library durable binding and semi-matte inside paper.

  • The hardcover book features 30-40 pages, a matte cover, library durable binding and semi-matte inside paper.

  • The digital versions of the photos that will be available for download as desktop wallpapers will be extremely high resolution and look fantastic on your computer with lots of white space for your icons to sit on.

  •  I hope to also include mobile phone home/lock wallpaper.

  • Behind-the-scenes will include videos of the process, in-progress photos, and more!

  • There will be one image EXCLUSIVE to the print hardcover and softcover book that will not be seen anywhere else.


If we don't meet the goal, that's ok! All the perks will still be delivered! 

If we DO meet the goal...celebrations in the street! Dancing and clogging and lots of other festivities! And probably a few surprises for all the contributers too!





A Bit About the Artist?

To see other art projects I have worked on, and other art series I have completed, look at my website www.crystalsmith.net. There is also a section for this project, with a more academic description.

We are creating a beautiful thing here, a work of art. But unlike most works of art, the original pieces only last a very short time. Their fragile existence is documented by the photographs that hopefully will travel around the world. 

Be a part of this project, and question "what is art?" "what is a cookbook?", and "what happens when you can't eat the final product?".


Lend Me A Hand!

If you can't contribute, that's cool, I get it. Give me a quick tweet, FB like or other shout-out and that would be great!! 

And if you want to post about this on your blog, or other site, I would be happy to answer questions or give you some more media to use! Just drop me a line!
story_txt:
What happens to food when you add paint?It becomes surprisingly bold & fresh. Blue and green mushrooms sprouting into a miniature forest, or wild flowers scattered in our noodles, create fantastical visuals that bring us back to our childhood when creativity wasn't limited.This unique mixed media art project combines unlikely materials to create exciting photographs. As a supporter of this project, you can share in these bright images through postcards, prints & the final book.(The image of the book above is a mock up only, real book may vary in cover and width)

A Book Like No OtherIs it an artbook, a photobook or a cookbook? Why can't it be all three? Questions like this take us back to childhood when we asked "why" much more often. The final intriguing book plays all three parts. Photography of fragile, short-lived art pieces. Each photograph is edited, given a certain toned aged look.And at the back of the book, you will find diagrammed art recipes, detailing how each piece can be recreated. Following in cookbook tradition, measurements such as "2 tsp blue acrylic paint" are used. Other mediums are also experimented with, such as thread and gold leaf. Play is a large part of the process for creating such imaginative images, and part of play is breaking rules.As an artist, my work centers on mixed media, exploring combinations & fusion. I'd like my artwork to exhilarate viewers into their own creative endeavors by proving there are no boundaries that can't be explored.An Intriguing OfferAll the funding goes directly into the perk rewards first, of course. However, I haven't completed all the pieces yet. Some of your funds go into new & fantastical images for the book and other perks. Each perk has been priced very carefully, and 70-75% of the cost is directly for the printing/creation of that perk. The rest goes towards my costs as creator. Specifically:
the purchase of food and paint 
my time as an artist, photographer and photo editor
the final layout and editing of the book. 


What Happens WhenAt the end of the campaign I will begin creating and photographing the rest of the art pieces to be included in the perks. I estimate 8-10 days for that work. Then I will edit the photos, layout the book, and do the final proof check. I estimate it will take 10 days until I am sure that the final book is ready to ship!Which means - Book orders will be shipped around 20-30 days after the campaign ends, and you can expect 7-10 days for shipping (depending on your location). Early perks, (postcards, prints etc) will be sent out throughout this process, and the books will be sent on schedule.

Even More Details!Want more details about the perks?
The softcover book features 30-40 pages, a glossy cover, flexible spine, library durable binding and semi-matte inside paper.
The hardcover book features 30-40 pages, a matte cover, library durable binding and semi-matte inside paper.

The digital versions of the photos that will be available for download as desktop wallpapers will be extremely high resolution and look fantastic on your computer with lots of white space for your icons to sit on.
 I hope to also include mobile phone home/lock wallpaper.
Behind-the-scenes will include videos of the process, in-progress photos, and more!
There will be one image EXCLUSIVE to the print hardcover and softcover book that will not be seen anywhere else.
If we don't meet the goal, that's ok! All the perks will still be delivered! If we DO meet the goal...celebrations in the street! Dancing and clogging and lots of other festivities! And probably a few surprises for all the contributers too!
A Bit About the Artist?To see other art projects I have worked on, and other art series I have completed, look at my website www.crystalsmith.net. There is also a section for this project, with a more academic description.We are creating a beautiful thing here, a work of art. But unlike most works of art, the original pieces only last a very short time. Their fragile existence is documented by the photographs that hopefully will travel around the world. Be a part of this project, and question "what is art?" "what is a cookbook?", and "what happens when you can't eat the final product?".Lend Me A Hand!If you can't contribute, that's cool, I get it. Give me a quick tweet, FB like or other shout-out and that would be great!! And if you want to post about this on your blog, or other site, I would be happy to answer questions or give you some more media to use! Just drop me a line!

story:
Illustrated by Andreas Ganther, this wimmelbook was developed by learning a lot of the construction business. We worked together with some of these guys who are building these fascinating machines in reality. With much focus on details this book is a great experience for children as well as for construction-loving adults.

The Idea was to show the viewer the history from the past until to the future of construction. Teeming with lots of funny details, this book invites you to discover all the amusing stories in each of its five pictures.


You can even look look for some special chararcters. They are hiding inside the different pictures and are waiting to be discovered by you. Have fun!


At the Beginning there were only ideas, influenced by interviews with guys of the construction business and an amazing visit of the bauma 2013 in Munich. Out of the first drawing with graphit pencils site for site came to life.


The next step was to bring them on pc and to colorize them with beautiful colors.


Now it’s up to you to support us, to get this book produced. It will be a great experience for all the children and maybe some adults fascinated by construction to discover the history from the past to the future.


Why we need your support

We don’t sell this wimmelbook to a publisher. We want to produce it on our own. But self-producing is very expensive. So we need your help. Our goal is to realize this great wimmelbook on our own. We are a stong team, have great ideas and are willing to bring BAGGERMANIA to reality. With you as backup it will hopefully don’t be a problem.


What you get for your support




International shipping and information

Q. Can I still contribute even if I live outside of Europe?

Yes, this campaign is for everyone worldwide. Everyone who wishes will have the chance to contribute.


Q. How are payments for contribution being made?

Payments are being made via Pay Pal or credit Card.

·  Click “Contribute Now”

·  Choose your perk, click “Continue to Payment” at the bottom of the page

·  Or, if you click “No Perk”, simply click “Continue”

·  Please read Indiegogo’s message and the breakdown of your perks. If you are happy with everything, process payment.


Q. I live outside Germany, do you ship internationally?

Yes! All perk items will be shipped internationally. There are no shipping costs worldwide.


Q. When will the perks are shipped?

The Estimated date for delivery is November 2014.


Risks & Challenges

Of course, every big project, no matter how well prepared and elaborated, comes with risks and challenges.

We developed a well prepared plan and are sure to bring our project to reality.


Communication

It’s important to us to keep all of you updated via social media throughout the process of finalizing the wimmelbook and the setup of publishing and production. We will answer all new incoming questions regarding the project. We will do our best to make each of you happy.


Budget

The budget for this project will be used entirely for all required materials, printing, shipping costs and the production. The cost are estimated on 50.000 USD. We have carefully budgeted all perks and personal goals of this campaign, however there can always be unexpected costs that might slow down the production of the wimmelbook if the campaign doesn’t reach its goal.

In spite of the risk of not reaching the goal of this campaign, we made sure that all claimed perks will be produced and shipped to you. We will keep you updated at all times about new steps and progress to make sure you’re informed.


Other ways you can help

If you are not in the position to fund the campaign financially, there are other ways to help by spreading the word about “THE GREAT BAGGERMANIA WIMMELBOOK”. Please like and share this campaign to help realize this project!

If you use the share tool of this page, we will be able to see who spread the words and will have some great goodies for you!



Thank you so much for your support to bring the BAGGERMANIA to reality!

story:
Oil Painting Class


Studio N111 is a community art studio and classroom space that offers a variety of workshops and classes geared towards a range of age groups and priced fairly to assure accessibility. Some of our classes include exploring the foundations of drawing, painting and mixed media, as well as non-traditional creative classes; designed for the experienced artist. 


 We collaborate with other local businesses, non-profits and community groups to enhance the art culture for the city. 


We are currently located on the third floor of Pratt St in downtown Hartford. A new, expanded space with more visibility will enable the Studio to offer even more to the community. Our goals include creating a Community Classroom for youth with diverse art programming, Corporate Creative Lunch Breaks for downtown employees, "BYOB" Art Nights, and using the space after hours as a Community Sitting Room; for poetry readings, open-mic nights, and an acoustic concert series. Additionally, areas of the studio will be rented to other local artists to use as work space. We are working with the City of Hartford and downtown property owners to select the ideal space for the new Studio. 



 This is an $80,000 venture. We hope that this Kickstarter will raise the funds needed for overhead and moving costs, renovation of a new space, the purchase of art supplies to keep classes affordable, and to hire additional teaching artists to enrich programming.

set design in City Hall for the Trashion Fashion show, with members of our community


Studio N111 believes that there is an artist in everyone, and that art can expand mental horizons, foster meaningful conversation, challenge assumptions, and unite communities. In order to expand and continue programming, we need the community's help! We cannot do this without you. Thank you for your generosity and support. 

Thank you!!

story:
We believe in social justice. And we believe that technology can be leveraged in powerful ways to organize and sustain social change.

In Ferguson, MO, we are working to create and sustain infrastructure to support the movement in the name of social justice. This is the movement of a new generation.

More than a Moment, a Movement

It wasn't until I went to Ferguson, MO on Saturday, August 16th that I understood the importance of the work happening. You can read about my initial experience in a blog post, here.

I quickly realize that this was not the America that I knew.

I've live-tweeted all of my experiences as well. You can also see a gallery of pictures and videos I've taken here.

This is not a moment in American history, this is a movement -- a movement demanding systemic change and justice.

The 3 Goals

This project has three defined goals.

Goal 1: Create Platforms to Share Information and Strategize

Thus far, we've created:

  • thisisthemovement.org which is the landing page for the daily newsletter
  • the daily #Ferguson newsletter to keep everyone informed and connected
  • hashtagferguson.org to assemble the twitter streams in one place
We need the resources to sustain these efforts and to continue building them to full fruition. We have gotten great traction thus far -- in just 4 days, the mailing list has over 700 members and has gotten 2,000 hits indepedent of the mailing list members.

We are also working to create a central platform for on-going announcements and a mechanism to link activists on the ground while protesting and to ensure that activists can travel to appropriate sites.

Goal 2: Create Resources and Structures to Link Allies with Activists

We are currently developing a platform to link the talents of those that would like to get involved with the appropriate avenue for them to get involved.

When funded, we will begin platform design and will develop the mechanism to match skills/talents to need as the work continues. 

Goal 3: Link Strategies to Target Systemic and Structural Reform at All Levels

We are currently developing an interactive platform to capture the policy recommendations and demands targeting systemic and structural reform highlighted by the events in Ferguson.

When funded, we will create a platform to host the policy demands that have arisen and to link to resources and ways for allies to get involved.

Everyone Has a Role To Play

There is a broad-based team of activists supporting this work and a host of tech advisors providing technical assistance. We're excited about what's possible.

For those that have asked, here is my bio:

A native of Baltimore, DeRay McKesson is a graduate of Bowdoin College and began his career as a 6th grade math teacher in New York City as a member of the 2007 Teach For America corps. As a teenager, he worked as a community organizer, training youth and adults to work together to overcome community challenges with Baltimore’s Safe and Sound Campaign. He has also worked for the Harlem Children’s Zone, opened an academic enrichment center for middle grades in West Baltimore, served on grant-making boards, and has worked for TNTP. The majority of his career, however, has been working for school systems, leading Human Capital initiatives. He works to ensure that structures and systems support all kids and that only the most talented and able adults work with and support our schools and students.

story:
Short Summary

Hello and thank you for coming to this site! For those of you who don't know, I'll be a senior at St. Edward's University this fall. My major is photocommunications, and my minor is journalism.

  •  I'll be going on a study abroad trip to India from July 28th through August 18th.
  • We'll start in Delhi and explore some surrounding cities, and then move into the foothills of the Himalayan mountains.
  • With your support, I'll be able to photograph and document everything I see, hear, taste, and smell.

What I Need & What You Get

  • The program carries a pretty hefty study abroad fee, which includes tuition, housing, meals and transportation within the country.
  • All the prints will be made on archival inkjet paper, meaning they'll last 100+ years. The books will consist of these prints, hand-bound by me.
  • Even if I don't reach the entire goal, every little bit helps!

The Impact

I'm extremely excited to visit the other side of the world. I consider traveling to be one of the most important things a person can do. It's unlikely that I'll get a chance like this again after college.

  • Last summer, I backpacked through Europe and photographed while I was there. Here's a small selection of images from that trip: http://mariahstevensross.tumblr.com/
  • As a photo major and photo lab manager, I'll have 24-hour access to the labs to ensure your prints get delivered on time.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please feel free to send this along to your friends and family - every little bit helps!
  • Thanks so much for visiting this page. I truly appreciate your support!

story:
Short Summary

We are supporting the Sophie Lancaster Foundation, a very good cause close to the heart of the rock and alternative scene.

  • Samatha Tomlin is the Ambassador for the Hard Rock Hell festival, and Wendy Page is a gig photographer working in and around Berkshire for many years.
  • We want to raise money for The Sophie Lancaster Foundation by publishing a calendar of emerging rock and heavy metal musicians.
  • The work of the Foundation focuses on creating respect for and understanding of subcultures in our communities. As part of the rock subculture, we feel this is important work, especially for the younger members of the metal and goth communities as they need to feel safe and protected in order to properly express themselves.


What We Need & What You Get

  • It should be ok to be different, not an invitation to violence and abuse. We are hoping to raise as much money as possible to help the Sophie Lancaster Foundation in their work reaching out to Stamp Out Prejudice Hatred and Intolerance Everywhere.
  • We are offering a unique collection of photographs in a calendar you will want to keep - especially if you buy the signed one (or collect the signatures as you see the bands live!)
  • If we don't reach our goal, then you lose nothing - the money stays in your bank. Hopefully, though, you will support us and we will have a nice chunk of cash to hand over!

The Impact

  • You will have a copy of a unique calendar showcasing a range of musicians, and you can feel good about having them on your wall knowing your cash has helped a very important cause!
  • This is our first venture of this kind, but if this year is a success, who knows, it could become a yearly project!
  • Our volunteer models have very bravely come forward to pose for us probably in ways they never have before! We are aiming to make them all look sexy, and hopefully you will also check out their music - there are CDs on offer in some of the incentive packages!

Risks & Challenges

This is going to be a real challenge for us, scheduling shoots over the next couple of months around the touring bands, and finding locations near them if they cannot travel to us.

  • Samantha will be dealing with the diary as well as helping on the shoots, and this should be hectic! Every band has gigs and festivals across the summer, and we need to complete all the pictures before the printing deadline. There should probably be a blog...
  • Wendy will be expanding her skills as we go, learning about new equipment and thinking up scenarios on the fly as well as shooting planned photosets. Imagination is key, and spotting the locations to bring out the character of each model. Expect the unexpected!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford a calendar, you can help us by spreading the word about our project, or you could turn up at a gig near you and cheer on our brave volunteers - every band needs an audience, and they need you!

story:
I am creating the world's largest hand drawn maze! As I reached 40 years old I realized I had a lot of goals I have yet to obtain. One of them was getting into the Guinness Book of World Records. After looking at the records I realized my cartoonist physique was probably not going to break any phyical endurance or sports records. So I approached Guinness with a new record. Very seldomly will they accept new records, and even more rare an artistic one. Much to my surprise they accepted!

The fully solvable maze when complete will be over 4 feet high by 30 feet long and feature over 100 illustrations throughout.

It occured to me there might be others like me who want to be a part of a world record! So I want to invite all of you to join me on this quest!

Sponsors such as Schell Games, Star-Kist, Guardian Storage and Visit Pittsburgh are already a part of the maze. I am about halfway done and have room for more! That's where all of you come in.

I am hoping to raise funds to take the maze on a world wide tour, showcasing it at cartoon and children's museums.

Your support will not only make that happen but also allow you to be included in the maze!

With a variety of perks to offer, you can own a maze, or even have your name or logo included in the world record!


If I can reach 8000.00 I will also be able to publish a book of my mazes as well!

This is a unique opportunity to support an artist and become a part of a truly interactive record breaking work of art.

Thanks,

Joe

Very seldomly will they accept new records, and even more rare an artistic one. Much to my surprise they accepted!
The fully solvable maze when complete will be over 4 feet high by 30 feet long and feature over 100 illustrations throughout.
It occured to me there might be others like me who want to be a part of a world record! So I want to invite all of you to join me on this quest!
Sponsors such as Schell Games, Star-Kist, Guardian Storage and Visit Pittsburgh are already a part of the maze. I am about halfway done and have room for more! That's where all of you come in.
I am hoping to raise funds to take the maze on a world wide tour, showcasing it at cartoon and children's museums.
Your support will not only make that happen but also allow you to be included in the maze!
With a variety of perks to offer, you can own a maze, or even have your name or logo included in the world record!
If I can reach 8000.00 I will also be able to publish a book of my mazes as well!
This is a unique opportunity to support an artist and become a part of a truly interactive record breaking work of art.
Thanks,
Joe

story:
Short Summary

     I am a 24 year old flamenco dancer and have been dancing since I was very young.  I began my training at Canada's National Ballet School and have studied many forms of dance throughout my life.   My parents, Roger and Valerie Scannura are founders of the acclaimed Toronto-based company Ritmo Flamenco and with them, I have travelled to Spain to study flamenco and tour around the world multiple times. Highlights of our performances are:  opening for Paco de Lucia at Massey Hall and performing for the Prime Minister of Malta at the Malta International Arts Festival and performing for Sting and Russel Crowe.  My experiences have been amazing, as my entire life has revolved around dance, flamenco and performing.   My flamenco dance career has taken me to Mexico, California, Malta and now - to Spain itself!  In 2012 I won the prestigious Paula Citron Fresh Blood Award for outstanding emerging Canadian choreographer.  Paula Citron wrote an amazing review about my dancing that has encouraged me to take risks with my own choreography and develop myself further as a artist.  

"Scannura is developing her own hybrid and she is truly a representative of Canadian dance in that respect.  Her dancing and choreography expresses a country of immigrants where many styles collide together to take dance into New World territory".

 -Paula Citron for the Globe and Mail, Toronto

   I have received the Chalmers Professional Development Grant to pursue studies in flamenco and have also received grants from the Ontario Arts Council and the Toronto Arts Council to present my first full-length performance titled Danzas Sagradas that was just premiered to full houses and standing ovations at Harbourfront Centre's NextSteps Dance Festival.  

     As someone that is not from Spain, I have always had a dream to be recognized internationally as a flamenco dancer, which is a rare feat.  A few years ago I had the opportunity to attend the Certamen Coreografia de Danza Espanola y Flamenco  in Madrid and watched the best young up and coming dancers in flamenco present works on a theatrical stage in front of Spain's most acclaimed artists. This year I prepared a 10 minute flamenco piece to a very contemporary piece of music and submitted to the festival.  I was very shocked and excited to find out that I was accepted to be one of the fourteen choreographers to premiere my new work at the Conde Duque Cultural Center in Madrid this December 18 + 19, 2013.  

What We Need & What You Get

The funds will go towards travel and accommodations ($3,500)  for myself and my technical advisor (Valerie Scannura) as I have to be accompanied by another person to communicate lighting and all technical directions to the Certamen personnel. $500 will go towards design and construction of a new costume specifically for this choreography.   Because the time span between being accepted and performing is so short ( less than one month) we were not prepared or expecting to be able to go to Madrid and take part in this performance - thus we are asking for these funds.  Also, the fact that I was accepted came as a complete surprise!

For $25 you will get your name in the program when this piece is premiered in Canada.

For $50 you will get your name in the program and 10% off a class package at the School of Ritmo Flamenco.  

For $75 you will get your name in the program and a 20 minute private lesson at the School of Ritmo Flamenco.

For $100 you will get your name in the program and a 45 minute private lesson at the School of Ritmo Flamenco.

The Impact

This choreography contest of Spanish dance and Flamenco gives a platform for presentation and competition of new choreographic works in the genre of Spanish dance and has been held yearly in Madrid since 1992.  The incentive for the competition is to allow new creations in Spanish dance and flamenco and to promote collaborations between composers and choreographers encouraging a high technical and artistic level of dancers and performers.  It's mandate is to give recognition and prestige to young choreographers who have taken risks to enrich the fusion of Spanish dance genres. In previous years, many astounding flamenco careers have been launched by their performances in the Certamen.  The Jury consists of Spain's most accomplished people in the arts as well as directors of acclaimed Spanish dance companies. Being a part of this competition will allow me to gain international exposure and will create a pathway for me to connect with people who can help me develop my career in flamenco.  Besides making my own art grow in technique and artistry, I also feel empowered as a Canadian  participating as an equal  with these wonderful dancers and choreographers in Spain. I will be able to make friends and acquaintances that will help me in future endeavours and finally, I will be able to bring back more knowledge back to Canada!

story:
Pittsburgh Fringe is a weekend-long, artist-led performing arts festival, featuring more than 70 shows from 24+ companies, coming to the North Side May 8-10.

This international movement invites adventurous audience to explore a small neighborhood, patroning show after show in a marathon cultural TKTKTK. Tickets are just $15(discounts available), capitalizing on the festival's theme of accessibility. 

Pittsburgh Fringe is part of a global movement of Fringe Festivals.  With the original Fringe in Edinburgh, Scotland (the world's largest unjuried arts festival),  Pittsburgh is part of the World Fringe and, in addition, the United States Association of Fringe Festivals.  

More about the project

Pittsburgh Fringe Festival seeks to expand the boundaries of performing arts in Pittsburgh and allows new and emerging performance artists the opportunity to showcase their talent by providing a venue to reduce financial barriers and increase exposure to the masses.

Pittsburgh Fringe Festival is a celebration of those artists who write in the margins of their playbills. It’s for those dreamers of stories beyond the written word. It’s an opportunity to witness the next big performance before it earns the monikers "next" and "big." 

As little as $15 gets us one step closer to making this event happen and can change the city's ideas about what our artists can accomplish and that the arts should be for everyone. Prove that the arts should be for all with a donation to this project today!

We need your help

Since the majority of the box office is returned to the artist(more than 24 different companies!), Fringe relies on support from funders and donors (like you) to promote performances, secure venues, provide housing for national acts, provide a stipend to our technicians, host gatherings, and create the festival atmosphere to make a huge impact.  Here's a breakdown of what we need help funding:
  • Volunteer and event insurance (about $200 each company)
  • Venues (about $900)
  • Box Office support(credit card fees)
  • Producing support($800 for our techs)
  • Equipment(about $1000 this year)
  • General marketing($2000)
This festival is important to the fabric Pittsburgh's arts community. While there are festivals that show professional work, Pittsburgh Fringe takes a leap off a cliff to support those artists just starting out or those that want to try new ideas for new audiences.   
We are in our second year of operation, and want to thank you for helping us spread the word, donating, and attending this important festival. Please donate today.
Love,
Pittsburgh Fringe Festival

story:
Who We Are

We are The Friction, an independent multidisciplinary queer arts collective comprised of eight young and enthusiastic artists. We've been around for nearly a year and in that time, we've brought a lot of quality, innovative programming to the Minneapolis arts community and provided a financially accessible alternative space for outside organizations to host events and productions. We are especially committed to creating equal visibility and support for queer artists.

What's the Money For?

We rent our space for a very low rate, but none of us are financially solvent enough to contribute out of pocket. As of right now, we have no fiscal sponsorship and have to fight each month to stay afloat on last-minute fundraisers and the nominal fee we charge outside groups to use our space. 100% of funds raised in this campaign will be put toward our rent ($500/month), in conjunction with funds from the aforementioned sources, so that we may continue to use the space through the end of the summer (and beyond, as during this time we hope to raise more money) If we do not meet our goal, we will throw a party to raise money. If we do meet our goal, we will throw a party to celebrate.

What's the Space For?

We, as The Friction Collective, exist independently of our space, but it is far and away the greatest resource we have. Our passion and vigor can only get us so far. We meet in the building twice a week to plan programming and put together our show The Firgun, Fraught (May 17-18 at Patrick's Cabaret), and someone is rehearsing there almost daily.  Not only do we benefit from having such a large, reasonably-priced space, but members of our artistic community do as well, and we have offered up this resource of ours to great effect.

story:
Yo Joe! Hail Cobra!

If you're reading this, you're probably a big fan of G.I. Joe. So are we! We are Joe Colton, Membership Liaison for The Finest: A GI Joe Costume Club and Robin Casares, Commanding Officer of the Third Night Watch Garrison of The Finest and we’re the women behind the Girls of The Finest 2015 calendar.

The 50th anniversary of GI Joe is here, and we wanted to do something special to celebrate this milestone. We also wanted to showcase our amazing members from around North America by creating something that GI Joe and Cobra fans everywhere could enjoy. And thus the idea for the Girls of The Finest calendar was born!

Trust us, this is no ordinary pin-up calendar. We are passionate about the characters we portray and we want to reflect the passion of the G.I. Joe fandom. All of your favorite female characters (plus a few twists on classic characters) will be portrayed here  - 12 months of our amazing female costumers photographed exclusively for this calendar! We think you'll agree that the Girls of The Finest is unlike any calendar you've seen before.

And as if that weren't enough…

We also wanted to show our support for the Real American Heroes that make up our U.S. military. Thus, all net proceeds earned from this campaign will go to benefit the Wounded Warrior Project. That means whatever money is left after we pay for the printing and distribution of the calendars and all associated perks will be presented to the Wounded Warrior Project with our thanks.

We Need YOU!

As excited as we are about this project, we can't do it without YOU. Only through your donations will this calendar happen. Your contribution of $5 or more will allow us to:

• Compile all the calendar photography

• Design/produce the calendar and all associated perks

• Pay for printing and shipping costs of the calendar and perks

We will be creating EXCLUSIVE content for this campaign that will only be available to those who donate here, including Girls of The Finest trading cards, post cards, patches and t-shirts! These will only be produced in limited quantities and once they're sold out, that's it!

Everyone who donates $5 or more will receive an exclusive Girls of The Finest item. Anyone donating $25 or more will receive the calendar PLUS exclusive items! (See perks on the right for a complete list)

How to Get Involved

Clearly, donating funds is the #1 way to get involved but if you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help! We also need people to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Share our link on your Facebook, Twitter or other social media, let other GI Joe fans know what we're doing, use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word, harness the power of the Internet to help us achieve WORLD DOMINATION! (Oh sorry, Cobra Commander took over typing there for a minute…)

Just get involved in whatever way you can - all help is appreciated!

* NOTE: We are happy to ship calendars and perks anywhere in the world! If you are in Canada, please add $7 to your donation to cover shipping. If you are outside North America, please email us with your location and we will let you know what additional shipping charges may apply.

story:
Our Story

Papergirl is a project originating in Berlin in 2006. Since then, it has travelled globally, with a number of cities around the world adopting the concept. Basically, a call out to artists is made to contribute artwork for display and distribution often in multiple print format. The work is displayed in a gallery setting before being given out to an unsuspecting public

The purpose is to feel part of an altruistic, playful and creative project... to gather people in spaces to drink, laugh and to adventure together.


The Impact

The impact is to add to a rapidly decreasing programme of arts festivals and events across the city of Newcastle and surrounding areas. Also to offer events and happenings that are more for participation than observation... get everyone together and just makes some stories.


What We Need & What You Get

We have already had phase 1 of the project... the preview night at Settle Down Cafe. This event, and all others have been completely unfunded and independant. A couple of us have so far paid for everything on our very meagre incomes, including booze, sweets, promo and what seems like endless amounts for time!

Phase 2 is rapidly approaching. The distribution! This is going to be pretty exciting! And we have big plans... but we need some help paying for it. Settle Down Cafe has kindly offered to cook breakfast for all volunteer cyclists... and with the preview night as a guide... that might get a bit silly and we can't expect a kind, independant small business to foot the cost of that! We also need to by loads of materials for decorating bikes and venues! For pre and post distribution parties! And for the latter... if you want booze! You'll have to help us out! The last lot cleaned us out!

Any help you can offer would be really appreciated! This has already been a great adventure and we want to give it our all right til the end!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you have access to big sheets of coloured paper, bicycle assessories... alcohol company sponsorships, own a butchers or bakers who can hook us up! P.A hire? As the addage goes... every little helps!

story:
The Short Version::

  • Kate Mink and Bethany Mann are "investigating" and creating the mysterious work of a secret society dedicated to nightmare abatement and the support and enhancement of chance encounters.
  • This campaign will help us build the infrastructure to display artifacts and increase the membership, thus allowing the subtle, magnanimous influence of the secret society to permeate a world that is weary and in need of a sincere infusion of benevolent folly.
  • Contributions will be used to illuminate, ensconce, create, and promote the exhibition "Anti-Nightmare Wallpaper and the Ladies 'Behind' It" at the Burlington Hotel in Port Costa during the month of October, and afterward, online, and potentially at other locations. 
  • For images and background on the artists and their playful collaborations visit:

    http://minkandmann.com

Why do we need your help?

  • The Burlington Hotel is a perfect venue (being both the place where the coincidental friendship of Mink and Mann was established and also a very fine example of vintage wall papers in high use...) but it will need some lighting and an infusion of vintage frames and cases to do justice to the society. 
  • We would never ask for something for nothing, so, in the spirit of an artistic collaboration, we offer lots of fun items in exchange for your contribution. Items on offer include: an actual membership in the secret society, a 'red dot' option allowing the recipient to pre-purchase a work from the show, as well as many handmade art pieces ranging from a hand-felted animal totem, to a subscription to letterpress latin mottos, to high-quality prints of the works in various sizes (post card to 8x10).
  • In order to truly create the effect of gentle happenstancery we will also require a true secret society of like-minded folks to leave objects of beauty and mystery for others.... Won't you join the ranks?

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute in the monetary fashion, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

The items we use to amuse, elucidate, and illuminate are often vintage and a little on the rare side. Though we love the hunt, we are short on time!

  • Please go to our Facebook page to see what we are looking for (especially if you live in the Bay Area!). It's like a giant scavenger hunt and we are quite the scavengers!
  • We need able bodies to help staff the show. Know a reliable, young artist that might want to help hang art or do promotion and doesn't mind (really) meager pay? Please direct them to us!
  • If you are unable to help fund us (or even if you do fund us), and believe in us, please share this site and our website (http://minkandmann.com) with anyone and everyone who might be interested in the project. You might put us in the path of the magical beast known as the art patron....
  • Please be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools! We'd love to see this everywhere. And we'd like to support the tools that support us!
  • Know someone with a great blog or one who writes for a local paper? Introduce us! We'd love some coverage!

    Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute in the monetary fashion, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

The items we use to amuse, elucidate, and illuminate are often vintage and a little on the rare side. Though we love the hunt, we are short on time!

Please go to our Facebook page to see what we are looking for (especially if you live in the Bay Area!). It's like a giant scavenger hunt and we are quite the scavengers!
We need able bodies to help staff the show. Know a reliable, young artist that might want to help hang art or do promotion and doesn't mind (really) meager pay? Please direct them to us!

If you are unable to help fund us (or even if you do fund us), and believe in us, please share this site and our website (http://minkandmann.com) with anyone and everyone who might be interested in the project. You might put us in the path of the magical beast known as the art patron....

Please be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools! We'd love to see this everywhere. And we'd like to support the tools that support us!
Know someone with a great blog or one who writes for a local paper? Introduce us! We'd love some coverage!

story:
Announcing the Sulfur Studios Expansion!

February 2016 marks the one-year anniversary of Sulfur Studios!  In that time we have provided affordable workspace to 21 artists and organizations and put on 24 solo and group exhibitions featuring local and national artists.  As a completely volunteer-run organization we have presented over a dozen music shows and hosted a variety of community events, including open studio nights, workshops, film screenings and more. None of this would have been possible without the support of our community, and once again we are asking for your help to continue to expand our offerings for the creative community.


The Space

In early 2016 Sulfur Studios will be expanding into the upstairs of our current building at 2301 Bull Street.  We will provide an additional 8 studios, a shared workspace, and a dedicated event space, allowing us to expand our contributions to Savannah’s creative community.

The new space will allow us to be more flexible in the functions we present.  Special events like movies, workshops and classes will no longer have to fit in-between exhibitions, but can happen simultaneously. 

Photo courtesy of Hissing Lawns

The additional studio space will also allow us to offer a studio residency program, which will bring creative professionals from out of town in order to share their talents and experiences with our community. The residency will increase the national profile of the arts in Savannah and the Starland District.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $12,000 in order to renovate the upstairs and develop new programs for the space:  

We will be working with Sam Carroll Construction to build 8 new affordable studios, which is a lot of studs, drywall, and paint! The studios will range from 80 - 150 sqft, with 10 foot ceilings. Several have windows on the outside walls, and almost all have natural light.

Additionally, we will be furnishing a shared work space with worktables and stools so we can provide a collaborative environment for the creative community.  We will also continue to improve the public spaces of the ground floor, with new flooring and restroom upgrades.

Finally, part of the funds raised will help cover the costs of providing a free studio and exhibition opportunities for our Artist-in-Residence series starting in Summer/Fall of 2016.

The Perks

Set of 3 Prints by Miggs the Artist


We have a lot of great perks for our supporters, including fantastic art from local artists, Sulfur Studios Swag and Memberships, and tickets to Carnivale, our fundraising masquerade ball on February 20th.

Beautiful Ceramics from Irene McCollum

Set of Prints from Cleonique Hilsaca


Sulfur Swag!

The Impact

We have been blown away by the wonderful response to the programs at Sulfur Studios in the past year.  Our Studios are full and we have a waiting list of artists who still need affordable workspace.  Our gallery has been used for so much more than just exhibitions - it has been transformed into a music venue, a movie theater and a classroom as needed.  By expanding Sulfur Studios into the upstairs of our building, we will be able to provide even more artists with affordable workspace, and schedule more community events without conflicts with exhibitions in the gallery.

Risks & Challenges

This is a big step for a young organization, but we feel that Sulfur Studios' track record over the past year has shown that we can take on big projects and make them happen.  

The building that houses Sulfur Studios is old and a bit temperamental, so there is always the chance we will incur unexpected costs during the renovation, but we are confident that we can find creative solutions to any problems that may arise.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't give a financial gift, you can still help us out.  We are always looking for volunteers to help with exhibitions and special events.  

Donations of paint, furniture and other supplies are always welcome and very much appreciated!

Finally, please share our campaign with your friends and family!

story:
Booya~!! Almost time for LIGHT-TECH, a solo arts exhibition by artist Kaliptus. 

The arts exhibition will be taking place at Knew Conscious gallery in Denver, Colorado, starting July 9th.  The show will consist of about 12-16 paintings and will be on display for a whole month.

                                      "Transceivers"  In progress for the show

For the arts exhibition, "Light-Tech", I will be combining elements from eastern mysticism with elements from western futurism to create visions that reflect upon a new kind of Light within consciousness. With this show, I want to hack the pleroma! I want explore some of the overmind technologies & paint the holo-transhumanism of the soul. I want to explore some the visions of "Mind-Light". I will be exploring Psy-Fi concepts, some of which will include humanoid beings of light that live in advanced far away star systems as sky travelers, light carriers and transceivers of mind light/compressed consciousness. Imagine a world where the beings just been around a bit longer. A world where we advantage all without disadvantaging any. I want to create blueprints that assist in the grand manifestation of a Golden Era across the galaxies for all... I will be painting the future of enlightenment, galactic phenomena, nebulas, energy generator cities, light-beings that may aesthetically look like robot buddhas, futuristic highways the lead to the sky, etc. etc.  The works will consist mostly of Acrylics and aerosol on canvas and will hopefully offer a new way of looking at things thru the "Psy-Fi" lens. Ideas of "attaining a light body for afterdeath travel across the galaxy" and conceptual blueprints of "vertical sky highways that connect the earth to the heavens" are just the beginning of it.  The entire show will be full of surprises so be sure not to miss it if you are in the Denver, CO area and are into topics such as visionary art and the future of enlightenment.

Kaliptus needs your help!

In order for Light-Tech to be as great as it needs to be, he needs to raise at least $1600. 

The funds will be used for canvases, high quality brushes, paint, mediums, frames and other supplies. Since Kaliptus is currently stationed in New Jersey, the funds raised would also go towards travel cost, shipment of paintings, temporary housing, food, etc.

::: Perks :::

An example selection of the mystery 6" x 4" prints

"Holotech" blotter prints, Printed on FSC-certified paper with vegetable based inks

"Hyper Innergy", One of the mystery 16" x 20" prints

If you want to support the "Light-Tech" visions and ideas for this show, please help Kaliptus raise $1600.

Thanks in advance!

:::)

story:
Hi! I'm Del of Del's Doodles - purveyor of fine illustrations for the discerning colourist :D

Many of you will already know me and will have contributed to my previous colouring book campaigns here on IndieGoGo. This one is a little different -

  • One fixed price, one tier, one reward - contribute $5, receive the digital download colouring pack when it's ready.
  • Digital download only! No physical product - these colouring pages will be assembled into a print-ready PDF and sent directly to your inbox for you to download, print and colour!
  • A minimum of 50 pages, however much I raise - but for every $5 over $500 I'll add one extra page, up to a maximum of 250 pages - so for the same price of $5, you can get a pack of up to 250 unique, beautiful colouring pages!

It's really that simple. Contribute $5 and you'll receive, when the images are ready, a bumper pack of, at minimum, 50 unique, original tiling patterns to colour - but the more contributions, the more pages I'll add - up to 250 tiling patterns to colour!

You will be provided with a print-ready PDF with every tiling image included at high resolution for good printing quality. I'll draw patterns in a variety of detail levels to suit all tastes, and the images will be provided at high enough resolution that you can get them printed larger than standard printer paper size, if you want!

The more the merrier! Spread the word - the more contributions, the bigger the colouring pack! Share this campaign with your colouring friends! <3

How To Pay?

I've had a few messages from people asking how they can back this project and claim their bumper colouring pack. There are two ways - to the right, where you see the featured 'Give Me My Patterns' box - hover over that box, and you'll see a 'Get This Perk' link. Click that. The second way is to click the 'Back It' button a little higher up the page - just underneath the bar that shows how much has been raised so far. IndieGoGo accepts a variety of payment methods including cards and PayPal. :)
