story:
Нажмите здесь, чтобы перейти к русскому тексту

Или здесь, чтобы взглянуть на вознаграждения, которые вы получите 

 Click here to take a look at our perks! Or here to contact us immediately.

A quarter of a century ago, Nikola-Lenivets was founded as a settlement by artists, architects and designers who left cities for the sake of practicing the arts in the wild. Nowadays it is the biggest art and landscape park in Europe which occupies more than 600 hectares of land. Dozens of giant installations are situated here, although some of them were burned down during the traditional Slavic holiday, Maslenitsa aka Butter Week. It is symbolic that Makhalych (from Russian word «makhat’» — «to wave» or «to flap») will be built here for the Burning Man Festival.

The kinetic sculpture Makhalych, which will be featured at the Burning Man 2016, is yet another incarnation of a russian architect and the founder of Nikola-Lenivets Vasily Schetinin’s character «Icarushka» (a Russian intimate hypocorism for Icarus).


History of Makhalych

The first prototype was made in the late 1980s. Schetinin managed to exhibit it abroad due to the fact that he was a member of the Soviet underground art group «Mit’ki». In those years,that was a true miracle. The second version of Icarushka became a symbol of «Peace Caravan», a festival of street theater arranged by Slava Polunin, and it was featured at exhibitions of several art and architecture museums.

Unlike Icarus, Makhalych: the Birding Man is a forty-yard giant who is not trying to get away to the sky. Pure movement is his final goal. This kinetic interactive object will be presented in the Black Rock Desert from 28 August to 5 September, 2016, Art Theme: Da Vinci's Workshop.

Makhalych refers to a variety of archetypal images: primarily birdlike flying machines by Leonardo da Vinci and Soviet avant-garde architect Vladimir Tatlin. A human figure, equipped with wings, is always the symbol which stands to counter injustice, transcend borders and celebrate human thought.


Specifications

The scale of Makhalych is due to the fact that the natural landscape serves as the exhibition space. The self-balancing kinetic interactive design consists of six eighteen-yard wooden wings,a sixteen-foot-long figure and a multimedia system for audio and visual effects. The weight of various parts of the sculpture is balanced in such a way that the efforts of one person suffice to bring it into motion.

The figure is made up of wooden hollow rings connected by metal bridges. Its weight is about three hundred kilograms. The six wings add almost two more tons. In the event of windstorms, the whole sculpture can be lowered to the ground in a few minutes.

Despite the team’s extensive experience in the creation of huge wooden installations and kinetic sculptures, this project is experimental, so some of the final design decisions may be made exclusively and directly during the manufacture and test assembling stages.


Stages of the project

Stage 1: the development of ideas and sketches. This process has actually spanned over a quarter of a century. Stage 2: the creation of the model of Makhalych in the ratio of 1 to 20. This has already been completed. The model (as featured in the video above) reflects precisely all the design parameters. Stage 3 recently commenced in a hangar located near Schetinin’s studio. The aim of this stage is to construct a full-sized wing. Stage 4 involves the production of all the six wings and hanging them to test for susceptibility to wind loads. Stage 5 begins simultaneously: the design of the figure which will form the basis of the sculpture. The final stages will take place from mid-May to late June, after which Makhalych will depart from Nikola-Lenivets through St. Petersburg and the Atlantic Ocean to the Black Rock Desert of Nevada, USA.

The Team

The core of Schetinin’s team consists of Vladimir, who developed the construction of such complex wooden art-objects as the Bobur and the Universal Mind (you should definitely take a look at it!), and Denis (on the left), who assembled by hand dozens of different sized models of Makhalych. The soundscape project, which is responsible for the creation of multi-channel audio installations in the forests of the Nikola-Lenivets park, will liven up the sculpture with light and sound effects.


Estimated budjet

This year the organizing committee of the Burning Man Festival made dream come true by providing a honorarium grant for the construction of Makhalych in the desert of Nevada, but in the end these funds can cover only a small part of the costs. We will still need to be supplied with numerous power tools, workshops space, transport to the Playa, and much more. Our expenses are even higher yet as we are coming to Black Rock from the middle of Russia.

The total budget for this piece is $97,000 which includes workshop rental and woodworking machine, salaries, materials, feasibility study, testing, shipping, transportation and installation of the artwork. Simultaneously to the crowd funding we are raising some private donations. We also will add some stretch goals as we approach the initial goal.

As you can see we need your support either way. If you can't help financially you always can aid Makhalych to spread the world by sharing info about this project in your social networks. Don't forget to use #makhalych hashtag!

Otherwise you can get one of our super cool perks (and be sure to look forward for the secret ones)!

What do we have to offer?
Here are our perks: Вознаграждения:

Postcard from Nikola-Lenivets /$10/ Открытка из Никола-Ленивца


Handcrafted cards /$20/ Линогравюра с Махалычем

The Birding Man for kids /$75/ Детский конструктор Birding Man


Personal video message /$30/ Видеоблагодарность от Василия Щетинина


Original author's sketches (we have only five and each of them is unique!) /$500/ Авторские эскизы (их только пять и каждый уникален!)


Footpath named after you (one of those that are marked in red) /$5000/ Назовите в свою честь одну из троп к «Тельцу Позолоченному», по которой ежегодно проходят десятки тысяч людей

Jump to contacts
Русская версия

Человек всегда мечтал обрести возможность летать. Благодаря вашей помощи в этом году в пустыне Блэк Рок взлетит «Махалыч: Birding man».


Четверть века назад в самом сердце России началась жизнь арт-парка Никола-Ленивец. За эти годы на его территории известные архитекторы из разных стран возвели десятки гигантских художественных инсталляций. Часть из них сжигалась во время Масленицы, что символически роднит Никола-Ленивец с фестивалем Burning Man. Этой весной именно здесь будет создана сорокаметровая кинетическая скульптура «Махалыч: Birding man».

Кинетический объект «Махалыч» для The Burning Man 2016 – очередное перерождение художественного персонажа архитектора Василия Щетинина «Икарушка», история которого началась в 1989 году.


История

Первый «Икарушка» был сделан в 1989 году из завалившегося забора. Ему, как и его мифологическому прототипу, удалось почти невозможное: выпорхнуть за границу, на выставку «Митьков» в Антверпен. Второй «Икарушка», наряженный в одежду художника, с гордо распростёртыми двенадцатиметровыми крыльями, стал символом фестиваля уличных театров «Караван мира», организованного Славой Полуниным. Истории взлётов и падений «Икарушки» была посвящена выставка, прошедшая в 2002 году в Государственном Музее Архитектуры им. Щусева.


Birding Man — уже не совсем «Икарушка». Этот сорокаметровый исполин не пытается взлететь; его крылья, чутко реагирующие на любые воздействия движутся, собственно, ради движения и одновременно создают своего рода укрытие, сень.

Кинетическая скульптура будет представлена в пустыне Блэк-Рок с 28 августа по 5 сентября. Тема фестиваля в этом году – наследие итальянского ренессанса.

«Махалыч» отсылает к целому ряду архетипических образов: птицеподобные летательные аппараты да Винчи, порождённый русским авангардом Летатлин. Во все времена фигура человека, приделавшего себе крылья, выступала символом противодействия несправедливости, преодоления границ возможного и торжества человеческой мысли.


Технические характеристики

Масштаб «Махалыча» исходит из того, что сама природа является для него экспозиционным пространством. Самоуравновешенная кинетическая интерактивная конструкция, дополненная светозвуковой инсталляцией, состоит из пятиметровой фигуры и трех пар крыльев, размах которых – тридцать шесть метров. 

Работая с распределением массы разных частей «Махалыча» команде удалось добиться такого уровня балансировки, что привести в движение всю конструкцию можно будет усилиями одного человека.

Человеческую фигуру архитектор собирается представить в виде ажурной конструкции, составленной из полых колец, соединенных металлическими перемычками. Её вес – около трехсот килограмм. Еще почти две тонны весят шесть крыльев. В случае возникновения ураганных ветров, иногда случающихся в пустыне, вся скульптура может за несколько минут быть опущена на землю.

Несмотря на большой опыт создания многометровых инсталляций из дерева и кинетических скульптур, имеющийся у команды, проект является экспериментальным, поэтому некоторые конструктивные решения могут быть приняты исключительно и непосредственно в процессе изготовления или тестирования в условиях пробного монтажа.


Этапы работы

I этап — разработка идеи и эскизов проекта. Этот процесс фактически растянулся на четверть века. II этап также пройден — создание модели «Махалыча» в масштабе 1:20, отражающей все параметры конструкции, от соотношения массы и размеров до угла наклона каждой пары крыльев. Точная копия движущегося «Махалыч» и запечатлена на видео. III этап — создание полноразмерного крыла, над которым уже начата работа в ангаре, расположенном неподалёку от мастерской Василия Щетинина. IV этап — производство шести крыльев и вывешивание их на строительный кран для испытания восприимчивости к ветряным нагрузкам. Параллельно с этим начинается V этап — конструирование фигуры человека, которая и составит основу композиции. Заключительные этапы будут происходить с середины мая до конца июня, после чего «Махалыч» отправится на пароме из Санкт-Петербурга через Атлантический океан в пустыню Блэк Рок штата Невада, США.


Команда


Костяк команды Василия Щетинина это Владимир, единолично продумавший конструктивное устройство таких сложнейших объектов из дерева, как Бобур и Вселенский разум (это стоит увидеть!), и Денис, чьими руками собраны десятки макетов Махалыча разных размеров. Коллектив проекта Soundscape, ответственный за создание многоканальных инсталляций в лесах вокруг парка Никола-Ленивец, оживит скульптуру светозвуковым наполнением.


Бюджет

В этом году оргкомитет фестиваля Burning Man приблизил возможность строительства масштабной скульптуры, предоставив грант. Но эти средства смогут покрыть лишь часть расходов. Для производства «Махалыча» необходимо арендовать ангар и оборудование, организовать транспортировку из Калужской области до Невады, и многое другое. Наши расходы еще выше, чем у других подобных проектов, так как нам предстоит перевести гигантский арт-объект через атлантический океан.

Общий бюджет составляет $97 000, и включает в себя аренду производства и станков, зарплаты рабочим, стоимость материалов и их доставку, проведение работ для расчета нагрузок, тестирование, транспортировку и оснащение скульптуры звуковым и световым наполнением. Одновременно с краудфандингом мы ищем средства и от частных спонсоров. Если нам удастся собрать заявленные $15 000 в опережающие наш оптимизм сроки, то мы не остановимся и будем добавлять новые лоты для продолжения кампании.

Нажмите здесь, чтобы взглянуть на вознаграждения, которые вы получите!


Feel free to contact us on Facebook, Instagram and Vkontakte. To get more visuals visit our Vimeo and Flickr.
story_txt:
Нажмите здесь, чтобы перейти к русскому тексту
Или здесь, чтобы взглянуть на вознаграждения, которые вы получите 

Click here to take a look at our perks! Or here to contact us immediately.




A quarter of a century ago, Nikola-Lenivets was founded as a settlement by artists, architects and designers who left cities for the sake of practicing the arts in the wild. Nowadays it is the biggest art and landscape park in Europe which occupies more than 600 hectares of land. Dozens of giant installations are situated here, although some of them were burned down during the traditional Slavic holiday, Maslenitsa aka Butter Week. It is symbolic that Makhalych (from Russian word «makhat’» — «to wave» or «to flap») will be built here for the Burning Man Festival.





The kinetic sculpture Makhalych, which will be featured at the Burning Man 2016, is yet another incarnation of a russian architect and the founder of Nikola-Lenivets Vasily Schetinin’s character «Icarushka» (a Russian intimate hypocorism for Icarus).



History of Makhalych
The first prototype was made in the late 1980s. Schetinin managed to exhibit it abroad due to the fact that he was a member of the Soviet underground art group «Mit’ki». In those years,that was a true miracle. The second version of Icarushka became a symbol of «Peace Caravan», a festival of street theater arranged by Slava Polunin, and it was featured at exhibitions of several art and architecture museums.





Unlike Icarus, Makhalych: the Birding Man is a forty-yard giant who is not trying to get away to the sky. Pure movement is his final goal. This kinetic interactive object will be presented in the Black Rock Desert from 28 August to 5 September, 2016, Art Theme: Da Vinci's Workshop.


Makhalych refers to a variety of archetypal images: primarily birdlike flying machines by Leonardo da Vinci and Soviet avant-garde architect Vladimir Tatlin. A human figure, equipped with wings, is always the symbol which stands to counter injustice, transcend borders and celebrate human thought.



Specifications
The scale of Makhalych is due to the fact that the natural landscape serves as the exhibition space. The self-balancing kinetic interactive design consists of six eighteen-yard wooden wings,a sixteen-foot-long figure and a multimedia system for audio and visual effects. The weight of various parts of the sculpture is balanced in such a way that the efforts of one person suffice to bring it into motion.


The figure is made up of wooden hollow rings connected by metal bridges. Its weight is about three hundred kilograms. The six wings add almost two more tons. In the event of windstorms, the whole sculpture can be lowered to the ground in a few minutes.





Despite the team’s extensive experience in the creation of huge wooden installations and kinetic sculptures, this project is experimental, so some of the final design decisions may be made exclusively and directly during the manufacture and test assembling stages.


 Stages of the project
Stage 1: the development of ideas and sketches. This process has actually spanned over a quarter of a century. Stage 2: the creation of the model of Makhalych in the ratio of 1 to 20. This has already been completed. The model (as featured in the video above) reflects precisely all the design parameters. Stage 3 recently commenced in a hangar located near Schetinin’s studio. The aim of this stage is to construct a full-sized wing. Stage 4 involves the production of all the six wings and hanging them to test for susceptibility to wind loads. Stage 5 begins simultaneously: the design of the figure which will form the basis of the sculpture. The final stages will take place from mid-May to late June, after which Makhalych will depart from Nikola-Lenivets through St. Petersburg and the Atlantic Ocean to the Black Rock Desert of Nevada, USA.

 The Team

The core of Schetinin’s team consists of Vladimir, who developed the construction of such complex wooden art-objects as the Bobur and
the Universal Mind (you should definitely take a look at it!), and Denis (on the left), who assembled by hand dozens of different sized models of Makhalych. The soundscape project, which is responsible for the creation of multi-channel audio installations in the forests of the Nikola-Lenivets park, will liven up the sculpture with light and sound effects.

Estimated budjet
This year the organizing committee of the Burning Man Festival made dream come true by providing a honorarium grant for the construction of Makhalych in the desert of Nevada, but in the end these funds can cover only a small part of the costs. We will still need to be supplied with numerous power tools, workshops space, transport to the Playa, and much more. Our expenses are even higher yet as we are coming to Black Rock from the middle of Russia.


The total budget for this piece is $97,000 which includes workshop rental and woodworking machine, salaries, materials, feasibility study, testing, shipping, transportation and installation of the artwork. Simultaneously to the crowd funding we are raising some private donations. We also will add some stretch goals as we approach the initial goal.

As you can see we need your support either way. If you can't help financially you always can aid Makhalych to spread the world by sharing info about this project in your social networks. Don't forget to use #makhalych hashtag!

Otherwise you can get one of our super cool perks (and be sure to look forward for the secret ones)!

What do we have to offer?
Here are our perks: Вознаграждения:
Postcard from Nikola-Lenivets /$10/ Открытка из Никола-Ленивца


Handcrafted cards /$20/ Линогравюра с Махалычем


The Birding Man for kids /$75/ Детский конструктор Birding Man



Personal video message /$30/ Видеоблагодарность от Василия Щетинина

Original author's sketches (we have only five and each of them is unique!) /$500/ Авторские эскизы (их только пять и каждый уникален!)



Footpath named after you (one of those that are marked in red) /$5000/ Назовите в свою честь одну из троп к «Тельцу Позолоченному», по которой ежегодно проходят десятки тысяч людей


Jump to contacts

Русская версия

Человек всегда мечтал обрести возможность летать. Благодаря вашей помощи в этом году в пустыне Блэк Рок взлетит «Махалыч: Birding man».
Четверть века назад в самом сердце России началась жизнь арт-парка Никола-Ленивец. За эти годы на его территории известные архитекторы из разных стран возвели десятки гигантских художественных инсталляций. Часть из них сжигалась во время Масленицы, что символически роднит Никола-Ленивец с фестивалем Burning Man. Этой весной именно здесь будет создана сорокаметровая кинетическая скульптура «Махалыч: Birding man».

Кинетический объект «Махалыч» для The Burning Man 2016 – очередное перерождение художественного персонажа архитектора Василия Щетинина «Икарушка», история которого началась в 1989 году.
История
Первый «Икарушка» был сделан в 1989 году из завалившегося забора. Ему, как и его мифологическому прототипу, удалось почти невозможное: выпорхнуть за границу, на выставку «Митьков» в Антверпен. Второй «Икарушка», наряженный в одежду художника, с гордо распростёртыми двенадцатиметровыми крыльями, стал символом фестиваля уличных театров «Караван мира», организованного Славой Полуниным. Истории взлётов и падений «Икарушки» была посвящена выставка, прошедшая в 2002 году в Государственном Музее Архитектуры им. Щусева.

Birding Man — уже не совсем «Икарушка». Этот сорокаметровый исполин не пытается взлететь; его крылья, чутко реагирующие на любые воздействия движутся, собственно, ради движения и одновременно создают своего рода укрытие, сень.
Кинетическая скульптура будет представлена в пустыне Блэк-Рок с 28 августа по 5 сентября. Тема фестиваля в этом году – наследие итальянского ренессанса.
«Махалыч» отсылает к целому ряду архетипических образов: птицеподобные летательные аппараты да Винчи, порождённый русским авангардом Летатлин. Во все времена фигура человека, приделавшего себе крылья, выступала символом противодействия несправедливости, преодоления границ возможного и торжества человеческой мысли.
Технические характеристики

Масштаб «Махалыча» исходит из того, что сама природа является для него экспозиционным пространством. Самоуравновешенная кинетическая интерактивная конструкция, дополненная светозвуковой инсталляцией, состоит из пятиметровой фигуры и трех пар крыльев, размах которых – тридцать шесть метров. 
Работая с распределением массы разных частей «Махалыча» команде удалось добиться такого уровня балансировки, что привести в движение всю конструкцию можно будет усилиями одного человека.



Человеческую фигуру архитектор собирается представить в виде ажурной конструкции, составленной из полых колец, соединенных металлическими перемычками. Её вес – около трехсот килограмм. Еще почти две тонны весят шесть крыльев. В случае возникновения ураганных ветров, иногда случающихся в пустыне, вся скульптура может за несколько минут быть опущена на землю.

Несмотря на большой опыт создания многометровых инсталляций из дерева и кинетических скульптур, имеющийся у команды, проект является экспериментальным, поэтому некоторые конструктивные решения могут быть приняты исключительно и непосредственно в процессе изготовления или тестирования в условиях пробного монтажа.
Этапы работы
I этап — разработка идеи и эскизов проекта. Этот процесс фактически растянулся на четверть века. II этап также пройден — создание модели «Махалыча» в масштабе 1:20, отражающей все параметры конструкции, от соотношения массы и размеров до угла наклона каждой пары крыльев. Точная копия движущегося «Махалыч» и запечатлена на видео. III этап — создание полноразмерного крыла, над которым уже начата работа в ангаре, расположенном неподалёку от мастерской Василия Щетинина. IV этап — производство шести крыльев и вывешивание их на строительный кран для испытания восприимчивости к ветряным нагрузкам. Параллельно с этим начинается V этап — конструирование фигуры человека, которая и составит основу композиции. Заключительные этапы будут происходить с середины мая до конца июня, после чего «Махалыч» отправится на пароме из Санкт-Петербурга через Атлантический океан в пустыню Блэк Рок штата Невада, США.
Команда



Костяк команды Василия Щетинина это Владимир, единолично продумавший конструктивное устройство таких сложнейших объектов из дерева, как Бобур и
Вселенский разум (это стоит увидеть!), и Денис, чьими руками собраны десятки макетов Махалыча разных размеров. Коллектив проекта Soundscape, ответственный за создание многоканальных инсталляций в лесах вокруг парка Никола-Ленивец, оживит скульптуру светозвуковым наполнением.
Бюджет
В этом году оргкомитет фестиваля Burning Man приблизил возможность строительства масштабной скульптуры, предоставив грант. Но эти средства смогут покрыть лишь часть расходов. Для производства «Махалыча» необходимо арендовать ангар и оборудование, организовать транспортировку из Калужской области до Невады, и многое другое. Наши расходы еще выше, чем у других подобных проектов, так как нам предстоит перевести гигантский арт-объект через атлантический океан.


Общий бюджет составляет $97 000, и включает в себя аренду производства и станков, зарплаты рабочим, стоимость материалов и их доставку, проведение работ для расчета нагрузок, тестирование, транспортировку и оснащение скульптуры звуковым и световым наполнением. Одновременно с краудфандингом мы ищем средства и от частных спонсоров. Если нам удастся собрать заявленные $15 000 в опережающие наш оптимизм сроки, то мы не остановимся и будем добавлять новые лоты для продолжения кампании.

story:
I've always wanted to create enamel pins but the investment for one person is nothing to shake a stick at- by opening for preorders through a crowdfunding site, I can both gauge interest and keep everything transparent and organized throughout the process! I really want to get these pins made for you guys, I hope you're as excited about this project as I am 

  • My goal is to raise $1500. This would allow me to make both runs of the pin- and have some left over to sell in my etsy shop. 
  • If I reach the $1500 mark, I'll be able to run them as hard enamel rather than soft! 

 

I have never done a project this large-scale before! It will take at least a month but no more than 3 months depending on how fast the funding goes and how long it takes the pin wizards to make my pins.

Anything helps! You don't have to give me money to help this project! Sharing links on twitter, tumblr, etc is HUGE! 

 

THANK YOU so much in advance!

story:
Black Rock City can be a harsh environment and STARWEN will be there to support Burners throughout their journeys!

STARWEN will proudly be housed by Sacbe/Maxa Camp (K & 9:15). Resident healers Dr. Tania Rivera, Hayley Starr, and Jo Little, and others will offer sessions including: Cranial Sacral, Human Tuning, Medical Chi Gong, Sound Healing, Energy Protection, Soul Readings, essential oils, supplements and more… Available to all!

The Diamond is a shape of clarity and ascension. The structure is energetically programmed to protect and positively charge a 0.9 mile radius. It is currently being constructed by Futureproof in Los Angeles and will be ready just in time for the Burn. 

Please support this mission and help us bring her to Life! While myself and others are contributing to this project ourselves, along with our time and intention, we need the help of the community to truly bring this to life in its fullest expression. Plus, we'd love to connect with and heal many more beautiful souls. So please contribute <3

With Deep Gratitude,

The STARWEN Team

story:
That's right, COCKADOODLES is a penis-themed colouring and activity book. Each of our 32 images are printed single-sided on high quality paper for your colouring pleasure. It's real and it's spectacular.



To Be Briefs

I made a joke last winter about how adult colouring books don't have any actual adult content. That joke spiraled out of control and lead to a nearly year long project to make a colouring book full of dicks. I can't wait until we make the cover of Time magazine!

All images have been made safeish for work, Cockadoodles is a banana
(but not nut) free product.


We've got a timeline from our printer that comfortably allows us to guarantee a few hundred of these by Christmas, with the rest coming quickly behind. We promise to ship as many as we can so you'll have them in time for the holidays!

This is legit...at least as legit as a colouring book full of tallywhackers can be. 

If this isn't for you, just think of all the enjoyment you'll get from gifting this in your office secret santa! Maybe your grandma watches a lot of Jerry Springer, she'd probably like this. Give a copy of Cockadoodles to your buddies, they'll love or hate it. There's nothing in between.
 

Give Us Cash & Take Our Wangs

We need to raise about $5000 in order to not lose money in printing and shipping Cockadoodles. Your dolla dolla bills will go toward printing the orders, purchasing envelopes/address labels, and shipping 'em out. The more we raise the cheaper things get for us, so we can add value (pages!) if there's serious demand for our packages.

We've spent hundreds of hours on this project between the seriously questionable research, drawing, and making dick jokes. We've told our families and friends about this. I told my girlfriend's parents about this, which was great and not at all weird.

We've got a lot riding on the project, largely our dignity.

In the event that we don't raise the full $5000, we'll get a small print run and still get you the book one way or another.

We just want this to exist in the world.

The Impact

We think the world will be a happier place with Cockadoodles in it. 

Cockadoodles was one of those ideas that lingered for a few months before diving in. We started looking at a lot of penises, which lead to some really uncomfortable conversations about what sort of dicks we liked for the book and why. 

​We're just two 28 year olds with a year-long ongoing dick joke, and everybody likes a good dick joke right?
 

Risks & Challenges

If no one buys this, we seriously looked at cocks for a whole effing year for nothing. That's pretty funny though, so I mean...let's start over.

Our biggest challenge was in creating the book, which is done. We got the real work out of the way so you know that you're buying our book of dicks, not our time/effort to go ahead and create it.

The biggest risk moving forward is in printing and shipping the orders. Given our printer's timeline and potential shipping delays as we approach the holiday season, we've set a limit that we're comfortable in delivering by Christmas.

Otherwise the only risk remaining is that people don't like Cockadoodles, which is silly because it's hilarious.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell your friends/enemies/frenemies and literally anyone who will listen. Share it on social media! If you don't want to buy Cockadoodles, at least do us the service of mocking it openly and loudly so we can rack up those Facebook likes.

About the Artists(?)

Our names are Connor and Chris. We're Canadian and we grew up in Niagara Falls, Ontario. This is actually our second project together. We've also got a podcast called Stuck in the 90s which was featured on the front page of the Canadian iTunes Store for a while, as well as on the CBC Radio 1 show 'Podcast Playlist'. Those were both super cool. The podcast was Chris' idea, I guess this is how I'm repaying him.

Risks & Challenges
If no one buys this, we seriously looked at cocks for a whole effing year for nothing. That's pretty funny though, so I mean...let's start over.Our biggest challenge was in creating the book, which is done. We got the real work out of the way so you know that you're buying our book of dicks, not our time/effort to go ahead and create it.The biggest risk moving forward is in printing and shipping the orders. Given our printer's timeline and potential shipping delays as we approach the holiday season, we've set a limit that we're comfortable in delivering by Christmas.Otherwise the only risk remaining is that people don't like Cockadoodles, which is silly because it's hilarious. 
Other Ways You Can Help
Tell your friends/enemies/frenemies and literally anyone who will listen. Share it on social media! If you don't want to buy Cockadoodles, at least do us the service of mocking it openly and loudly so we can rack up those Facebook likes.About the Artists(?)Our names are Connor and Chris. We're Canadian and we grew up in Niagara Falls, Ontario. This is actually our second project together. We've also got a podcast called Stuck in the 90s which was featured on the front page of the Canadian iTunes Store for a while, as well as on the CBC Radio 1 show 'Podcast Playlist'. Those were both super cool. The podcast was Chris' idea, I guess this is how I'm repaying him.

story:
In English | En Español
Experience and share Chilean classical music trough abstract art with original paintings, prints and greeting cards.


About this project


Hi, my name is Jacqueline Unanue, I am a Chilean-Spanish-American visual artist living in Philadelphia PA, USA.

My traveling exhibition will span 3 countries. My Ancient Land series is inspired by the music of Chilean Classical Composers and my multicultural memories.



Perks Summary
More about them below




Exhibition
Main Pieces


The Exhibition is composed of 24 pieces, 7 of them are really big (see below).



Exhibition
The Artwork


Here are all the pieces of it.

See more here.



Inspiration
Chilean Classic Composers


Immersed in this music as I painted, l felt it flow through me physically and found myself expressing both the movement of the music and my own emotions in free and spontaneous brush strokes that are musical as well as gestural.

I’ve been influenced by renowned Chilean classical composers. Among others:

René Amengual

Jorge Urrutia

Eulogio Dávalos

Juan Orrego-Salas

Enrique Soro

Sylvia Soublette



Inspiration
My homeland Chile, Spain, United States


Chile, the country where I was born and where I developed my artistic career, is firmly recorded in my memory. The colors I have used suggest -in an abstract way-, my memories of the geography, the forest, the desert, the ocean, and the Chilean sky.

Those memories are meshed with both the experiences I had in my many travels to Spain to connect with my father’s ancestral roots and also with my experience in the United States where I have lived for almost fifteen years and where I continue to develop an artistic vision formed by my multi-cultural experiences.



Perks

All perks include my eternal thanks, an invitation to the 3 exhibitions. Also, your name will be pointed out in the names wall list in each gallery.

* Please visit my website, there you will also find more available pieces!



Exhibition Locations


1- Embassy of Chile, Washington DC, United States. March 18 - April 4, 2015. http://chileabroad.gov.cl/estados-unidos/

2- Sala Viña del Mar, Viña del Mar, Chile. April 14 – May9, 2015. http://www.culturaviva.cl/

3- Centre cultural La Casa Elizalde, Barcelona, Spain. September 15 - October 16, 2015. http://www.casaelizalde.com/



About the artist


Jacqueline Unanue was born in Chile, and studied design at the Universidad de Chile de Valparaíso. She traveled extensively through Chile’s Atacama Desert and Altamira caves, Spain, doing on-site research.

In addition to numerous individual and group exhibitions in Chile since 1983, she has also been exhibited in Spain, Finland, Ecuador, Argentina, and the United States—in galleries in Washington D.C., Philadelphia, Chicago, and New York.

Since year 2000, she lives in Philadelphia PA, USA, where she is represented by 3rd Street Gallery.

For more information visit her website



Costs


My goal is to raise at least US $9,600 of the funds I need to pay for my trips, transportation, and hanging my exhibitions through this campaign.

  • Airplane tickets for Chile & Spain USD $ 3,000
  • Artwork transportation USD $ 1,900
  • Works on paper framing for Chile & Spain USD $2,000
  • Brochure, one design for the exhibitions in Chile and Spain USD $ 600
  • Housing USD $ 900
  • Promotional video USD $300
  • IndieGoGo fees and perks USD $900

Note: if your donations exceed my goal of at least $9,600, I will use that surplus to defray the cost of materials I have used to produce this series of painting.

In English | En Español
Exposición individual itinerante en Estados Unidos, Chile y España.
Vive la experiencia de sentir música clásica chilena a través de pinturas abstractas originales, reproducciones y tarjetas de saludo.



Acerca de este proyecto


Hola, mi nombre es Jacqueline Unanue, soy una artista visual chilena-española-americana. Vivo en Filadelfia, PA, Estados Unidos.

Mi exposición itinerante comprende 3 países. La serie Mi Antigua Tierra está inspirada en la música de compositores clásicos chilenos y en en mis experiencias multiculturales.



Resumen de Obsequios
Más información abajo




Exposición
Piezas principales


La exposición está compuesta de 24 obras, 7 de ellas son realmente grandes



Exposición
Las piezas


Estas son todas la piezas.

Ver más aquí.



Inspiración
Compositores Clásicos Chilenos


Inmersa en estas obras musicales, mientras pintaba, sentí fluir la música físicamente hacia mí y me enontré expresándome a través de sus movimientos y de mis propias emociones, mediante trazos libres y espontáneos, generando pinturas musicales y gestuales.

He sido influenciada por renombrados compositores clásicos chilenos. Entre ellos:

René Amengual

Jorge Urrutia Blondel

Eulogio Dávalos

Juan Orrego-Salas

Enrique Soro

Sylvia Soublette



Inspiración
Mi país Chile, España y Estados Unidos


Chile, el país donde nací y donde me desarrollé artísticamente, está firmemente grabado en mi memoria.Los colores que he usado, sugieren -en un modo abstracto-, mis recuerdos de la geografía, de la vegetación, del desierto, del océano, y del firmamento chilenos.

Esos recuerdos se entremezclan con las vivencias obtenidas durante mis frecuentes viajes a España para conectarme con mis raíces ancestrales paternas, así como también con la experiencia en los Estados Unidos, donde he vivido por casi quince años y donde he seguido desarrollando una visión artística surgida desde mis vivencias multiculturales.

3- Centro Cultural La Casa Elizalde, Barcelona, España. 15 de Septiembre- 16 de Octubre, 2015. http://www.casaelizalde.com/



Acerca de la artista


Jacqueline Unanue nació en Chile y estudió diseño en la Universidad de Chile de Valparaíso. Viajó extensamente , realizando investigación en sitio a través del desierto de Atacama, Chile y a las cuevas de Altamira en España.

Además de numerosas exposiciones individuales y colectivas en Chile desde 1983, también ha expuesto en España, Finlandia, Ecuador, Argentina y Estados Unidos -en galerías de Washington DC, Filadelfia, Chicago y Nueva York.

Vive en Filadelfia, PA, Estados Unidos, donde es representada por la 3 ª Street Gallery.

Para más información visita su website



Los Costos


Mi meta es recaudar a través de esta campaña al menos US $ 9,600 de los fondos que necesito para pagar mis viajes, transporte, y montaje de mis exposiciones.

  • Pasaje de avión a Chile & España USD $ 3,000

Nota: Si vuestras donaciones exceden mi meta de al menos $9,600, usaré ese excedente para costear los gastos de materiales con los que he producido esta serie de pinturas.

story:
This is simple: 

  • We have a pretty amazing surprise that we're bringing to the Temple this year.
  • It's really quite neat and there's never been anything like it at the Temple before.
  • It cost us about $3k to put together at the last minute, and a couple team members went into debt personally to deliver this.
  • We don't have the time or spare resources to do tangible perks for this final campaign, and are hoping that the joy of seeing this on playa is why you'll help.
Burning Man is almost upon us, and members of our team are already on the playa working to bring you a pretty darn incredible Temple. Help because you haven't contributed to the Temple yet and feel like you should. 

Help because this surprise is going to make the Temple even more special.

We're building this Temple for you (and it's going to be spectacular!)

Thank you,
The Dreamer's Guild

story:
ABOUT OLLIE

Hi, I'm Oliver, or Ollie for short! I'm a Chinese-American, queer, nonbinary-trans person living in Portland, OR. I use they/he pronouns. For about two years I have been the evil mastermind behind hournoon - a mixed-media illustration, crafts, + apparel design project. Visual art has been an integral aspect to me since I was very young. I have dedicated two decades to getting lost in color and pursuing many mediums of art, including illustration, resin casting, fiber arts,  and music. 

I hope to bring safer spaces, body loving acceptance and accommodation to my tattooing. I struggle with disassociation and dysphoria in my daily life, and I have found solace in being able to look to the ink in my skin as another reminder that I'm here, living, and three-dimensional. This grounding experience is sincerely important to me, and I want to use my years of practice as an illustrator to aid anyone else struggling with similar feelings through tattoo work. I'd also just love to tattoo people who enjoy my art - a big thank you to those of you who do!

This can be possible with your help! Help me complete my tuition for tattoo school!

SCHOOL?

Completing a program authorized by the Oregon Board of Body Art Practitioners is required in this state to obtain a tattooing license. I've been accepted into the March term at Point of View tattoo school. You can read more about Point of View's tattoo school here: https://www.pointofviewtattooschool.com/

I have personally saved 70% of the tuition ($7000/$10000) working full time as a manager at my day job, and through hournoon. Scholarships and grants for trade schools like tattooing are tough, if not impossible, to obtain. Due to this, I am reaching out to my friends, family, peers and community to help bring me across this last leg of my tuition. If exceeded, anything received over my goal will continue to go towards my tattooing career: obtaining a machine, supplies, studio space, etc. 

PERKS

Your support means so much, so I want to give back with perks! 

For every $5 donation, you'll receive one starry wolf sticker, exclusive to this fundraiser! Starry wolf will be printed on mirror vinyl, locally in Portland by Stickerninja.

 

For every $15, you'll get the starry wolf sticker, plus the frightful friends sticker pack! 

$30 gets you the full sticker pack, as well as 3 assorted buttons!

$50 donations will get an original illustration! A traditionally inked piece mailed to you! (8"x7")

$150 donations will be available to portland locals + those willing to travel! You can pick from my pre-made flash designs, or work with me on a custom piece for your body. My tattooing books will open after I complete school around spring of 2020. Anyone who pledged on this tier will be contacted to schedule their appointment with me then!

 

THANK YOU!

Thank you so much for reading through this! Every word of warm support means so much to me! If you would like to browse through more of my work, you can visit my website http://hournoon.com or on instagram + twitter @hournoon

Another way you can support me directly is by buying some stuff from my shop! http://shop.hournoon.com I have apparel, stickers, prints and more available! 

Feel free to share my original posts about this campaign on social media! Every share helps! If I haven't made a post on a site, share away! Here's some from the sites I regularly use:

instagram / twitter / facebook

story:
I'm an artist.

And like everyone, I have a goal and hope to make a name for myself. Unfortunately, I've been using a trial version of Open Canvas since I had to spend my money on a new computer (the old one had some hardware issue I couldn't figure out.) The trial ends in around 70 days, and I have no idea what I'll do then.

To make art, I need supplies!

This new computer, since it was more of an 'emergency purchase', can't even run photoshop without lagging. If possible, I'd like to buy a RAM upgrade for it. I also need to, of course, buy either Photoshop or OpenCanvas. Then, I need to buy a good tablet, because the kind I'm using currently... Well, I've used this model in the past, and it's always broken after a year or two, because it's cheap. A wacom tablet would be awesome, but everyone knows those cost a fortune!

I do fee art for people most of the time.

I've joined in to a few projects, including making VN's, doing comics based on kids shows, and pretty much anything else people have asked of me. Others rely on me, and I'd feel terrible if I had to ditch the projects I joined. Especially when a few are so promising! I like to draw people free art for their birthdays, or draw get well soon pictures. Mostly, I like helping people, and making them smile. I generally don't ask anything in return. 

If you can't help me, maybe someone else can?

Maybe you have a friend who really needs some drawings done. I don't know what your situation is, or the people around you, but I'd really appreciate the help. You can feel free to spread the word! Thank you in advance!

Art examples below.
Lineart and shading;

Refined lineart;

A shaded sketch;

Hi Guys! My name is Janelle Richmond and I am launching this Fundraiser as a gift to one of the most amazing young ladies I have the pleasure of knowing. Our girl, Erika Petra, has a Birthday right around the corner and What better time could there be to kick off a new dream career? Nobody deserves a fabulous vacation and a little Faerie Magic more than our Beautiful Erika!  

Everyone who has ever met her knows that she pours her heart and soul into everyone else in her life, and puts herself last. Our girl is always on the go and takes care of everyone around her, but it is time for her to start chasing her dreams! We are starting a Mermaid Pod right here on the California Central Coast! This trip to Greece is not only a celebration for Erika, but it is also The Jump start we are hoping for to get our Mer-pod off the ground!  I would love nothing more than to be able to send her on an amazing Grecian Dream vacation to Santorini!! Most of the costs have already been covered, but it would mean the world to all of us if we could raise the money to cover her travel costs too! Obviously, she would never do this for herself so I went behind her back and set this up! Can you imagine the look on her face when she gets the money we raise?!?!? 

If you guys could possibly find it in your hearts to donate Anything at all, It would be amazing! I can't offer you too much just yet, but I can promise some REALLY cool and rather magical photos from Erika and Myself coming up really soon! ;) If we can get her to Greece, I promise, I will stick her in a tail and we will be doing a MERMAID photo shoot on the Beach!! 

Please, please, please...She is so wonderful and has brought so much love and joy into my life and into the lives of everyone she meets. Nobody deserves this more than she does. 

Any and EVERY little bit helps!

story:
Help me use my creativity to get off the streets

I am currently living rough and looking for backers so I can purchase accommodation and work full time on a colouring book to get me back on track in life.

#HelpDaniel

Sea life colouring book suitable for adults and children.

  • 100% detailed, no filler pages
  • Natural designs based on real creatures
  • Designed to help peoples mental health
  • High quality paper and print

What will I do with the funds?

  • Get housed for the next 3-4 months
  • Work full time on the colouring book
  • Printing, Post and Packaging

Funding Goals

Up to and over £3000

24 Page colouring book

Over £6000

I will extend the book to include more pages for a total of 36.

Over £9000

The book will be a total of 48 pages!

story:
Short Summary


The Good Women Cooperative is comprised of 40 female artisanal leaders striving for economic independence and stability for Amazigh women and culture in Ayt Hassan, Morocco. I, CorpsAfrica Volunteer Elghali Guennouni, am producing this campaign to assist the Good Women Cooperative in raising funds for the materials, training, and marketplace access necessary to make their cooperative sustainable and financially viable. This will allow these women and their families much needed regular non-agriculture based income.

What We Need & What You Get

The vision of the Good Women Cooperative is to preserve and improve upon the unique and original Amazigh craft techniques and patterns currently being used by the artisans, while at the same time adapting these skills for more modern product lines. 

 

Boucherouite Rug /Measurement : 1.50 *1.16/ Colors : white, black, bright blue, green and yellow/ Material : thread and fabric/ Artizens names : Mina bouchoucha, amina aythouyn, amina bouzid and fatima bandham/ 

Jewlories //MAmazigh neckless //easurement : necklace and bracelet/ Color : blue, red, and black/ Material : beadwork and fishing thread /Artizens name : Fatima ouhamou

Gouzlavi embroidery /Table runner/ Measurement : 1.50 * 1.50 /Color : Pink and brown/ Material : thread /Artizens name : Mina mansour and maryam mouslih 

Gouzlavie Khmissa Embroidery /Measurement : 35 * 30/ Colors : bright blue, orange/ Material : thread/ Artizens name : Naima bandham/ 

Basket /Measurement : small, medium and large/ Color : green, yellow , red and blue /Material : raffia and thread/ Artizens name : Habiba nasir rqiya wasif and ruqaiya abouzid 

                                       Clove neckless

This means the continued and improved production of Amazigh necklaces, rugs, and other traditional products, while at the same time adapting these designs for the production of shirts, pants, wallet, baskets, caps, pillow cases, etc. To do this the cooperative will need 2 sewing machines, a serger, and an embroidery machine plus supplies to begin product production. They are also going to invite a group of successful women artisans from Fez, the artisanal capital of Morocco, to do a 10 day workshop with them. This workshop will cover modernized textile techniques and lessons on running a sustainable and economically viable women owned cooperative in Morocco.

 Lastly, the women will need a higher end camera and computer.  This will allow them access to the international market and other entrepreneurs, which is vital to their success due to the saturation of the standard Moroccan marketplaces with “traditional goods.”  These items will also help them bypass the pitfalls of the male dominated traditional Moroccan business world.  The women of this village had, at one time, worked to produce handicrafts for a private business, but were discouraged by their lack of commercial gain.  They separated themselves from that venture, that is how they develop themselves into an independent, cooperative group.

 The perks we are offering showcase products that the women currently produce, or are in the process of developing…


The Impact


This project will benefit the entire community by spreading the wealth of knowledge that already exists within the community to all those interested while at the same time supplementing their artistic skills with business skills that will allow them to take full control over their product. 

                                                               Craft Spirit Program

Empowering all interested parties, men and women alike, will mean that while they are preserving, and improving upon, Amazigh craftsmanship, they are also adding a new source of income that is not reliant upon weather conditions. There is already an existing culture of sharing in the village, and there are people willing and able to share their skills and tools in order to expand the number of participants in the project. 

There already exists unique and original craft techniques and patterns that can easily be transferred to a myriad of goods such as shirts, pants, wallet, baskets, caps, pillow cases, and many other goods that people would want to buy. However, the goods are only a source of income if there is a market to purchase them in. 


Objective: To provide assistance to an aspiring women’s textile business

Introduction: The women of this village had, at one time, worked to produce handicrafts for a private business. Discouraged by certain demands for commercial gain they separated themselves from that venture. Introduced to the Corps Africa representative assigned to their village, they recognized this as an opportunity to develop themselves into an independent, cooperative group. They are now looking at improving existing talents and developing designs for the niche marketing of Amazigh products.


Risks & Challenges

The real challenge developing marketplaces for the products of the Good Women Cooperative. This being addressed through the development of a wordpress site, this indiegogo campaign, and promoting interior Amazigh design adaptations to Riyadh, restaurant, and guesthouse owners.

The Good Women Cooperative also offers a “Craft Spirit Program”. Potential clients who wish to develop craft ideas and products are invited to the village, given lodging the home of one of the artisans, and treated to the Amazigh cooking and lifestyle experience for three days. During this time the client develops and workshops their idea with the artisans, with a prototype of the final product being given as a gift at the end their stay.


Other Ways You Can HELP

Of course, donating money is one of the main forms of supporting this project. We also appreciate you sharing this campaign with other business communities and on social media. Lastly, any connections to markets eager for Amazigh goods is always appreciated.

story: We are recreating Burning Man 2015 for the digital world of Virtual reality. With the growing emergence of VR, LA League of Arts is on our second year of archiving and rebuilding Black Rock City as an open experience VR App that can be enjoyed by the general public on many virtual reality platforms as well as standard desktops and laptops. This a personally developed project that has no corporate partnerships what so ever.
story_txt: We are recreating Burning Man 2015 for the digital world of Virtual reality. With the growing emergence of  VR, LA League of Arts is on our second year of archiving and rebuilding Black Rock City as an open experience VR App that can be enjoyed by the general public on many virtual reality platforms as well as standard desktops and laptops. This a personally developed project that has no corporate partnerships what so ever.

story:
Semana Gótica de Madrid / Madrid Gothic Week


La Asociación Cultural Besarilia organiza la Semana Gótica de Madrid desde 2009. Desde entonces, cada año, hemos mostrado al público la belleza y riqueza del siglo XIX, profundizando en los enigmas del Romanticismo y de las distintas manifestaciones culturales que han extendido su legado hasta nuestros días, a través de la literatura, la música, el cine, la moda, y las artes plásticas y escénicas, con éxito y amplia repercusión nacional e internacional.

Besarilia Cultural Association organizes Madrid Gothic Week from 2009. Since then, every year, we have showed the beauty and richness of the nineteenth century, deepened into the mysteries of Romanticism and the various cultural expressions that have extended their legacy to the present day, through literature, music, film, fashion, and visual and performing arts, successful and extensive national and international impact.


Nuestro evento promueve:


La obra de autores contemporáneos y clásicos en el Encuentro de Literatura.

El trabajo de artistas plásticos en SGM Art.

Las colecciones de diseñadores de moda noveles en Plataforma G.

Conciertos y música de grupos underground a través del SGM Festival y Virus G zine.

Los cortometrajes, documentales y video arte de nuevos realizadores audiovisuales en la Ventana Oscura.

Las producciones independientes de danza y teatro en Teatrífico.

Los estudios culturales a través del Congreso sobre arte, literatura y cultura gótica urbana, y de la publicación de la revista académica Herejía y Belleza.


Our event promotes:


The work of classic and present-day authors in the Literature Meeting.

The work of artists in SGM Art.

The fashion collections of young designers in G Platform.

Concerts and underground music concerts through SGM Festival and Virus G zine.

Shortfilms, documentaries and video art of new film makers in Ventana Oscura.

Independent drama and dance productions in Teatrífico.

Cultural studies through the Conference on Art, Literature and Urban Gothic Culture, and the academic magazine Heresy and Beauty.


Por qué apoyarnos


Porque somos un evento único en España, en Europa y en el mundo. Nuestra oferta cultural es multidisciplinar y, en consecuencia, innovadora y diferente.

Porque cada año adquirimos mayor visibilidad a nivel nacional e internacional y hemos demostrado que somos un evento sólido, cuya proyección aumenta con cada nueva edición.

Porque al apoyarnos, apoyas a artistas, escritores, editoriales, músicos, diseñadores de moda y jóvenes realizadores de cine, tanto consagrados como aquellos que comienzan una carrera y su gran talento merece ser divulgado.

Porque gracias a nuestro trabajo de divulgación hemos mostrado a todos los públicos la subcultura gótica urbana: un movimiento rico en manifestaciones artísticas cuyas raíces se remontan al Romanticismo y la era Victoriana. Niños, jóvenes, adultos y personas de la tercera edad, de toda condición social, asisten habitualmente a nuestra cita anual.



Why support us


Because we are a unique event in Spain, in Europe and in the world. Our cultural offer is multidisciplinary and therefore innovative and different.

Because every year we gain more visibility at national and international level and we have shown that we are a solid event, whose projection increases with each new edition.

Because to support us, you support artists, writers, publishers, musicians, fashion designers and young filmmakers, both established and those beginning a career and his talent deserves to be reported.

Because thanks to our outreach work we have shown urban Gothic subculture to all public: a rich artistic movement whose roots go back to Romanticism and the Victorian era. Children, youth, adults and seniors of all walks of life, regularly attend our annual meeting.




Qué necesitamos


En 2015 necesitamos cubrir una sexta parte de los gastos que implica organizar un evento de esta magnitud.

Este dinero se destinará íntegramente a la producción de nuestro evento:

Gastos de transporte: billetes de tren y avión para los invitados, traslados internos y aeropuerto-hotel-aeropuerto.

Alimentación y alojamiento de invitados.

Gastos de infraestructura y montaje.

Alquiler de espacios para el evento.

Alquiler de equipos: proyectores, micrófonos, amplificadores, etc.

Pago de servicios profesionales: fotografía, prensa, vídeo.

Honorarios de los invitados.


What we need


In 2015 we need to cover one-sixth of the costs involved in organizing an event of this magnitude.

This money will go entirely to the production of our event:

Transport costs: train and flying tickets for guests, internal and airport-hotel-airport transfers.

Food and accommodation of guests.

Infrastructure and assembly costs.

Hire of installations.

Hire of technical equipment: microphones, projectors, amplifiers, etc.

Payment of professional services: press, photography, video, etc.

Paying for guests.




Qué obtienes


Premiamos tu mecenazgo con regalos exclusivos de la VII SGM. Como productor independiente de nuestro evento, recibirás estos artículos de alta calidad y diseño único (gastos de envío incluidos). En función de la cantidad que aportes (ver columna de la derecha), te obsequiaremos con:


What you get


We reward your patronage with exclusive gifts. As an independent producer of our event, you will receive these high quality and unique design articles (including shipping costs). Depending on how much you contribute (see right column), we will give you:


Taza / Mug VII SGM


Taza Mug de porcelana/cerámica en color negro, con marcaje vitrificado del logo de la VII SGM a 1 tinta en dos posiciones. Altura: 9,5 cm. Diámetro: 8,2 cm. Capacidad: 30 cl. Resistente a lavavajillas y microondas.

Black porcelain-ceramic mug with 1-colour print of the VII SGM logo in two positions by vitrified marking process. Height: 9.5 cm. Diameter: 8,2 cm. Capacity: 30 cl. Dishwasher and microwave safe.

Taza / Mug SGM Cthulhu


Taza Mug de porcelana/cerámica en color negro, con marcaje vitrificado del logo SGM Cthulhu a 2 tintas en una posición a lo ancho. Altura: 9,5 cm. Diámetro: 8,2 cm. Capacidad: 30 cl. Resistente a lavavajillas y microondas.

Black porcelain-ceramic mug with 2-colours print of the SGM Cthulhu logo by vitrified marking process. Height: 9.5 cm. Diameter: 8,2 cm. Capacity: 30 cl. Dishwasher and microwave safe.

Camiseta / T-shirt VII SGM


Camiseta negra, 100% algodón, 160g/m², con serigrafía a 1 tinta del logo de la VII SGM. Modelo para chico disponible en las tallas: S, M, L, XL. Para chica: S y M.

Commemorative illustration 1 colour silkscreen printed on 100% cotton 160g/m² black t-shirt. Men: Sizes S, M, L, and XL. Women: Sizes S and M.

Camiseta / T-shirt SGM Cthulhu

Camiseta / T-shirt SGM FEST

SGM Cthulhu 2 colours silkscreen printed on 100% cotton 160g/m² black t-shirt (see more details above) + Black porcelain-ceramic mug with 2-colours print of the SGM Cthulhu logo by vitrified marking process (see more details above) + Black cover notebook with 2-colours print of the SGM Cthulhu logo.

Kit Especial SGM FEST


Camiseta negra, 100% algodón, 160g/m², con serigrafía a 4 tintas de la ilustración conmemorativa del VII SGM FEST (modelo para chico disponible en las tallas: S, M, L, XL; para chica en S y M) + Chapa metálica vertical (4,5 x 6,8 cm) con aguja impresión a 4 tintas de la ilustración del VII SGM FEST en acabado mate + Parche rectangular (10 x 5 cm aprox.) de tela negra con el nuevo logo del SGM FEST bordado y estampado en blanco.

VII SGM Fest Commemorative illustration 4 colours silkscreen printed on 100% cotton 160g/m² black t-shirt (see more details above) + Vertical metal badge (4.5 x 6.8 cm), VII SGM Fest illustration 4 colours printed with a matte finish + Black fabric rectangular patch (10 x 5 cm approx.) with the new SGM FEST logo white printed and embroidered.



Actividades en 2015


IV Congreso sobre arte, literatura y cultura gótica urbana

Con académicos de universidades de España, Europa y América Latina, que trabajan temas relacionados con el Romanticismo, la época Victoriana y nuestra subcultura. La revista Herejía y Belleza, compila todas las ponencias y comunicaciones presentadas en formato de artículo.


VII Encuentro de Literatura

Escritores, editores, guionistas y artistas de diversas disciplinas debaten en mesas redondas sobre la literatura gótica y de terror, clásica y actual. En 2015 el Encuentro tendrá lugar en diferentes espacios alternativos e institucionales de la ciudad de Madrid.


VII SGM Art

El misterio en el arte será la temática de la exposición de 2015.


VII Teatrífico

Canciones y textos de los siglos XVII y XIX forman parte de "Cesa de Atormentarme", un concierto con instrumentos de época y lecturas dramatizadas.


VII Ventana Oscura

Mesas redondas sobre las sectas en el cine y la obra de Chicho Ibáñez Serrador. Muestra de cortometrajes de estética gótica, de terror y suspense.


VII SGM Festival

Durante dos días, 8 bandas internacionales de diferentes estilos (Gothic Rock, Post-Punk, Dark Wave, Death Rock y Alternative Rock), todas ellas con peso específico y plenamente activas en la escena actual, estarán presentes en nuestro festival: Aeon Sable, Ascetic, Ash Code, Christine Plays Viola, Frank the Baptist, Grooving in Green, Horror Vacui y NU:N.


Plataforma G

Pasarela de moda con diseñadores que inspiran sus colecciones en los estilos: victoriano, steampunk, industrial y medieval, entre otros.


2015 Activities


IV Conference on Art, Literature and Urban Gothic Culture

With academics members of universities from Spain, Europe and Latin America, working on issues related to Romanticism, the Victorian era and our subculture. Heresy and Beauty magazine compiles all papers presented in article format.


VII Literature Meeting

Writers, editors, screenplayers and artists from various disciplines discussed in round tables on classic and present-day Gothic and horror literature. In 2015 the meeting will take place in alternative and institutional spaces of Madrid.


VII SGM Art

The mystery in art is the theme of the 2015 exhibition.


VII Teatrífico

Songs and texts from the seventeenth and nineteenth centuries are part of "Cesa de Atormentarme", a concert performed with instruments of the time and dramatic readings.


VII Ventana Oscura

Roundtables and a horror and gothic shortfilms screening.


VII SGM Festival

Two day festival, 8 international bands of different styles (Gothic Rock, Post-Punk, Dark Wave, Death Rock y Alternative Rock), all of them fully active on the current scene: Aeon Sable, Ascetic, Ash Code, Christine Plays Viola, Frank the Baptist, Grooving in Green, Horror Vacui and NU:N.


G Platform

Fashion show with designers that inspire their collections in Victorian, steampunk, industrial and medieval, among other styles.




Innovaciones en 2015


I SGM Fest Kids

Por primera vez, la SGM ofrecerá un concierto de rock dirigido al público infantil a cargo de los madrileños Pussycat Kill. También habrá DJs, baile, ‘pinta caras’, chuches, sorteos y muchas sorpresas.


2015 Innovations


I SGM Fest Kids

For the first time, the SGM will offer a rock concert for children by the locals Pussycat Kill. There will be DJs, dancing, 'face painting', sweets, raffles and many surprises.





Impacto


Ayúdanos a sacar adelante esta séptima edición de la Semana Gótica de Madrid. Hasta ahora hemos hecho posible lo imposible.

Hemos llevado una cultura de la calle a espacios como el Museo del Romanticismo, el Centro Cultural Conde Duque, el Museo Lázaro Galdiano e instituciones académicas como la Universidad Complutense y la Autónoma de Madrid. Ellos nos han apoyado, han creído en nuestro trabajo y han visto los resultados año tras año.

Hemos conseguido divulgar la riqueza artística de nuestra subcultura y optimizar la visión del público hacia ella. Y seguimos esforzándonos en ello, con ilusión, pasión y responsabilidad. ¡Ayúdanos!

Impacto


Help us to successfully complete this seventh edition of the Madrid Gothic Week. So far we have made possible the impossible.

We have brought a culture of the streets to spaces such as the Museum of Romanticism, the Conde Duque Cultural Center, the Museum Lazaro Galdiano and academic institutions like Complutense and Autónoma universities of Madrid. They have supported us, and have believed in our work and have seen the results year after year.

We managed to disseminate the artistic richness of our subculture and to change the vision of the people towards it. And we still working hard on it, with enthusiasm, passion and responsibility. Help us!
story_txt:
Semana Gótica de Madrid / Madrid Gothic Week

La Asociación Cultural Besarilia organiza la Semana Gótica de Madrid desde 2009. Desde entonces, cada año, hemos mostrado al público la belleza y riqueza del siglo XIX, profundizando en los enigmas del Romanticismo y de las distintas manifestaciones culturales que han extendido su legado hasta nuestros días, a través de la literatura, la música, el cine, la moda, y las artes plásticas y escénicas, con éxito y amplia repercusión nacional e internacional.


Besarilia Cultural Association organizes Madrid Gothic Week from 2009. Since then, every year, we have showed the beauty and richness of the nineteenth century, deepened into the mysteries of Romanticism and the various cultural expressions that have extended their legacy to the present day, through literature, music, film, fashion, and visual and performing arts, successful and extensive national and international impact.



Nuestro evento promueve:

La obra de autores contemporáneos y clásicos en el Encuentro de Literatura.
El trabajo de artistas plásticos en SGM Art.
Las colecciones de diseñadores de moda noveles en Plataforma G.
Conciertos y música de grupos underground a través del SGM Festival y Virus G zine.
Los cortometrajes, documentales y video arte de nuevos realizadores audiovisuales en la Ventana Oscura.
Las producciones independientes de danza y teatro en Teatrífico.
Los estudios culturales a través del Congreso sobre arte, literatura y cultura gótica urbana, y de la publicación de la revista académica Herejía y Belleza.



Our event promotes:

The work of classic and present-day authors in the Literature Meeting.
The work of artists in SGM Art.
The fashion collections of young designers in G Platform.
Concerts and underground music concerts through SGM Festival and Virus G zine.
Shortfilms, documentaries and video art of new film makers in Ventana Oscura.
Independent drama and dance productions in Teatrífico.
Cultural studies through the Conference on Art, Literature and Urban Gothic Culture, and the academic magazine Heresy and Beauty.



Por qué apoyarnos

Porque somos un evento único en España, en Europa y en el mundo. Nuestra oferta cultural es multidisciplinar y, en consecuencia, innovadora y diferente.
Porque cada año adquirimos mayor visibilidad a nivel nacional e internacional y hemos demostrado que somos un evento sólido, cuya proyección aumenta con cada nueva edición.
Porque al apoyarnos, apoyas a artistas, escritores, editoriales, músicos, diseñadores de moda y jóvenes realizadores de cine, tanto consagrados como aquellos que comienzan una carrera y su gran talento merece ser divulgado.
Porque gracias a nuestro trabajo de divulgación hemos mostrado a todos los públicos la subcultura gótica urbana: un movimiento rico en manifestaciones artísticas cuyas raíces se remontan al Romanticismo y la era Victoriana. Niños, jóvenes, adultos y personas de la tercera edad, de toda condición social, asisten habitualmente a nuestra cita anual.




Why support us

Because we are a unique event in Spain, in Europe and in the world. Our cultural offer is multidisciplinary and therefore innovative and different.
Because every year we gain more visibility at national and international level and we have shown that we are a solid event, whose projection increases with each new edition.
Because to support us, you support artists, writers, publishers, musicians, fashion designers and young filmmakers, both established and those beginning a career and his talent deserves to be reported.
Because thanks to our outreach work we have shown urban Gothic subculture to all public: a rich artistic movement whose roots go back to Romanticism and the Victorian era. Children, youth, adults and seniors of all walks of life, regularly attend our annual meeting.






Qué necesitamos

En 2015 necesitamos cubrir una sexta parte de los gastos que implica organizar un evento de esta magnitud.
Este dinero se destinará íntegramente a la producción de nuestro evento:
Gastos de transporte: billetes de tren y avión para los invitados, traslados internos y aeropuerto-hotel-aeropuerto.
Alimentación y alojamiento de invitados.
Gastos de infraestructura y montaje.
Alquiler de espacios para el evento.
Alquiler de equipos: proyectores, micrófonos, amplificadores, etc.
Pago de servicios profesionales: fotografía, prensa, vídeo.
Honorarios de los invitados.



What we need

In 2015 we need to cover one-sixth of the costs involved in organizing an event of this magnitude.
This money will go entirely to the production of our event:
Transport costs: train and flying tickets for guests, internal and airport-hotel-airport transfers.
Food and accommodation of guests.
Infrastructure and assembly costs.
Hire of installations.
Hire of technical equipment: microphones, projectors, amplifiers, etc.
Payment of professional services: press, photography, video, etc.
Paying for guests.






Qué obtienes

Premiamos tu mecenazgo con regalos exclusivos de la VII SGM. Como productor independiente de nuestro evento, recibirás estos artículos de alta calidad y diseño único (gastos de envío incluidos). En función de la cantidad que aportes (ver columna de la derecha), te obsequiaremos con:



What you get

We reward your patronage with exclusive gifts. As an independent producer of our event, you will receive these high quality and unique design articles (including shipping costs). Depending on how much you contribute (see right column), we will give you:

story:
"Art tells gorgeous lies that come true.”

Burning Man 2015

― Hakim Bey, The Temporary Autonomous Zone

     You walk through the dust and heat of day, beyond the heart of the city, and from the haze before you emerges a shape that is both plant and place, flower and temple, both open and contained. No fence keeps you out, but one hundred and eight lanterns mark out the space, like a fairy ring in the forest, like the hundred and eight beads of the Buddhist rosary. 

   

     Through the archway you walk. Up the long, low steps, the muffled sound of your tread meets the familiar clunk of wood; the music of a seaside pier rises from the dust, invoking the sense of some long lost place where water once stretched out to kiss the horizon. Below, the improbable sounds of water and the briefest hints of ocean blue tickle the imagination. From above, eight dragons of fire and steel peer down, watching you, or look out into the distance, waiting.

   

     And again, the thing that is neither quite plant nor place seems to hover at the edge of defining, the green rooftop like a lily pad, the great lotus rising up out of the dried mud and the memory of water, each petal big enough to sleep in, open out from this improbable tree, this pillar of memories.

     

     Inside, past and present blend and dance together. Old rites and new technologies bring fresh form to venerable, ancient practices. There is hidden circuitry here: casting the moon blocks reveals the will of the gods in a panoply of color and light. The breath of dragons explodes outward in answer to prayer. The goddess herself has been known to appear, if the moment is right.

     

     The bamboo tokens, holding luck or misfortune, lead seekers both to a message and a map. New poems, merging ancient Chinese mysticism and the passionate exhortations of the desert dwelling Sufi's, invite contemplation. Each poem also holds directions to a place within the bounds of Black Rock City, inviting exploration and discovery, and perhaps the answers you seek. Can you unravel the meaning in your poem? Do you dare follow its instructions, setting out into Black Rock City to visit the coordinates it gives? What might Mazu plan for you?

     

     You leave the temple, clutching message and map, and the sound of music finds your ears. Drums, gongs and shouting voices emerge from fantastical shapes, finned and spiny, nautilus-headed dancers and demons with a thousand eyes walk out of the dust, beckoning you to join them. You wonder, for a moment, if you are in fact in a desert, or in the memories of an ancient ocean, seeing the dreams of the sea floor dancing past. 


We want to be your friend! 

www.mazugoddessoftheemptysea.com

Thank you for your time, gifts and all the love!  May you be blessed by Mazu, and see you on the playa! 


Burning Man 2015
story_txt:
"Art tells gorgeous lies that come true.”

Burning Man 2015
― Hakim Bey, The Temporary Autonomous Zone
     You walk through the dust and heat of day, beyond the heart of the city, and from the haze before you emerges a shape that is both plant and place, flower and temple, both open and contained. No fence keeps you out, but one hundred and eight lanterns mark out the space, like a fairy ring in the forest, like the hundred and eight beads of the Buddhist rosary. 
   
     Through the archway you walk. Up the long, low steps, the muffled sound of your tread meets the familiar clunk of wood; the music of a seaside pier rises from the dust, invoking the sense of some long lost place where water once stretched out to kiss the horizon. Below, the improbable sounds of water and the briefest hints of ocean blue tickle the imagination. From above, eight dragons of fire and steel peer down, watching you, or look out into the distance, waiting.
   
     And again, the thing that is neither quite plant nor place seems to hover at the edge of defining, the green rooftop like a lily pad, the great lotus rising up out of the dried mud and the memory of water, each petal big enough to sleep in, open out from this improbable tree, this pillar of memories.
     
     Inside, past and present blend and dance together. Old rites and new technologies bring fresh form to venerable, ancient practices. There is hidden circuitry here: casting the moon blocks reveals the will of the gods in a panoply of color and light. The breath of dragons explodes outward in answer to prayer. The goddess herself has been known to appear, if the moment is right.
     
     The bamboo tokens, holding luck or misfortune, lead seekers both to a message and a map. New poems, merging ancient Chinese mysticism and the passionate exhortations of the desert dwelling Sufi's, invite contemplation. Each poem also holds directions to a place within the bounds of Black Rock City, inviting exploration and discovery, and perhaps the answers you seek. Can you unravel the meaning in your poem? Do you dare follow its instructions, setting out into Black Rock City to visit the coordinates it gives? What might Mazu plan for you?
     
     You leave the temple, clutching message and map, and the sound of music finds your ears. Drums, gongs and shouting voices emerge from fantastical shapes, finned and spiny, nautilus-headed dancers and demons with a thousand eyes walk out of the dust, beckoning you to join them. You wonder, for a moment, if you are in fact in a desert, or in the memories of an ancient ocean, seeing the dreams of the sea floor dancing past. 
We want to be your friend! www.mazugoddessoftheemptysea.comwww.facebook.com/mazugoddessoftheemptyseahttp://tinyurl.com/DeptofPubArtsYouTubewww.instagram.com/departmentofpublicarts/www.twitter.com/DeptofPubArtsComing Soon: www.departmentofpublicarts.comPins and Stickers will have this design: 



Thank you for your time, gifts and all the love!  May you be blessed by Mazu, and see you on the playa! 

Burning Man 2015

story:
Short Summary

Hey everyone! I am a Senior Art Major at Spring Arbor University in Michigan. I have been studying fine arts for the past 3 and a half years, and now to wrap up my time at SAU, I have to have my very own Senior Art Exhibit. This Exhibit will show the cumulation of my studies, focusing on Graphic Design and Photography. The show calls for around 25 professionally framed pieces. I have about 2 months until the show on April 19th. 

What We Need & What You Get

This is where you all come in! Hosting this show is very costly. Each of the framed pieces requires high quality printing, custom glass, a custom cut frame, hardware, and custom matting. For just one completed and framed piece it costs about $100. AND I NEED 25 OF THESE! Thats a lot!

Since I'm an artist, I have come up with some perks for anyone who decides to donate! I will create a handmade calligraphy print with your choice of phrase or wording! Every $25 get's you another print! Anything under $25 will be from the good of your heart to help out a graduating college student! If you donate over $200, I'll give you one of the framed Art pieces after the show (or the frame with a custom print in it)!

Other Ways You Can Help

I greatly appreciate prayer! Even just supporting through sharing this campaign with friends and family is helpful! The cost of buying a custom print on Etsy is pretty expensive, so $25 for a print that will also help me have a Senior Art Exhibit is a great deal, if I do say so myself. Thank you for taking the time to look at this campaign, your support is invaluable to making this happen.

story:
Hey there!

QU3ST is a group of 3D Animation students in Montreal Canada producing a showcase of short student films and they need you help!

What We Need:

In order to make this night as special as it can be, we need funding from YOU in order to offer delightful perks such as:

  • Food & drink
  • Lively entertainment
  • A classy environment
  • A good time

Can't Donate?

Then please consider:

  • Liking & sharing our facebook page:  Qu3ST
  • Spreading the word!
  • Following our progress on our Tumblr page
