story:
WHAT

I am Annika Kappner a visual artist based in Amsterdam. My latest project is called “Latent Colours of the Future Mind’. It deals with the evolution of human consciousness and its relation to visual language. That means how we perceive & see the outside world and the world within, and how that relates to the visual language that surrounds us and that we create.

HOW & WHERE

  1. For this project I am doing the desk research, talking to experts in related fields, and creating the visual sketches in Amsterdam. 
  2. In October and November I will be travelling to Peru where I will study the indigenous folk art of the Andes & the natural surroundings that inspired the artists that started this tradition 1000s of years ago. This visual language is particularly interesting to me, since it is alive and evolving since the Inca Empire and its predecessors. Peruvian visual culture is out of the big 5 ancient civilizations (China, India, Egypt, Mexico & Peru) that form the cradles of our modern world, the only one still ‘in use’ and evolving. The indigenous population has a very particular cosmology and relation to nature. They for example traditionally see time as circular, as opposed to linear how we do in the Western world. Nature has magical powers and is an integral part of daily life.
  3. After 3 weeks of travelling and talking to local artists in Peru, I will produce a series of paintings and videos based on the research made in Amsterdam and Peru. These works will be shown in Lima beginning December, and thereafter I will be looking for a space in the Netherlands to show the project in Europe.

ME & THE PROJECT

My work is inspired by the nature of consciousness and the related dynamics of the mind. Here you can see my latest works and collaborations

www.annikakappner.com

Like oftentimes manifested in visual language our mind works in patterns. If we experience something repeatedly a blueprint in our thought process is created and we are very likely to think the same way in a similar situation or expect a similar thing to happen to us. This shapes our behavior and can inhibit us from evolving. 

As part of the research process I look at the visual patterns of Andean folk art, patterns in nature, thought patterns that I recognize in my own behavior and that of friends and family, and at patterns in other areas of design and science, like parametric design in architecture and quantum physics.

WHY

In this project I am looking for visuals that bridge and connect the evolution of visual patterns and mythology, and the evolution of the patterns in our mind. It is the contrast between the ancient roots of the indigenous art, the close connection to nature, the alternative cosmology in comparison to the complexity and speed of the exponentially evolving world we live in. With this project I wish to fuse new impulses with age-old wisdom, and create a new artistic connection between Peru and Europe. 

My work aims to create access to inner spaces that we have forgotten or cannot see. By going back to the roots of one of the major ancient civilizations I hope to reveal some of the keys to our inner being.

YOU

For all this money is truly needed!  Part of the travel costs and research materials are already paid for, but to realize the full potential of the project additional 3300 € are needed. I already took care of the plane ticket from Amsterdam to Peru, research travel to the Ethnographic museum in Berlin, a large part of the books and material for sketches, and I will cover the living costs for my stay in Peru, so basically I need your contribution to pay for the materials, set up of the exhibition, PR and fund part of the inland travels. 1500€ painting material +  800€ exhibition setup and PR + 200€ additional literature + 800€ inland travel. Any excess funding will go into the next show in the Netherlands.

So if you can support what you can to make it happen, I will be truly grateful! 

Will you help? 

THANK YOU!


Love,

Annika


Some of the Perks:

Painting Series 'The Internet Loves You', Acrylics, 40 x 30 cm

Lino Prints 40 x 30 cm
story_txt:
WHATI am
Annika Kappner a visual artist based in Amsterdam. My latest project is
called “Latent Colours of the Future Mind’. It deals with the evolution of
human consciousness and its relation to visual language. That means how we
perceive & see the outside world and the world within, and how that relates
to the visual language that surrounds us and that we create. HOW & WHERE

For
this project I am doing the desk research, talking to
experts in related fields, and creating the visual sketches in Amsterdam. 

In
October and November I will be travelling to Peru where I will study the
indigenous folk art of the Andes & the natural surroundings that inspired
the artists that started this tradition 1000s of years ago. This visual
language is particularly interesting to me, since it is alive and evolving
since the Inca Empire and its predecessors. Peruvian visual culture is out of
the big 5 ancient civilizations (China, India, Egypt, Mexico & Peru) that
form the cradles of our modern world, the only one still ‘in use’ and evolving. The indigenous population has a very particular cosmology and relation to
nature. They for example traditionally see time as circular, as opposed to
linear how we do in the Western world. Nature has magical powers and is an
integral part of daily life.

After
3 weeks of travelling and talking to local artists in Peru, I will produce a series of paintings and videos
based on the research made in Amsterdam and Peru. These works will be shown in
Lima beginning December, and thereafter I will be looking for a space in the
Netherlands to show the project in Europe.
ME & THE PROJECT
My
work is inspired by the nature of consciousness and the related dynamics of the
mind. Here you can see my latest works and collaborations
www.annikakappner.com
Like
oftentimes manifested in visual language our mind works in patterns. If we
experience something repeatedly a blueprint in our thought process is created
and we are very likely to think the same way in a similar situation or expect a
similar thing to happen to us. This shapes our behavior and can inhibit us from
evolving. As part of the research process I look at the visual patterns of Andean folk art,
patterns in nature, thought patterns that I recognize in my own behavior and
that of friends and family, and at patterns in other areas of design and
science, like parametric design in architecture and quantum physics. 
WHY
In
this project I am looking for visuals that bridge and connect the evolution of
visual patterns and mythology, and the evolution of the patterns in our mind.
It is the contrast between the ancient roots of the indigenous art, the close
connection to nature, the alternative cosmology in comparison to the complexity
and speed of the exponentially evolving world we live in. With this project I
wish to fuse new impulses with age-old wisdom, and create a new artistic
connection between Peru and Europe. My work aims to create access to inner
spaces that we have forgotten or cannot see. By going back to the roots of one
of the major ancient civilizations I hope to reveal some of the keys to our
inner being.
YOU
For
all this money is truly needed!  Part of
the travel costs and research materials are already paid for, but to realize
the full potential of the project additional 3300 € are needed. I already took care of the plane ticket from Amsterdam to
Peru, research travel to the Ethnographic museum in Berlin, a large part of the
books and material for sketches, and I will cover the living costs for my stay
in Peru, so basically I need your contribution to pay for the materials, set up
of the exhibition, PR and fund part of the inland travels. 1500€ painting material +  800€ exhibition setup
and PR + 200€ additional literature + 800€ inland travel. Any excess funding will go into the next show in the Netherlands.So if you can
support what you can to make it happen, I will be truly grateful! Will you help? THANK YOU!Love,AnnikaSome of the Perks:Painting Series 'The Internet Loves You', Acrylics, 40 x 30 cmLino Prints 40 x 30 cm

story:
Hello!

My name is Shy! My husband, Coey, and I are two artists based in Columbus, Ohio, making a living off our art. I run our small business/studio, selling our art both online and at conventions. Coey has a design job, illustrating for apparel and housewares with a lot of creative freedom. Typically, we make it by just fine, and happily!

But, June hit really hard, and we’re in need of help.


The Pickle We're In

In the last 6 weeks, several large, unexpected, and costly problems fell on us.

  • A really nasty storm at the end of June knocked a huge portion of our tree onto our house, leaving us without power for a while, damaging the eave and roof. The tree is gone and taken care of, but the removal bill is hefty due to the size of the job, and we’re still getting quotes for the roof repair. It doesn’t look like that’ll end up too small a number, either.
  • My health. I’ve been in the hospital a few times with a multitude of symptoms. Medical bills are starting come in, and depending on the results of (yet another) test I have to have soon, I may need surgery to remove my gallbladder. In short; even more bills. We have health insurance, thankfully, but our deductible is pretty high, so we still have a ways to go before they’ll start to pay.
  • Our cat, Mars, needs surgery, too. Anyone who’s followed Coey and I on Tumblr for a while might remember a sale on Etsy for our cat, Padou; she had stomatitis, a disorder where the body identifies teeth as foreign and rejects them. Earlier this year, our vet told us Mars has the same, and needs her teeth pulled as well. We were hoping to have the money saved by now, but all available funds have gone to paying the bills mentioned above. Mars has been acting very isolated the last couple months, not eating much and being very gloomy. We’re worried the pain of her teeth has started making her miserable, and want to get them pulled ASAP.
  • Because of all these sudden expenses, it’s caused a lot of repercussions in other areas. Our inventory is running low, which means we’re running out of items to sell and make an income on, and we can’t afford to order more at the moment. Our house is in desperate need of general repairs which we cannot do with these pressing expenses. We’re unable to put money aside for the remainder of Coey’s transition. Our car is acting suspiciously, but I can't afford to take it in or fix anything wrong with it. July is a "big bill month" because of insurance and half of property tax due. Not to mention, we both have student loans and basic living expenses, which now seem unmanageable.

How Contributions Will Help

So, we swallowed our pride and are asking for help. Even a few dollars would be greatly appreciated, and we’re going to make sure no contribution will go without some form of return!
Even if we don't make our goal amount, any money raised will go to paying off these unexpected expenses and help us get back on our feet.

Coey and I have been discussing things we can do to raise funds as quickly as possible; another sale on Etsy, taking emergency commissions, etc. This Indiegogo campaign lets us do all of that at once. All donations of $3 or more will get (at least) a thank you card featuring art by Coey and myself and a message of gratitude. Tiers $15 and more will get coupons for money off purchases through our Etsy. There are even tiers for custom art by myself. We want to give back to the people who help us out of this pinch, as we are extremely grateful to anyone who would help us.


Shy's Marker Commission Examples

Click here for (probably too many) examples of my marker work up for commission.


Risks & Challenges

The largest foreseeable problem at this point is if something else pressing and expensive happens. We run our business right out of our house, and I regularly ship orders to customers, so fulfilling perks would be easy.


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, please reblog, retweet, share on FB, anything! If we can get a lot of people to even contribute a few dollars each, we would be back on our feet in no time!

story:
What this is all about: 

Our names are Jessieh Ruth and Samantha Jolene. We have been collaborating as artists for over seven years. The purpose of this campaign is to seek financial support from those who have come to know us and our work (collectively and as individuals) during that time. We are embarking on a life-changing adventure with the ultimate goal of establishing a solid and enriching performance ensemble in Philadelphia, PA. Together with Philly-based dancer and choreographer Maggie Donoghue, we've been fortunate to receive much needed community support and rehearsal space through the Artist Residency Program with Mascher Space Cooperative. This process has already begun and we, as a group, are scheduled to perform this September as part of the 2014 Philly Fringe Festival as OTHER CASE NOTES ENSEMBLE. Each of us views this current opportunity as a continuation of the educations we've received and value so much. This is a simultaneously ambitious and humbling endeavor and simply put; we need your help getting there. 

What We Ask: 

While we've both acquired employment in our post-grad lives, have been making every effort to save for this opportunity and have received valuable support from our respective families; we do not want to enter this decision blindly. We know that we will need additional funds moving forward. This is why we are asking for your help in this way.

The goal we've set is not a random dollar amount to serve simply as a security blanket, but a necessity. With that in mind, we've made every effort to keep the amount we are asking for modest and realistically achievable. There is no expectation on our end with regards to how much our supporters may be able to give financially. What has been most important for us in making the decision to reach out in this way; has been the reminder that we do, in fact, have supporters. So, thank you. 

For those of you interested in giving, we think disclosure of how your gifts will be used is appropriate. It's reassuring to have a sense of where the money is going and what it's being used for. Currently, we can provide you the following information for how your gifts will be allocated:

From the total amount raised in this campaign;

65% - Relocation Expenses (i.e. moving expenses from South Carolina to Philadelphia, preliminary housing arrangements, etc.)

25%- Directly to OTHER CASE NOTES ENSEMBLE (i.e. company insurance, additional rehearsal and performance space not covered by our residency with the Mascher Space Co-op, the launching of a company profile and website, etc.)

10%- Goes into a fund we've already established to help us give back to the Drama Department of the South Carolina Governor's School for the Arts and Humanities where we first began our exploration as students, actors, and collaborators. 

As far as additional perks of giving; we've got some fun ones in mind. 

                 See also: Perks. 

In closing, we already want to acknowledge the time you've taken to consider this campaign. While we hope that you are able to contribute via monetary support, we do not see this as the only means of helping us at this time. Please, even if you personally cannot give at this time, spread the word about helping us out. Let someone know about us, our plans, and our commitment as emerging artists (feel free to use that handy indiegogo share tool or talk this up on facebook). 

With much gratitude and affection,

Jessieh Ruth and Samantha Jolene.

story:
The Unsung Superheroes of the IDF

From suit and tie to olive slacks.
From filing taxes to filling tanks.
From putting their children to sleep to sleepless nights defending them.
These are the unseen and unsung superheroes of the IDF. For their exceptional sacrifice and undying dedication to the land of Israel, we invite you to help us say two small words that speak volumes: Thank You!

“I have posted watchmen on your walls, Jerusalem;                   
​they will never be silent day or night.” (Isaiah 62:6)

Shalom, my name is Chen Winkler and I am an Israeli sculptor, photographer, and artist who has served as a general in the reserves for 30 years. Over these three decades I have been blessed with the unique opportunity to behold up close the lives of the everyday heroes that put on the green uniform to defend our homeland at a moments notice. The intimate encounter with reservists over this period of time have long sat within me, taking on a mature form finally ready for artistic expression. This gallery is the culmination of years of artistic contemplation how best to portray to the wider populace the true, human visage of these unique and unsung heroes.

I have started this campaign with the knowledge that I am not alone in my desire to convey the immense gratitude for the citizens who suit up to defend Israel at the drop of a helmet. I know that countless others feel as indebted as I am to these defenders and their vigilance that plays a vital role in the safety of the State of Israel, the Jewish people, and the entire world. 

Your donation to the campaign will help me give the IDF reserves the true, heartfelt appreciation that they deserve. In addition to helping me create an exhibit of proper magnitude equal to the tremendous sacrifice of our IDF soldiers,  thousands of everyday IDF reservists will be directly impacted by your donation that will go towards supplying them with essential gear that will significantly improve their indefinite service whenever they are called. 

What We Need, What You Get
There are close to half a million active reservists today serving in the IDF. Obviously reaching every single one of them would require an immense amount of funding and manpower. Although I know that I can't thank every reservist, I'm dedicated to doing my utmost to reach as many as possible.  With your help I'll be able to do just that. 
Your donation will go towards:

-  Helping me to open the exhibit in a manner and proportion proper to the gratitude that the Reservists deserve. Every dollar donated helps me create and maintain the instalments and events hosted in the gallery. 

- Exposure of the event to invite as many active reservists as possible to give them our immense gratitude. For each dollar we raise, another IDF reservists will hear about and be able to attend the exhibit where they will receive sponsored gifts and donated gear from donators like you. 

- Providing essential military gear to reservists. All donations of gear and kits go directly to active reservist with no in-between or switching of hands. From your donation straight to a soldier. 

- Having Served as a Commander and General of countless Lone Soldiers, I know of their unique situation and the special sacrifice they make in choosing to serve. Over the years, a special place in my heart has grown for Lone Soldiers and they are always in my thoughts.
10% of all proceeds will be donated to  ACHAI foundation, a foundation that provides living and employment for Lone Soldiers and youth-at-risk that have nowhere else to turn to. An evening dedicated to Lone Soldiers will be held at the exhibit where we will salute their exceptional spirit of service. (Gifts can be specified to be given to Lone Soldiers as well) 

I'll be posting live updates from the Gallery so you can see the impact your donation  is having. 

If you can't make a monetary donation, don't worry! I appreciate you taking interest in the project. Sharing this page with friends and family, on social media and in person, is an immense contribution as well :) 

I would be thrilled to see you at the exhibit if you can make it between the 4th and 28th of April in Tel Aviv.

story:
My name is Paul.

I am a medical student from Zurich. But besides my studies i have developed a passion for creating art. It all started in school. I visited the Rudolf Steiner School, where art and music are one of the really important topics. So from early on i loved to work with paper, pencil and wood.

Over the years i spent more and more time to get my ideas into paintings, pictures, sculptures, prints. I started carving big woodsculptures with the chainsaw, small sculptures with carving knifes. In addition I discovered the technique of screenprinting, to get my woodwork onto paper. That gives me the opportunity to convert the three-dimensional sculptures into two-dimensional art prints. Hereby the motive gets its own new expression but stays connected to the main focus of my work, the woodsculpture. 

Given that i have a lot of ideas for new screen-prints in my mind but only limited time, money and equipment, i would be super happy, if some of you could support me and help to get my ideas and projects on paper. Thank you very much!

 

Paul Jaklin

PS: also check out my instagram account @jpjart

story:
The Project

Wilfried Senoner, the artist and his sketches. A book including over 80 artistic sketches of the late Italian artist Wilfried Senoner.

      

My name is Marc Aaron Senoner and I would like to publish a sketchbook to honour my father Wilfried Senoner (1945-1999). He was an extraordinary artist from northern Italy, taught by world famous artists including Marino Marini, Alik Cavaliere and Francesco Messina. He wasn't just a painter and a woodcarver, he also designed church interiors, including 14-meter high altars entirely hand carved by himself and also released a political satire comic book called “Wirr Warr” while he worked for an architect in Germany.

In 1997 fate struck and a ski accident left him in a coma for almost one year. Against all odds, he managed to fight his way back to life, although sadly for much too short a time.

Since my father's passing I have collected an array of drawings and sketches that span his rather short but amazing career. He produced an incredible body of work that includes a wide range of styles, well almost every style (Gothic,Baroque,Art Nouveau,Modern,you name it). As some of his critics would later say: “He almost knew too much about art.” “His artistic eclecticism allowed him to not be influenced by what the tradition of that time suggested. His art resembles a dreamworld full of mystery and his avant-garde paintings were almost too modern for that time.”

I feel the time is now right to share his sketches with the world. You may ask, why now? Why his sketches? Well, the reason is that I see his works in a different light now, they seem to have a prophetic value and show me a side of my dad I didn't have the opportunity to get to know, since I was just 18 at the time of the accident. His fears, his hopes and his beliefs live on in his art and allows me and whoever views his creations to understand who he really was and the message he wanted to spread. 

   

     “The drawing is the most necessary art today!” Wilfried Senoner

   

His life was a struggle but his religious woodcarvings and frescoes allowed him to grant his family a decent living and still pursue his dream of having a little impact on this world through his paintings. He wanted his art to be an appeal to mankind; he wanted to somehow scare people, make them think by using their own minds. And yet, he desperately loved life and celebrated it with bright, strong colours to express his every emotion. To get an idea of what I mean, check out some of his works here: http://www.atelier-senoner.com/en/oil-paintings.php

 

 

NEW REFERRAL CONTEST (I will send out updates of the rankings): 

 

Since IndieGoGo automatically tracks the referrals of contributors I am offering a BONUS award to the person with the most referral contributions! Once you contribute any amount - even the minimum of $5 - you could still win by referring the most contributors. The prize is the $400 value "The original" perk PLUS a little custom handcarved surprise just for you!

 

What I Need & What You Get

 

Wilfried Senoner, the artist and his sketches, will be a unique compilation of sketches drawn between 1960 and 1980. It shows the journey of a young artist in love with art, who is desperately craving for knowledge and who is striving for perfection and enlightenment. 

The final product will consist of over 80 drawings and sketches brought together in 30 pages as a limited edition hardcover book of 250 copies only. Keep in mind that these sketches have never been seen or exhibited before. You can view some of the sketches I might include by visiting my blogs: http://www.atelierwilfried.wordpress.com or following my FB page http://www.facebook.com/atelierwilfriedsenoner

My goal is to raise $10,600 to cover the printing costs on blurb.com, some of the shipping expenses and the site's fees. Over the next couple of months I will select the images to be included in the book; you can help me make the final selections by liking or providing feedback on what I post on my blogs. It would be a special privilege to have you be a part of this journey, which will allow others to learn, to find inspiration and make art more enjoyable and accessible to everyone.

If we happen to raise more than what I have asked, I would love to donate most of that amount to two of my favourite organizations: www.artforlife.org and www.helpugandakids.org. If the demand is very high then I will be happy to print more books, add more pages and donate whatever is left to as many public libraries and art schools as I can.

I can't do this without you! I will put all the money I've asked for into this project and as you can see I am willing to offer you incredible perks, because you deserve it all and I can't wait for this to finally happen!

Your once in a lifetime rewards include art prints, drawings, etchings, art books, portraits, little carvings and more.....

       

               

 

Other Ways You Can Help?

There are other ways you can help me too, if you don't feel like donating in these tough times!

  • You can talk to your friends, enemies and lovers about this campaign, email the link or share via Twitter, Facebook, Google+, Pinterest, even smoke signals might work!

  • You can follow my blogs and share them, too!

  • Help me make some noise and get the “art” out! Please! Because as I use to say: “A drawing says more than a thousand pictures!”

Remember that we don't charge you for shipping since you're worth it and that's just one way we want to thank you!

Stay tuned for more sketches to be uploaded and thank you again for your time and support.

God bless you,

Marc Aaron Senoner
story_txt:
The Project
Wilfried Senoner, the artist and his sketches. A book including over 80 artistic sketches of the late Italian artist Wilfried Senoner.
      
My name is Marc Aaron Senoner and I would like to publish a sketchbook to honour my father Wilfried Senoner (1945-1999). He was an extraordinary artist from northern Italy, taught by world famous artists including Marino Marini, Alik Cavaliere and Francesco Messina. He wasn't just a painter and a woodcarver, he also designed church interiors, including 14-meter high altars entirely hand carved by himself and also released a political satire comic book called “Wirr Warr” while he worked for an architect in Germany.
In 1997 fate struck and a ski accident left him in a coma for almost one year. Against all odds, he managed to fight his way back to life, although sadly for much too short a time.
Since my father's passing I have collected an array of drawings and sketches that span his rather short but amazing career. He produced an incredible body of work that includes a wide range of styles, well almost every style (Gothic,Baroque,Art Nouveau,Modern,you name it). As some of his critics would later say: “He almost knew too much about art.” “His artistic eclecticism allowed him to not be influenced by what the tradition of that time suggested. His art resembles a dreamworld full of mystery and his avant-garde paintings were almost too modern for that time.”
I feel the time is now right to share his sketches with the world. You may ask, why now? Why his sketches? Well, the reason is that I see his works in a different light now, they seem to have a prophetic value and show me a side of my dad I didn't have the opportunity to get to know, since I was just 18 at the time of the accident. His fears, his hopes and his beliefs live on in his art and allows me and whoever views his creations to understand who he really was and the message he wanted to spread.

His life was a struggle but his religious woodcarvings and frescoes allowed him to grant his family a decent living and still pursue his dream of having a little impact on this world through his paintings. He wanted his art to be an appeal to mankind; he wanted to somehow scare people, make them think by using their own minds. And yet, he desperately loved life and celebrated it with bright, strong colours to express his every emotion. I can't do this without you! I will put all the money I've asked for into this project and as you can see I am willing to offer you incredible perks, because you deserve it all and I can't wait for this to finally happen!
Your once in a lifetime rewards include art prints, drawings, etchings, art books, portraits, little carvings and more.....

There are other ways you can help me too, if you don't feel like donating in these tough times!


You can talk to your friends, enemies and lovers about this campaign, email the link or share via Twitter, Facebook, Google+, Pinterest, even smoke signals might work!


You can follow my blogs and share them, too!


Help me make some noise and get the “art” out! Please! Because as I use to say: “A drawing says more than a thousand pictures!” 


Remember that we don't charge you for shipping since you're worth it and that's just one way we want to thank you!

God bless you,

story:
Short Summary

Sam was diagnosed with Autism when he was three years old.  Sam was reading at a beginning first grade level and as his Mom I was frustrated and wanted to find a way to help him.  

Sam had a fascination with cameras and so I bought him a point and shoot.  My plan included Sam's Music Therapist from Hochstein (Rochester, NY) to teach him how to hold the camera. (Sam has dificulties with fine motor planning)  I made a facebook page for my friends to comment on his photos so he could read them to practic his reading.

Sam now has his own facebook fan page Snapshots by Sam Maloney with over 1300 fans and his photos are seen in 20 different countries.

Sam's passion is nature and wildlife.  Sam wants to be able to photograph birds and he needs a DSLR Camera with a telephoto lens.  As his Mom, I want to fulfill his dreams.

I think one of the blessings about Sam is that he is teaching us all what are loved ones with Autism are capable of.  Sam is showing the world that it doesn't matter what you don't have but it matters what you do with what gifts were given.  

I didn't know Sam could take beautiful photos when we started.  It was to everybody's surpirse to look at his photos and wonder where this talent came from.  Sam has sensory integration difficulties where he sees, hears, smells everything and touches can bother him.  Sam sees things that I don't and all I can do is sit and smile when I upload his photos.  

Are next goal is to teach Sam some typing.  Sam reads his comments every Wednesday and Friday with me and his Community Hab worker.  Sam now reads at a third grade level and it will continue to improve.  

I am asking for $3,000.  

This will include the Nikon DSLR 7000 Camera $1,120

Protection Plan 3 years $23                                            

Telephoto Lens $149  ($100 savings with the camera)                                                                

3 year Protection Plan $70                                                    

Camera Bag $50                                                                        

Tripod $150                                                                     

Sam also dreams of taking Scuba Diving Lessons to be a Marine Photographer so I am including the GoPro Underwater Camera $340                                                                                                  

3 Year Protection Plan $90.                                                         

One of the other ways that we are fundraising is to sell Sam's prints on his facebook page Snapshots by Sam Maloney.  You can like Sam's page and message me to find out how you can order prints.  If you are unable to order or contribute it would be wonderful if you could share about Sam's dream to be a bird and marine photographer. Thank You ~ Debra Pierce Bellare, Sam's Mom.

story:
NIMA MUHINMANCHI ART (NMA)

An after-school workshop program in visual arts and music in Accra, Ghana

  • Where youth in Nima, Accra participate in the arts creatively, educationally, and vocationally
  • Acquiring the skills, potential, and confidence to express themselves through art
  • Gaining access to professional platforms to showcase their talent

What's our history?

  • A local grassroots effort, NMA was founded on-the-ground in the summer of 2011
  • In our first program, we involved six schools, 30 students, 25 local artists, renowned painters Larry Otoo, Wiz Kudowor, and Professor Ablade Glover, and Nima’s own hip life music stars V.I.P and F.O.I
  • We had seven business sponsors, raised $1,100 in funds, and were featured on four TV and radio stations.
  • We inaugurated the first arts event of its kind in that area

What has NMA done since?

  • We thought of NMA as a one-time event, but everyone wanted to keep it going!
  • Since then, we’ve participated in a number of painting, music, and workshop programs
  • And gained the support of many top artists and arts organizations in Accra

And now?

  • We are wrapping this term's workshop sessions, getting ready for a banging opening celebration that will blow last year’s away – with an all-day arts festival at Kaokudi Park and an evening exhibition and music show at the Alliance Française
  • We’ve done it all practically without funds, purely through the dedication of the artists and volunteers, and the talent and motivation of the students
  • We aim to prove our success this July in order to establish ourselves as a long-term sustainable program

The Impact

What do we need right now?

  • Funds for the supplies and basic costs of the event

What do we aim for the future?

  • Building the foundations to support continued NMA workshops
  • A transformed and revitalized Nima with a strong ecosystem of collaboration among inspirational established artists, young local artists, and Nima students

What We Need & What You Get

Contribute to...

  • Paints: $400
  • Wooden board: $150
  • Canvas: $150
  • Banners: $50
  • Brushes and palette knives: $100
  • Transport to exhibition: $150

And you can...

  • Be a part of the creative potential.
  • Help us build a positive image of Nima.
  • Join us in displaying Nima’s talent to the world.

If we reach above our goal, we will use the funds toward making the program bigger and better. If we really surpass the amount, we will put the funds toward continuing NMA workshops in the long-term!

*IF YOU DO NOT HAVE A CREDIT CARD, contact us at nimaart.gh@gmail.com if you would like to reserve a prize*

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • LIKE NMA on facebook: www.facebook.com/nimaart.gh
  • FOLLOW NMA on twitter: @NMAart (www.twitter.com/NMAart)
  • If you're in Accra, volunteer with us
  • If you're anywhere, tell with your friends!
  • And use the Indiegogo share tools!!

Nagode. (“Thank you” in Hausa.)

story:
The Story

Skump is the creative persona of a young Oakland-based artist who has worked for many years in an underground environment, honing and sharpening his crafts, and has finally dug his way out into the real world. As an artist with visions of aesthetic creations always amassing in his mind, he needs a little help in making these aspirations into physical real world items. Sure to be infused with certain magical properties, they take time and funding. Time Skump can find, but with a day job in tow and rent to pay, the funds are something more scarce. Basically Skump just wants to make stuff for people like you, he just needs a little help.

The Impact

Your contributions would directly fund art supplies, thereby enabling Skump to fully indulge his creative urges and grow more easily as an artist and as a visual contributor to society. 


What Skump Needs & What You Get

So what does Skump need the money for? The initial goal is $600, and that can be broken down into two initial projects:


1. 1" button maker + Supplies - $300 = tons of fun buttons to give away and leave as small gifts 

2. Skumps first wave of stickers! - $300 = over 800 stickers of various designs on nice UV coated Vinyl


So what do you get for being so generous? For starters all donations are tax deductible, but also you get a bunch of fun art stuffs made by Skump himself and membership into The Skump Super-Fun Adventure Club! Including weekly updates as to how the projects your donations helped fund are progressing, free awesome swag, and discounts on future larger scale art projects! And last but not least, Skumps infinite thanks and appreciation for your help in making his dream and his life closer to the same thing.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like Skumps artwork at least a little bit, but don't feel like contributing, thats just fine too! Maybe you have some friends who might like it, and you wouldn't mind sharing or tweeting about Skump to others? It'd take a second and would benefit Skumps cause just as much as monetary donation!

story:
***UPDATE***

The first 3 people to pre-order a limited edition print will receive an original drawing on paper with dedication! (Sorry sold out!)


About me

I'm Vacon Sartirani, a visual artist from Italy living in Berlin. (You can find my artwork at www.vaconsartirani.com)

I decided to use Indiegogo to raise the funds for my first limited edition of high-quality, professionally scanned and printed giclée prints.

For everybody who loves my art but can't afford it, this is a very good opportunity to purchase a long-lasting, awesome-looking, professional quality original artwork ad a very affordable price.

The editions


Digital rendering of the final editions' appearance and scale
(framing is just for example and NOT included)
 
I decided to offer limited editions of these three artworks: "The Passion of lovers", "La prigioniera" and "Ein Abgrund (Der Fernseher)".
The original paintings will be scanned by a professional Cruse fine-art scanner, which will give a high-fidelity, high-detailed digital image in a 1:1 scale.
I will then make a professional fine-art printing studio realize up to 30 copies editions using high-quality material such as professional archival pigment ink Epson Ultrachrome K3 Vivid Magenta, and award-winning acid-free Harman by Hahnemühe museum paper, that will ensure the perfect rendering of tone and vibrant colors of my original red and blue. The combination of such inks and paper is especially for professional fine art prints, and is estimated to last unchanged for 200 years.
Every copy will be signed and numbered, and then put on sale on my website.
 
Both the professional scanning and printing are expensive, so I make a pre-order special offer to funding the edition's kick-start.
 

I offer to pre-order customers a special 25% discount on every print!!


"Ein Abgrund (Der Fernseher)"

 

 

Edition: Limited (max. 40 copies)
Image size: 18 x 22 cm
Paper size: ca. 22,5 x 30 cm
Ink: Epson Ultrachrome k3 Vivid Magenta archival pigment, 9 colors
Paper: acid-free, archival Harman by Hahnemühe matt cotton textured 300g/m2
Retail price = 20 € (est. 26,70 $) + shipping
Pre-order price (-25%) = 15 € (est. 20,20 $) + shipping

 

 


 

 

"The Passion of Lovers"

 

Edition: Limited (max. 32 copies)
Image Size: 26 x 32 cm
Paper Size: ca. 30 x 42,5 cm
Ink: Epson Ultrachrome k3 Vivid Magenta archival pigment ink, 9 colors
Paper: acid-free, archival Harman by Hahnemühe matt cotton textured 300g/m
 
Retail price = 32 € (43 $) + shipping
Pre-order price (- 25%) = 24 € (32,30 $) + shipping

 


 

 

"La Prigioniera"

 

Edition: Limited (max. 32 copies)
Image Size: 26 x 34,5 cm

Paper Size: ca. 30 x 42,5 cm
Ink: Epson Ultrachrome k3 Vivid Magenta archival pigment, 9 colors
Paper: acid-free, archival Harman by Hahnemühe matt cotton textured 300g/m2
Retail price = 32 € (43 $) + shipping
Pre-order price (- 25%) = 24 € (32,30 $) + shipping
 

 



 

 

The perks

Other than the editions, special perks include:
 
  • An exclusive postcard, made especially for this event, with handwritten dedication on back (every contributor from 10$ up will receive this perk).
  • An unpublished drawing on paper of 22 x 27 cm, signed by the artist.
  • An unpublished acrylic painting on canvas of 30 x 30 cm, signed by the artist.
  • One of the original acrylic painting on canvas of "Der Fernseher" or "The Passion of lovers" of your choice.
  • An acrylic on canvas custom portrait of you (or a person of your choice), of 3000 cmq (eg 50 x 60 cm).

 

Packing and worldwide registered shipping costs (for prints: 8$) are always included in every perk's price.

 

 

 

About the fundraising

This is a pre-order, that means that every single copy that my customers will order using this platform will be delivered, regardless the fundraising goal is reached or not.
The realization of the prints will start immediately after the fundraising will be over, so expect at least a week before everything will be ready to be shipped at your address. I'll keep you updated to all the process'es stages from fundraising to final  delivery of the prints, however.
The fundraising goal is approx. 50% of the money needed to the whole project.

 

 

 

Please visit my site www.vaconsartirani.com for more of my artworks and stay tuned for the pre-order updates

For any information, please mail me at vaconsartirani@gmail.com

I will then make a professional fine-art printing studio realize up to 30 copies editions using high-quality material such as professional archival pigment ink Epson Ultrachrome K3 Vivid Magenta, and award-winning acid-free Harman by Hahnemühe museum paper, that will ensure the perfect rendering of tone and vibrant colors of my original red and blue. The combination of such inks and paper is especially for professional fine art prints, and is estimated to last unchanged for 200 years.
Every copy will be signed and numbered, and then put on sale on my website.
 
Both the professional scanning and printing are expensive, so I make a pre-order special offer to funding the edition's kick-start.
 
I offer to pre-order customers a special 25% discount on every print!!




"Ein Abgrund (Der Fernseher)"




 
 
Edition: Limited (max. 40 copies)Image size: 18 x 22 cmPaper size: ca. 22,5 x 30 cmInk: Epson Ultrachrome k3 Vivid Magenta archival pigment, 9 colorsPaper: acid-free, archival Harman by Hahnemühe matt cotton textured 300g/m2

Retail price = 20 € (est. 26,70 $) + shippingPre-order price (-25%) = 15 € (est. 20,20 $) + shipping 
 



 
 
"The Passion of Lovers"
 
Edition: Limited (max. 32 copies)Image Size: 26 x 32 cmPaper Size: ca. 30 x 42,5 cmInk: Epson Ultrachrome k3 Vivid Magenta archival pigment ink, 9 colorsPaper: acid-free, archival Harman by Hahnemühe matt cotton textured 300g/m
 
Retail price = 32 € (43 $) + shipping
Pre-order price (- 25%) = 24 € (32,30 $) + shipping


 


 
 
"La Prigioniera"
 

Edition: Limited (max. 32 copies)Image Size: 26 x 34,5 cm
Paper Size: ca. 30 x 42,5 cmInk: Epson Ultrachrome k3 Vivid Magenta archival pigment, 9 colorsPaper: acid-free, archival Harman by Hahnemühe matt cotton textured 300g/m2
Retail price = 32 € (43 $) + shipping
Pre-order price (- 25%) = 24 € (32,30 $) + shipping

 

 


 
 
The perks
Other than the editions, special perks include:
 


An exclusive postcard, made especially for this event, with handwritten dedication on back (every contributor from 10$ up will receive this perk).
An unpublished drawing on paper of 22 x 27 cm, signed by the artist.
An unpublished acrylic painting on canvas of 30 x 30 cm, signed by the artist.
One of the original acrylic painting on canvas of "Der Fernseher" or "The Passion of lovers" of your choice.
An acrylic on canvas custom portrait of you (or a person of your choice), of 3000 cmq (eg 50 x 60 cm).



 
Packing and worldwide registered shipping costs (for prints: 8$) are always included in every perk's price.

 
 
 
About the fundraising
This is a pre-order, that means that every single copy that my customers will order using this platform will be delivered, regardless the fundraising goal is reached or not.
The realization of the prints will start immediately after the fundraising will be over, so expect at least a week before everything will be ready to be shipped at your address. I'll keep you updated to all the process'es stages from fundraising to final  delivery of the prints, however.
The fundraising goal is approx. 50% of the money needed to the whole project.
 
 
 
Please visit my site www.vaconsartirani.com for more of my artworks and stay tuned for the pre-order updatesFor any information, please mail me at vaconsartirani@gmail.com

story:
My name is Scott Kraske and I am proposing on behalf of my team and community the construction of an art project for delivery at Burning Man: Rites of Passage in August 2011 called:


“Final Passage” a sculpture with the elements (summary)


Final Passage

Connecting all forms of creation evolved and inspired with the elements

that gave them food, energy and faith. It is symbolic

of the beginning to life lived and renewal.


After Burning Man that ends on September 6th, 2011, it is the artist's anticipation to work with either BRAF (Black Rock Arts Foundation) or NAF (Nevada Arts Foundation) to find a home for this piece in the city of Las Vegas Art District or other part of the city.


Imagine the Tree of Life meets the River Styx standing brilliantly in the desert shimmering with 5 branches, each holding a small flame in a tall glass chimney, surrounded by sparkling leaves. Standing 22 feet tall, this beautiful monochromatic tree will shimmer in the glowing light from the 5 flames; one on each limb. (After burning man the flames may be removed and fitted with electrical lighting unless otherwise)


The piece will be accompanied by two arches representing two halves of a passage where through a boat is passing symbolizing the transition. The ornate metal arches will also have a propane feed helping to keep visitors warm by night while casting a colorful light through the arch.


The orientation and acoustics of the project is based on a lot of religious and spiritual elements but gives the visitor the ability to take away anything they need from it.


The final construction will result in an art piece with a lot of texture and it will use light in a lot of ways to amplify the concept, either by the light generated by the piece itself of from any natural ambient light.


Theme of the Project

There are a lot of spiritual elements combined in this tree, none of which are primarily from a single religion. Since faith is a rite unto itself the perceived meaning is relevant to the individual experiencing the piece.


The tree represents a human connection to nature. In mythology the Tree of Life concept has various origins in cultures all over the world; the start of life, knowledge or even a basic desire to understand where we were coming from.


And then for many death represented by the boat is less seen as a finality but a transition into a new life or even a higher plain of existence. The boat in the water represents the Ferry Man who transported the dead to the underworld, but in this case the boat carries one through the arch from the old to the new.


One additionally interesting factor for anyone who might make a note of it, though it is not specifically demonstrated in the overall construction, the sculpture maintains all 5 elements of nature; earth, water, air, fire and spirit.


Project Schedule

Build Schedule requires concerns for weather because Las Vegas can get very hot my mid June and working out of doors with welding equipment on metal can be trecherous. So we will plan on getting the feature done before the weather turns against the team.


1 April 2011 obtain and begin building core infrastructure for tree trunk and 2 arches by welding for solid connections, but light and easily moved frame work in sections. This will be the bulk of grant money for these materials.

- buy aluminum framing

- buy welding materials

- buy gas for welding

*immediately or have already been collecting required scrap metal for later stage of design process.


10 April 2011 trunk should be completed carefully and configuring the 5 branches so the flames land in the right measurements with some asymmetry on a horizontal level with the aluminum framework.


Start chimneys (x10) for fitting and eventual placement for the next phase

- buy Chimney pyrex

- buy resources for glass blowing


25 April 2011 branches completed and begin to install electrical conduit, gas lines, compressor lines going to each branch and have the flame plate completed with testing as well as both arches; including the ignition system.


1 May 2011 the framework with installed components including gas, air and electrical and be able to be assembled. Then begin applying skin with re-proposed metals and test acoustics; all framing and general foundation work should be done and ready for texturing. All functions should be working and tested.


1 Jun 2011 should be near completion and ready for full 100% testing. Will begin tweaking and applying decorative pieces and then store for use.


25 Jul 2011 considering a trial run at Element-11 for the tree for setup, transportation and breakdown.

- rent a flatbed trailer


26 Aug 2011 load and leave for Burning Man for a 27 Aug arrival to begin setting up.



Construction

The core structure will be built from an aluminum frame welded securely in sections so that it can be easily assembled on any site where it will be displayed. Standing 22 feet tall


The bark of the tree will be created using re-purposed metal strips or cut from larger pieces of re purposed metal welded to the skeletal frame of aluminum in varying textures so that it remains a solid structure. It is also important for the safety of people wanting to make physical contact that we will avoid sharp edges.


On top of each of 5 limbs will be a base to where a propane fed flame with a tall clear chimney possibly made from glass/pyrex or other material safe with the flame effect.

  • Copper tubing will lead from the base that will house a propane tank to the main hub at the top 3rd of the 3 piece skeleton core of the tree.

  • A knob at the base will easily shut the flame down as needed.

  • 5 lines will feed one to the end of each limb a flame burning low in a chimney glass tube.


An arch feeds off of one side with the same aluminum skeleton over another feature. This arch will be given a faux stone surface also cut from re-purposed metal.


  • The arch will be hallow and anchored on the ground and locked into a mechanism on the side of the tree.


A slot running on the interior ring of the arch will hold a reflective metallic surface x 2. Each side is reflective and gives the illusion of being see through.


A final feature for the base of the structure will be a trough representing the river Styx with a canoe inside, cut in half, with each side end of the canoe on opposite sides of the reflection.


  • The canoe halves will be anchored to the constructed base of the trough.

  • A very shallow pool of water (or facsimile) will be in the base of the miniature river bed.

  • The trough will have the illusion it passes through the arch.

  • One side of the archway is monochromatic.

  • The second side is in full color showing renewal.


Crowning the piece at the top will be where smaller branches will be held holding a light gauge wire decorated with white, silver and black metal discs secured solidly to the rods designed to catch the lights of the fire and any ambient light.


  • Light gauge wire will filter out of a crown with the small disks welded to them.

  • The wires will provide movement and the small disks will provide a twinkling light effect.

  • Will provide a fullness and foliage to the top of the tree.


Core Attractions for the Art

  • a clean daytime visual without fire that still catches the day time sunlight

  • a shimmering night time attraction lit by fire

  • a spiritual display featuring the 5 elements; earth, water, air, fire and spirit


Core Safety details to Achieve

  • solid fuel connections for the propane with the only output at the lighting point.

  • secure exterior skin and limbs against weather and survive abuse by visitors.

  • limited access to standing water in trough to avoid drowning (limit space).


Core Environmental details to protect:

  • secure shiny discs and exterior skin to avoid MOOP.

  • water in trough, if water is used, may have a vinegar in it to avoid clouding water, but will be managed on breakdown and moved out so not to damage the environment.



The Production Team

This project was originally conceived by Scott Kraske while attending the 2010 Burning Man event Metropolis.


Scott Kraske (aka Toaster) is a Las Vegas based artist who graduated from The Art Institute of Las Vegas with a Bachelor of Science in Web Design and Interactive Media. His career goals were purely creative and extended beyond web design and took on many dimensions. Much of his work can be found on his portfolio web site www.art23design.com as StudioSK.


Scott Kraske brought his first art project to Burning Man in 2010 called Monotropolis and it was positioned on the playa with a great deal of pride. The story that led up to getting it there was a never ending series of challenges, but it was brought whole and ready for placement on time.


Ricky Tarkowski is the owner of Weld Rite Services and a burgin who is very excited about learning about the Burning Man experience. He is a long established professional welder in Vegas and is a metal art sculptor. He is certified in polarity, amperage, voltage, MIG, TIG, stick, plasma, oxy fuel cutting and welding through Davis Laboratories in Las Vegas, Nevada.


He has a varied line of metal pieces from small to large that he makes in his brick and mortar business location in Henderson, Nevada.


The project will be built on his brick and mortar business location before it is transported to Burning Man to be assembled in sections for easy transportation.


Robbie Shield is a master craftsman with Royal Studio (www.royalstudio.com) manufactures and sells only the finest in hand blown glass creations. He is an internationally known artist of glass and oil paintings. Robby will be hand blowing the glass (pyrex) chimneys that will sit on each branch of the tree.


Robbie is also a burgin who has dreamed of the Burning Man experience as well and is excited about Final Passage project as an opportunity to introduce him to this world of artists.


Robbie moved to Las Vegas recently after having spent much of 2010 traveling through Europe before leaving his home country of Australia.


Shane is a 5 year veteran of Burning Man with his beautiful wife Liz who might be recognized from their shark car that premiered at Burning Man 3 years ago. Shaney is responsible for uniting this exciting team and will be designing and implementing the ignition system for the propane fed flames on each limb.


Shaney is an engineer and electronics technician for XYZ company based out of Henderson, Nevada.


The Team will grow as we add other members of the team to assure the safety, assembly, and break down of the art piece before and after Burning Man 2011.



Playa Placement

It is with great hope that this placement will have the esteemed and wonderfully placed I had in 2010, when I was very fortunate for that project.




The Financing

Scott Kraske (as StudioSK) is looking at three main channels of fund raising so that construction can begin no later than the beginning of March 2011.

  • posting a project video and fund raising campaign on IndieGoGo.com

  • local fund raising effort in the Southern Nevada community

  • and applying for Grant recognition from Burning Man and NAF (Nevada Arts Foundation)


None of these sources are guaranteed and not a single one will pay for the entire project. Having used IndieGoGo with some success last year it is hopeful, that with better planning and more knowledge, this year will yield the funding needed to complete and place the project.


Many of the services needed to assemble the project will be donated, but the caveat will be obtaining the supplies needed for construction.

story:
Most museums are founded by a few wealthy donors who believe in an idea and want to make all the decisions. When we set out to design The Polaroid Museum that traditional arrangement didn't feel true to our brand. We've always put cameras in the hands of the people, allowing them to instantly capture and share memories, and so we wanted to crowdsource our founding body, establishing that authentic connection to the people and the social experience. We've come to Indiegogo to find our founders. 

The Fearless Leader

That's Warren, Founder of Polaroid Fotobar, the first-of-its-kind, fun and experiential retail destination that is quickly changing the paradigm of how people "liberate" their photos and turn them into innovative and memorable products. Polaroid Fotobar is behind the effort to open The Polaroid Museum in Las Vegas at The LINQ in March 2014. 

____________________________

The Polaroid Corporation and its founder, Edwin Land, impacted not just the modern imaging industry, but set the course for the future of instant and collaborative sharing which ultimately led to today's world of social media. You may not realize it, but Polaroid played a big role in the world we live in today!

We believe that Polaroid - one of the world's most trusted, well-respected and recognizable brands with a rich 75 year history and an inspiration to many - has a remarkable story that deserves to be told. 

We plan to educate guests on:

  • Polaroid History - the amazing things people did and still do to this day with Polaroid film. 
  • Polaroid Technology - a company that created and maintained a niche all its own for 60 years. 
  • Polaroid Pop Culture - a friendly product that millions of people absolutely adored. 

The History of Polaroid

In the 1960s and 1970s, Polaroid was what Apple is today: the coolest technology company on earth, the one with irresistible products, the one whose stock kept climbing way past the point of logic. In its heyday, Polaroid was an absolute innovation machine  - a scientific think tank that periodically kicked out a fantastically profitable, covetable product. In fact, the late Steve Jobs expressly said that he modeled his company to a great extent after Polaroid. 

Like Apple, Polaroid had a genius-visionary founder, a man named Edwin Land who both served as the company’s public face and drove its creativity. Land was a Harvard dropout who in 1947 unveiled the latest in a series of extraordinary ideas: the Polaroid Land camera system, one that produced photographs instantly. At a time when most photographers sent off their film by mail for processing, it was stunning. Instead of waiting a week, you had a photo in 60 seconds. If your picture came out lousy, you could try taking it again before the moment evaporated. Nothing else worked like this.

By the mid-fifties, Polaroid was growing like crazy; by the sixties it seemed unstoppable. In 1972, Land launched the product that he considered the company’s crowning achievement: the SX-70 camera system. That’s the one most of us recognize as “Polaroid,” with photos that have a fat white tab at the bottom of the frame. In 1974, a billion Polaroid photos were taken. A few years later, the company reached a billion dollars in annual sales. At that point Polaroid had become a well-established global brand with over $32B of revenue over the 17 years between 1984 and 2000. This was primarily driven by the launch of the more affordable, One Step camera product lines, which made instant photography available to the masses.

Though it’s often perceived as something for snapshots only, Polaroid film—especially in its professional formats—was extraordinary stuff, and was embraced by some of the era’s great photographers. Ansel Adams loved Polaroid, and shot some of his most famous images of Yosemite National Park on Polaroid film. Walker Evans and André Kertész each adopted an SX-70 late in life, when a big traditional camera became cumbersome, and each made beautiful photographs on it. A very special and enormous camera, shooting giant images (20 by 24 inches) that have to be seen to be believed, has been used by everyone from Andy Warhol to Chuck Close to Mary Ellen Mark, and is still in operation.*

The Polaroid Museum

The fun, interactive and educational museum will tell the 75 year story of Polaroid and its founder, Edwin Land. With an extensive collection of rare, never before seen artifacts, including cameras and their prototypes as well as art and advertising courtesy of the Polaroid Company Historical Collection at MIT, the museum will trace Polaroid from its early years through current day. 

     


Further, in collaboration with The Andy Warhol Museum, the "Capturing Celebrity" exhibition will feature a collection of 50 of Warhol's most famous Polaroid photographs including a number of self-portraits, as well as images of celebrities Dennis Hopper, Truman Capote, John Lennon, Yoko Ono, Mick Jagger, Dolly Parton, Farrah Fawcett, Debbie Harry, Giorgio Armani, Arnold Schwarzenegger, Keith Richards, Muhammad Ali and more. Two of Warhol’s personal Polaroid cameras will also be on display.

Other artists and exhibits on display will be announced in the weeks to come. One of those displays will include the 20x24 camera, the largest living Polaroid camera in the world of which only five working examples still exist. 

Visitors will go home educated about the brand's rich history, inspired through past works of art and invigorated for the future of photography.

With your support and participation, The Polaroid Museum Project hopes to raise $100,000 to further fund exhibits which will bring the vast history and culture of Polaroid to the world.

What's It Going to Look Like?

The Polaroid Perks

We've created a unique set of perks we think any Polaroid or picture taking lover would enjoy. 

$5 --- Express your deep, eternal love for Polaroid for a minimal contribution and we'll send you an 'I love Polaroid' bumper sticker (to proudly proclaim said love) and add your name to our museum website. 

$20 --- Become a Founding Member of The Polaroid Museum and we'll hang your favorite photo as a Polaroid Picture with your name on our Founders Wall in the museum. Also includes a commemorative replica of your photo for you to proudly display! (Limited to 5,000)

$25 --- EARLY BIRD: Museum Tickets - 4 tickets to The Polaroid Museum. The next time you come to Las Vegas, stop by The Polaroid Museum and "shake it like a Polaroid Picture". (Limited to 250) 


$50 --- Museum Tickets - 4 tickets to The Polaroid Museum. The next time you come to Las Vegas, stop by The Polaroid Museum and "shake it like a Polaroid Picture". 

$100 --- 24x30 Polaroid Picture - Indiegogo exclusive, limited-edition 24x30 poster celebrating the establishment of The Polaroid Museum. Includes 2 tickets to the museum. (Limited to 1000)$250 --- VIP Partner - Become our VIP Partner and receive a Polaroid VIP Card which gets you a free lifetime pass to the museum for you and 3 guests, a commemorative founder plaque, your favorite photo as a Polaroid Picture and your name on our Founders Wall. Also includes a signed copy of "Instant: The Story of Polaroid" by Chris Bonanos. (Limited to 1000)$300 --- Polaroid OneStep Camera - Still get the urge to shoot in instant format? Manufactured for over a decade in the 80s and 90s, the Polaroid OneStep CloseUp camera became the standard by which all other cameras were judged. You'll get the OneStep camera, your favorite photo as a Polaroid Picture and your name on our Founders Wall, a commemorative replica of your photo for you to proudly display and a signed copy of "Instant: The Story of Polaroid" by Chris Bonanos. (Limited to 50)

$5,000 --- The Ultimate Selfie - "Selfie" was 2013's word of the year. Here's your opportunity to take the ultimate selfie. Have your portrait taken on the 20x24 camera by a Professional Polaroid Portrait Photographer in one of four locations: Las Vegas, San Francisco, Boston or New York. (Limited to 50)

$10,000 --- VIP Private Event - The Polaroid Museum yours for 2 hours to host your own private event with 100 guests. (Food and drink not included, date subject to approval). Also includes a Polaroid VIP Card which gets you a free lifetime pass to the museum for you and 3 guests, a commemorative founder plaque, your favorite photo as a Polaroid Picture and your name on our Founders Wall and a signed copy of "Instant: The Story of Polaroid" by Chris Bonanos. (Limited to 5)

*Above paragraphs about The Polaroid Corporation courtesy of Chris Bonanos, author of 'Instant: The Story of Polaroid'.
story_txt:
Most museums are founded by a few wealthy donors who believe in an idea and want to make all the decisions. When we set out to design The Polaroid Museum that traditional arrangement didn't feel true to our brand. We've always put cameras in the hands of the people, allowing them to instantly capture and share memories, and so we wanted to crowdsource our founding body, establishing that authentic connection to the people and the social experience. We've come to Indiegogo to find our founders. The Fearless LeaderThat's Warren, Founder of Polaroid Fotobar, the first-of-its-kind, fun and experiential retail destination that is quickly changing the paradigm of how people "liberate" their photos and turn them into innovative and memorable products. Polaroid Fotobar is behind the effort to open The Polaroid Museum in Las Vegas at The LINQ in March 2014. ____________________________The Polaroid Corporation and its founder, Edwin Land, impacted not just the modern imaging industry, but set the course for the future of instant and collaborative sharing which ultimately led to today's world of social media. You may not realize it, but Polaroid played a big role in the world we live in today!We believe that Polaroid - one of the world's most trusted, well-respected and recognizable brands with a rich 75 year history and an inspiration to many - has a remarkable story that deserves to be told. We plan to educate guests on:

Polaroid History - the amazing things people did and still do to this day with Polaroid film. 


Polaroid Technology - a company that created and maintained a niche all its own for 60 years. 

Polaroid Pop Culture - a friendly product that millions of people absolutely adored. 
The History of Polaroid
In the 1960s and 1970s, Polaroid was what Apple is today: the coolest technology company on earth, the one with irresistible products, the one whose stock kept climbing way past the point of logic. In its heyday, Polaroid was an absolute innovation machine  - a scientific think tank that periodically kicked out a fantastically profitable, covetable product. In fact, the late Steve Jobs expressly said that he modeled his company to a great extent after Polaroid. Like Apple, Polaroid had a genius-visionary founder, a man named Edwin Land who both served as the company’s public face and drove its creativity. Land was a Harvard dropout who in 1947 unveiled the latest in a series of extraordinary ideas: the Polaroid Land camera system, one that produced photographs instantly. At a time when most photographers sent off their film by mail for processing, it was stunning. Instead of waiting a week, you had a photo in 60 seconds. If your picture came out lousy, you could try taking it again before the moment evaporated. Nothing else worked like this.
By the mid-fifties, Polaroid was growing like crazy; by the sixties it seemed unstoppable. In 1972, Land launched the product that he considered the company’s crowning achievement: the SX-70 camera system. That’s the one most of us recognize as “Polaroid,” with photos that have a fat white tab at the bottom of the frame. In 1974, a billion Polaroid photos were taken. A few years later, the company reached a billion dollars in annual sales. At that point Polaroid had become a well-established global brand with over $32B of revenue over the 17 years between 1984 and 2000. This was primarily driven by the launch of the more affordable, One Step camera product lines, which made instant photography available to the masses.
Though it’s often perceived as something for snapshots only, Polaroid film—especially in its professional formats—was extraordinary stuff, and was embraced by some of the era’s great photographers. Ansel Adams loved Polaroid, and shot some of his most famous images of Yosemite National Park on Polaroid film. Walker Evans and André Kertész each adopted an SX-70 late in life, when a big traditional camera became cumbersome, and each made beautiful photographs on it. A very special and enormous camera, shooting giant images (20 by 24 inches) that have to be seen to be believed, has been used by everyone from Andy Warhol to Chuck Close to Mary Ellen Mark, and is still in operation.*The Polaroid MuseumThe fun, interactive and educational museum will tell the 75 year story of Polaroid and its founder, Edwin Land. With an extensive collection of rare, never before seen artifacts, including cameras and their prototypes as well as art and advertising courtesy of the Polaroid Company Historical Collection at MIT, the museum will trace Polaroid from its early years through current day.      Further, in collaboration with The Andy Warhol Museum, the "Capturing Celebrity" exhibition will feature a collection of 50 of Warhol's most famous Polaroid photographs including a number of self-portraits, as well as images of celebrities Dennis Hopper, Truman Capote, John Lennon, Yoko Ono, Mick Jagger, Dolly Parton, Farrah Fawcett, Debbie Harry, Giorgio Armani, Arnold Schwarzenegger, Keith Richards, Muhammad Ali and more. Two of Warhol’s personal Polaroid cameras will also be on display.Other artists and exhibits on display will be announced in the weeks to come. One of those displays will include the 20x24 camera, the largest living Polaroid camera in the world of which only five working examples still exist. Visitors will go home educated about the brand's rich history, inspired through past works of art and invigorated for the future of photography.With your support and participation, The Polaroid Museum Project hopes to raise $100,000 to further fund exhibits which will bring the vast history and culture of Polaroid to the world.What's It Going to Look Like?The Polaroid PerksWe've created a unique set of perks we think any Polaroid or picture taking lover would enjoy. $5 --- Express your deep, eternal love for Polaroid for a minimal contribution and we'll send you an 'I love Polaroid' bumper sticker (to proudly proclaim said love) and add your name to our museum website. $20 --- Become a Founding Member of The Polaroid Museum and we'll hang your favorite photo as a Polaroid Picture with your name on our Founders Wall in the museum. Also includes a commemorative replica of your photo for you to proudly display! (Limited to 5,000)$25 --- EARLY BIRD: Museum Tickets - 4 tickets to The Polaroid Museum. The next time you come to Las Vegas, stop by The Polaroid Museum and "shake it like a Polaroid Picture". (Limited to 250) $50 --- Museum Tickets - 4 tickets to The Polaroid Museum. The next time you come to Las Vegas, stop by The Polaroid Museum and "shake it like a Polaroid Picture". $100 --- 24x30 Polaroid Picture - Indiegogo exclusive, limited-edition 24x30 poster celebrating the establishment of The Polaroid Museum. Includes 2 tickets to the museum. (Limited to 1000)$250 --- VIP Partner - Become our VIP Partner and receive a Polaroid VIP Card which gets you a free lifetime pass to the museum for you and 3 guests, a commemorative founder plaque, your favorite photo as a Polaroid Picture and your name on our Founders Wall. Also includes a signed copy of "Instant: The Story of Polaroid" by Chris Bonanos. (Limited to 1000)$300 --- Polaroid OneStep Camera - Still get the urge to shoot in instant format? (Limited to 50)
